loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Elenita is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase fish nets and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to earn and save enough money expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy plastic bottles for resale.

loans.name: Wilman

texts.en: Wilman is 24 years old and lives near the city of Ibarra. He describes himself as “a little bit fun” and works at making and selling bricks. When he was 15 years old, his father taught him how to make bricks. Now he and his older brother work the brick-making process from start to finish. Wilman reports that his business is going well and that he is seeking this loan to invest in more brick-making material and firewood. He notes that the most improved portion of his life since acquiring his first loan was the economic aspect. In the future, he dreams of having more businesses like a grocery store and a hardware store where he can sell his bricks and work in construction projects.

loans.use: to buy brick-making materials and firewood

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Compone, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila; la socia tiene 38 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, de 10, 8 y 2 años de edad;  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista de compra y venta de verduras, la socia vende zanahorias, cebollas y pasto para cuyes; la socia vende en un stand en el mercado, la socia también desea invertir el crédito en la compra de verduras y paga a su proveedor de poco a poco mientras le dan las verduras según ella va vendiendo, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de verduras para la venta.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “MUJERES EN ACCION” ["Women in Action"] communal bank. The bank is in the Compone district of Anta province, in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Lucila, and she is 38 years old. She has a live-in partner and 3 children, aged 10, 8 and 2. Her work is a retail business, buying and selling vegetables. She sells carrots and onions as well as grass to feed guinea pigs. She sells her products at a stand in the market. She would like to invest the loan in buying vegetables and also paying her provider little by little to continue supplying her with vegetables while she sells them. The borrower is requesting the loan to invest in buying vegetables to sell. 

Lucila is very satisfied and grateful for the support which is being provided to her in this way, and she is committed to paying off her debt on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María es madre D. familia D. 55 años D. edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

María se dedica desD. hace varios años a la crianza y comercialización D. ganado ovino (cuenta con 15 ovejas), su corral es amplio lo tiene a unos minutos D. su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos  naturales, una vez que lleguen a su peso  y tamaño ideal lo ofrece a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga pueD. solventar los gastos D. su hogar.  Tambien cuentacon tierras D. cultivo donD. siembra limón y una vez que cosecha lo comercializa y es otro ingreso que obtiene.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento balanceado para sus animales y fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras, con la finalidad D. que obtenga un buen precio por ambos productos que ofrece y así pueda tener mayores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad D. vida.  María es una persona trabajadora y dedicada a su familia que lo único que quiere es poderles brindar estudios superiores a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria, 55, is a mother who lives with her children in their own home which doesn't have basic services. Their house is located in the district of TambogranD. which is in the department of Piura, an area that is known for agricultural activity, cattle and artisan crafts. 

For some years Maria has raised and sold sheep (she has 15). Her corral is large and located a few minutes from her home. She feeds them balanced food and grasses. Once they reach the ideal weight and size she offers them to her customers and with the income she can cover the costs of her home. She also has farm land where she plants limes which she sells for extra income once they're harvested. 

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevos soles to buy more balanced feed for her animals and fertilizers to improve her land, with the objective of getting a good price for both products and thereby having more profits to improve her quality of life. Maria is hardworking and dedicated to her family. All that she wants is to be able to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers to improve her lands.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Miatta lives in West Point, Liberia. She is 42 years old, married and has two children, 16 and 19 years old. They are in school and live at home. Her husband is a driver. For the past 10 years, she been selling  rice, oil, peppers, onions, and "bitter ball" (an eggplant-like vegetable). One of the problem she faces is the rainy season. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, "bitter ball", peppers, and  onions for her business. Her dream is to send her children to school and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, "bitter ball", peppers, and onions.

loans.name: Iris Anielka

texts.es: La señora Iris Anielka es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella tiene un negocio de pulpería,  por lo que tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicio debido a la necesidad de proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Ella tiene 2 hijos menores a su cargo, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado proporcionarles estudios, alimentos y vestimenta. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, jugos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos. Desea ampliar su inventario aun más para ofrecerles a sus clientes una variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Iris Anielka is a hardworking woman who has managed a general store for more than six years. She started this business so that she could provide her family the necessary income. Iris has two young children under her care, so she invests great effort into providing for their education, food, and clothes.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, juices, bread, detergent, and basic grains. She wants to increase her inventory even more so that she can offer her customers a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, juices, bread, detergent, and basic grains.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old, widowed and has one child, age fifteen.  She has been selling clothes for the last five years making a monthly profit of KES.6,000.

Jane has applied for a loan of KES.20,000 from KADET LTD with which she plans to purchase more stock of  ladies and children clothes for sale.

With the anticipated profit made Jane plans to expand her business and to educate her child to higher levels. She hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes of ladies and children clothes for sale.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a 47-year-old married woman with 4 children. Tessie’s husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Tessie helps her husband plant rice crops on their land. She also raises pigs and sells delicacies to the people in her community. Tessie does all this to support her family. She has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pig feeds. Tessie hopes that through their businesses, they will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pig feeds

loans.name: Phann

texts.en: Growing agricultural crops is the major economic activity for Cambodian people who live in Ornlong Veng District, Odor Meanchey province, Cambodia. One of them is Mrs. Phann, 55, who has been involved in the agricultural business for ages. She is a hardworking woman, covering her family’s need. Mrs. Phann’s husband has the same business as her, and they are working together on their existing farmland. This humble couple is getting more experience from this business activity. From this sector, they can earn about 5 dollars for each day. They are blessed with three children who are living under their roof, all of whom are attending a local school. Phann and her husband have grown mixed crops on her land such as rice, potatoes, corn and other kinds of beans. They planted two months ago but the crops are not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer and crop plague, thus she has decided to request a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticide to keep her crops growing well in good condition. In the future, Mrs. Phann wants to build a larger house, send all of her children to college to become well-educated people, and wishes to have a plowing machine. She says that this fund is very useful for her business sector. This is her first loan with HKL, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticide.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en: Hector is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has five children. Hector has a shop that sells fish, including sardines and mackerel. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell. Hector has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Hector hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Ruben Vicente

texts.es:
Ruben Vicente tiene 49 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo de 22 años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC MONTE DE LOS OLIVOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina conformada por 14 socios y socias. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao.
Ruben se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es que el hijo culmine los estudios.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  jugar futbol y pasear por el campo.
texts.en:
Rubén Vicente, 49, is married and has a son.  He lives with his wife and 22-year-old son in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Monte de los Olivos” communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from this office; it has 14 members, both men and women.  This communal bank’s members are short cycle corn, orange and cocoa bean farmers.

Rubén is a corn, orange and cocoa bean farmer. His sales and his purchases take place in Chillanes Canton.  He’s asking for the loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain his crops in good condition.

The loan will be very helpful because it will improve his quality of life.  The challenges he faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  His dream is that his son completes his schooling.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer and going on excursions through the countryside.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old and lives in the airport community. She is a widow and she did not attend school. 

For the past 25 years she has been selling dried fish in the local market. She likes her business because it makes her independent.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried fish (butter nose fish and cassava fish) for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish (butter nose fish and cassava fish) for her business.

loans.name: Nawab Begum's Group

texts.en:
Nawab begum is 37 years old, she is married and the mother of three daughters and a son. All of her children are continuing their education. Her two elder daughters also do sewing jobs for clients in the neighbourhood in order to contribute financially to the family.

Nawab makes and sells snacks and just loves cooking. The taste of her snacks is very good and she sells a good quantity of snacks every month. Her husband has a job with a low income. 

Nawab has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to expand her snack-selling business. With the loan, she will purchase larger quantities of spices and cooking oil which will allow her to make better-tasting products that she can sell for higher profits. She is an experienced business woman and has been running her business for many years. She is very confident that she will be able to increase her profits as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and spices to make snacks.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria trabaja como artesana en plomería, realizando codos y cajas, las cuales vende en la feria principal de la ciudad de El Alto. Ella está divorciada y tiene dos hijos. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de tubos para continuar fabricando los accesorios de plomería y generar sus ingresos de la venta de los mismos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito y su historial de pagos es excelente. Ana Maria vive en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Maria produces handmade plumbing fittings, such as joints and pump boxes. She sells them at the main fair in the city of El Alto. She is divorced and has two children. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy tubes so that she can continue producing plumbing accessories and generating income from her sales.

This is the second time she has requested a loan and her payment history is excellent. Ana Maria lives in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to buy tubes for making plumbing joints and pump boxes.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, age 35, is a widow with one child who is nine years old. She runs a grocery stall that gives her a monthly income of Kes. 6,200.

This is her second loan with KADET. Jane has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy vegetables, tomatoes, carrots, and onions to sell. Jane hopes to open a wholesale grocery in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes, carrots, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. She owns a retail shop, a business she has run for five years. 

Frida is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase sugar, flours, cereals, and other items to sell. The main challenges she faces are the scarcity and high cost of products. 

She looks forward to setting up a wholesale business in the future. She will use the extra income to open other businesses.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flours, cereals, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 39 years old married to Jacob. They have five children of the following ages: 18, 15, 13, 12, and 10 years respectively. She sells timber and has been in business for thirteen years. Right now her monthly income is KES 10,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of KES 20,000, which she intends to use to purchase more timber for sale. She will repay her loan with the anticipated profit.

loans.use: to purchase timber for sale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel is a married man, 34, who looks after his two young sisters and lives in a rural area with the family. He deals in cattle trading and does farming as a side business. He started his business in 2006. He works 7 days in a week and 14 hours per day. He started his business to increase the family's income and to provide a better standard of living for his family. He acquired this loan to buy more cows to fatten. His clients are cattle traders from the cities. His hope for the future is to increase his stock and to have some children. The challenge he faces is diseases that lead to the death of cows and   reduces the profits he earns. He is grateful for the services the lenders offer that enable people and their communities to develop..

loans.use: To buy more cows

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 49 years old and has three children. Cresencia is married and has three children who are in school.

Cresencia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Cresencia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cresencia has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a very entrepreneurial person, that is why she began her business a year and a half ago, a grocery store. She is very happy because she has met several people, her clients have increased as well as the sales, but her clients suggest her to sell different products and with this she could increase the number of clients and sales, that is why she is soliciting a loan of $1,500.00 which she expects to pay in a term of 1 year.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Irma es una persona muy emprendedora por lo cual inicio su negocio hace un año y medio, en el area D. abarrotes, esta muy contenta porque a conocido a mucha gente, sus clientes han incrementado y L. venta tambien pero sus clientes le sugieren que venda diferentes productos y con esto podria incrementar aun el numero D. clientes y con ello las ventas por lo que solicita un prestamo D. $1500.00 dllrs y pagarlo en un plazo D. 1 año.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Segundo

texts.en:
Segundo is a rice farmer from Santa Lucia in rural Ecuador. He has two children who are 5 and 7 years old. He has been working his lands for about 20 years. Although he does not have much land, it is enough to make ends meet for his family. Segundo also brings in money by raising pigs. He travels to local markets to sell the livestock when ever he is in need of extra money.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Segundo is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen runs her own business selling basic household goods. The business is well-located, being the only one in her area and therefore enjoys high sales. She began her business when she immigrated with her entire family to the province of Manabi due to the El Niño phenomenon. With the help of her husband, she sold vegetables to area residents. She currently sells all types of groceries, basic household products and foodstuffs. Carmen is seeking the loan because she has realized the need to purchase products at wholesale prices due to the increase in her clientele. Being a visionary, she also wants to put up a bazaar; there is a school near her house and her customers have requested it. Carmen is sure that with the improvements she makes to the business along with the purchase of additional merchandise, she can improve her and her family's living conditions. Carmen is 33 years old and has 3 children, 2 of whom attend school.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Carmen tiene su negocio de venta de articulos de primera necesidad que tiene buena ubicacion pues es la unica en su sector y por lo tanto beneficia de buenas ventas. Ella comenzo su negocio cuando inmigro con toda su familia de la provincia de Manabi por causa del fenomeno del Niño. Con la ayuda de su esposo vendían legumbres a las persona que viven alrededor. Actualmente venden toda clase de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad y de consumo diario. La Sra. Carmen necesita el credito pues ha notado la necesidad de comprar los productos al por mayor pues su clientela ha aumentado y como es visionaria quiere poner ademas un bazar por que hay una escuela cerca de su casa y sus clientes han solicitado, Carmen esta segura de que con los arreglos que realice a su negocio y la compra de mas mercaderia ella podra mejorar las condiciones en las que viven ella y su familia. Carmen tiene 33 años y 3 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos estudian

loans.use: Purchase wholesale products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her charcoal-selling business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Sra. Juliana and Sr. Teodolfo Blanco are married with two boys. They are living in Barrio Santa Rosa, Paraguay. Teodolfo works as the foreman of a company in the region of Ybycuí and Juliana owns a small store in their community. Thanks to the efforts of the two they have been able to buy their own house and provide for their two school-aged boys. Juliana began her business as a way to supplement the income of the family. From her own house Juliana runs a small store in which she sells basic staples to people in her neighborhood.

Juliana began her business with what little capital her husband was able to set aside for her. Little by little Juliana began to acquire products such as sugar, rice, noodles and oil which are available in her store. In this way Juliana has been able to help maintain their house and put her boys through school.

Juliana wishes to use her loan to acquire a refrigerator allowing her to offer a greater selection of merchandise as well as better quality goods. In the interest of growing her business Juliana has asked for this loan.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (rice, sugar, flour)

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: Shavkat has loved raising sheep since childhood. He has been engaged in the livestock business for over 5 years now. Shavkat is married and has 3 children. His family is friendly and his wife helps him in his business activities. Currently he has five sheep and plans to purchase fodder for his animals. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of US$ 200.

loans.use: Purchasing fodder for sheep.

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es:
Mrs. C. has built and now runs a small grocery store in the neighborhood of Las Moritas.  Beginning with very little she has slowly built the business up by reinvesting her profits.  The location is a busy one and Mrs. C. believes that with a little more investment in the goods her customers desire, the shop will succeed.   Translated by a Kiva volunteer.  
La Sra. C. posee una  tienda que a construido con esfuerzos propios ,en la colonia las Moritas .
Según comenta ella  inicio su negocio con poco pero a podido ir incrementando su negocio ,con lo poco que le queda  D. ganancia, el negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado por lo cual eso le genero la inquietud D. querer invertir mas y a si poder ofrecer otros productos que los clientes buscan.

loans.use: To stock a small grocery store with such things as soft drinks and grains.

location.town: Col. Las Moritas Calle 17 de Mayo pasaje H #16 Lou

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng S., 32, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She stays at home, cooking food and looking after her little kids, while her husband works buying and selling wood, earning around $23/day in revenue.

Mrs. Seng S. would like to use this loan to purchase four water buffaloes to breed for additional income as now the price of buffaloes is growing steadily.

loans.use: To buy four water buffaloes to breed for additional profit

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Lydia M.. She is widowed and has five children, aged between 14 and 22.

In 2001, Lydia established a livestock business. Lydia has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now she requires a new loan in order to purchase additional chicks to raise and sell. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially among SELFINA clients. "Kuku" means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital--clients can start with one or two and either add to their stock or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can be either sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Huk

texts.en: Mrs. Huk O., 43, sells rice (rice with variety of foods), eventually earns around $2 a day of profit. Her husband Mr. Kong Srang, 50, is a well maker (he digs to make  wells) in his village and makes on average $5 a day of profit. They have four children, one of who is married and lives away from home. The other children are students. To help his business grow, he needs to purchase tools (this equipment is use to dig the well). (A mother of Mrs. Huk O. is pictured because Mrs. Huk O. and her husband were not available).

loans.use: To purchase tools to be used to dig a well

loans.name: La Alianza Group

texts.en:
Carmen is a busy woman, raising three children (ages: 16, 18, and 23) in the town of San Pedro D. Macoris. This will be her second loan with Esperanza, and with her first she started making money by driving people around on a moped that she bought. It operates like a taxi, and she makes about $1 per riD.. This loan will help with repairs, gas, and maybe another moped for her oldest child to start working with her. She said that her ambitions for the future are to continue pursuing growth for both herself and her children. Eventually she wants to buy an old car so that she can drive several people around at a time, and increase her profits.

Oh behalf of Esperanza, thank you for your support of this group! God Bless.

loans.use: For repairs and purchase of a moped

loans.name: José Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto is 48 years old, married and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. He has one son who is 14 years old. His wife works as a maid in a private home and helps the family with household expenses.

Ernesto started his mechanical rides business with a family inheritence and he has 15 years of experience. It is difficult when there is no electricity.

He wants this loan to make improvements to his home and plans to enclose a room with plaster-covered brick. He will also build a wall.

His plans are to refurbish and modernize the mechanical rides, be more organized and to help his son get ahead so he can be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Ernesto tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad, su esposa trabaja en una casa particular como domestica, y apoya a la familia en los gastos del hogar.

El negocio del Sr. Ernesto son Juegos mecánicos, que comenzó de una herencia familiar, la experiencia que ha tenido es de quince años. Las dificultades se dan cuando no hay energía eléctrica.

Este préstamo lo quiere para mejoras de su vivienda por que quiere enladrillar un cuarto ,repellarlo y también hacer un muro. Sus planes son renovar los juegos mecánicos y modernizarlos, estar más organizados y también apoyar a su hijo a salir adelante para que sea un profesional.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make home improvements

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Señor Rafael Antonio is dedicated to the business of selling basic grains which he markets in the municipality of Somotillo for the purpose of improving the conditions of his humble home which he has the duty of maintaining.

He is a father of two children who he must maintain and offer the necessary conditions for their development. The problem that he faces nowadays is that, because he does not possess the economic resources, he has sought support from CEPRODEL for a loan for the purchase of the basic grains which will permit him to market them in his sector in the municipality of Somotillo of the city of Chinandega of the beautiful country of Nicaragua.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Rafael Antonio se dedica al negocio de venta de granos básicos los cuales los comercializa en el municipio de Somotillo con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su humilde hogar de habitación el cual tiene el deber de mantener.

Es padre de dos hijos los cuales debe de mantener y brindarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. El problema que hoy en día atraviesa es que al no poseer el recurso económico, ha buscado apoyo en CEPRODEL para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita la compra de estos granos básicos para comercializarlos en su sector en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega del bello país de Nicaragua.

loans.use: To buy grains for sale in the market.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of M. A., and they live in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, and they have been living in this house for the last 16 years. She is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. All of her daughters are in kindergarten. Her husband runs a cafeteria. She has already successfully repaid two previous loans she received from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and she is now applying for a third loan for her husband so that he may expand his cafe business.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Asia baji, who seeks a loan to diversify her grocery shop; (2) Zainab baji, who requests a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle); and (3) Khursheed baji, who is in need of a loan to buy animals to resell.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing grocery products, a rickshaw, and animals)

loans.name: Mamodu's Group

texts.en:
These teachers are from the Benevolent Islamic Secondary School in Makeni. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000. They want this loan for various reasons. Mamodu B., 27, would like to invest his in business. Mamodu is an assistance teacher and has been teaching for the past two years now.

Alhassan A. F. would like to use his to purchase building materials. Alhassan is 37 and married with 4 children. He has been in the teaching profession for the past 14 years now.

Alimany K. will use his to purchase pieces of furniture. He is 40 and married with 2 children. Alimany has 17 years of experience in the teaching field.

Alhaji J. will invest his in business. Alhaji is married with 1 child.

loans.use: Buy top-up cards and phone accessories

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte O. is 38 years old. She is a wife and the mother of three kids. Charlotte O. is very resourceful in providing food and paying bills for her family. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey and fish with pepper. She sells kenkey in the mornings and in the afternoon and evening. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has a very strong customer base since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called St. Paul's Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45 year old Salama Abdulrahma from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children, between the ages of 22 and 28.

Salama has been running a cosmetics shop since 2006. Her business is doing well. She works at it for twelve hours a day, six days per week, and currently earns about $400. She is requesting a loan of $725 to purchase additional supplies of cosmetics for her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Salama thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies of cosmetics.

loans.name: Miryan

texts.es:
La Sra. Miryan tiene 44años de edad, está  casada hace  22 años, con  Jorge Sánchez con tiene 3 hijos de 18, 9 y 7 años  de edad respectivamente, la hija mayor ya está trabajando y los menores están en edad escolar.
Su esposo  trabaja  como cajero en un restaurante en el centro y aporta económicamente en la casa.
Viven en casa propia en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, en donde la Sra. Miryan tiene una casilla y los fines de semanas elabora comestibles para vender como: hamburguesas sándwich de milanesas, de jamón y queso, también vende gaseosas, cervezas y en el verano tiene venta de helados.
 Cuenta que  de lunes a viernes trabaja hace 20 años en una panadería familiar en donde se elaboran panificados exclusivos de los Mennonitas (descendientes alemanes), cuenta que allí aprendió  la elaboración de masitas, confites y panificados.
 Nos dice además que el crédito es muy útil para ella porque le permite acceder a mayores mercaderías, y en este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas, helados, y además en la reparación del techo de su casa, ya que llega la época de mucho calor  y necesita un poco mas de ambiente fresco para la elaboración de su comestibles.
texts.en:
Señora Miryan is 44 years old. She has been married for 22 years to Jorge Sánchez. They have three children,18, 9, and 7 years of age respectively. The eldest daughter is already working; the younger children are still in school. Her husband works as a cashier in a restaurant in the central business area, and supports the home economically. They live in their own home in the city of Villa Elisa, where Miryan has a hut and on the weekends she makes food to sell like hamburger, milanesas (thin breaded cutlets of meat) sandwiches, ham and cheese sandwiches, and she also sells soda pop, beers, and in the summer she sells ice cream. She has been able to work Monday through Friday for the past 20 years in a family bakery where she makes exclusive Mennonite (of German decent) baked goods. She has learned to make corn snacks, comfits, and other baked goods. She says that credit is very useful for her because it allows her to gain access to the best markets, and that this loan would be invested in the purchase of soft drinks, ice creams, and also for the repair of the roof of her home, as the season of intense heat has arrived and she needs a little more fresh air in order to make her food.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks, ice creams, and to repair the roof of Miryan's house

loans.name: Onyekachi

texts.en: Onyekachi O. owns a store where he sells rechargeable phones and phones accessories. He is 27 years old and single. He hopes to get married soon. Onyekachi travels to Lagos and Onitsha to purchase rechargeable phones and phone accessories to sell in Benin City. He requests a $275 loan to purchase more rechargeable phones and accessories. He says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phones and phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en:
Chhean Y., 33, is a rice farmer who also sells a little grocery from her house. She currently earns revenue of $4 a day to support her family’s living and especially her kid’s foods. She has been running her business for nine years, thus now she has a lot of customers to buy her wares. She is married with two children, both of whom are teenagers and attending school. The family lives in Pursat Province.

Chhean Y.'s husband, Soung Vuthy, 32, is a primary teacher who also raises animals including pigs and cows for selling. With growing business of her husband, and to increase the family's income, Y. would like to request a loan for her husband to buy more piglets and a cow to breed.

The picture shows Y.'s husband because Y. was not available for the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and a cow to breed.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Ana  tiene 40 años,  ella vive en la casa de sus padres, ella estudio administración de empresas pero lo dejo por falta de dinero, los pago de sus pensiones eran muy altos y no podía pagarlos consiguió trabajo  en una empresa “Proseguros” por varios años, lamentablemente  dejo el trabajo por que su mama le dio derrame cerebral, no había quien la cuide, su Papa es jubilado pero trabaja en construcción, una vez que su mama estaba mejor de salud empezó  nuevamente a trabajar como secretaria, pero al tiempo a la mama de Ana le da nuevamente le da otro derrame cerebral, Ana tuvo nuevamente que dejar de trabajar para cuidar a su mama, pero esta vez  con sus ahorros se compro un carro, en cual en la actualidad lo alquila  y se dedico a la venta de productos de bellaza por catalogo y a la venta de zapatos por Catalogo, desde hace ocho años. hace un año se acaba de casar. 
Desde que esta en Finca ella a crecido como micro empresaria con Finca pudo ahorrar hasta comprarse su carro, las charlas que a recibido han sido de mucho beneficio para ella.

Necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, que los va invertir en  pintar su carro y algunos arreglos que el carro necesita.
El sueño que tiene Ana  es quedar embarazada, quiere tener su hija, se esta sometiendo a tratamientos fertilización, es caro pero ella se esfuerza trabajando  y con la ayuda de Dios vera su sueño hecho realidad.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre. Ana is 40 years old and lives in her parents' house. She studied business administration but was forced to give it up for lack of funds. The school fees were very high and she was unable to pay them. She found work in the company Proseguros and was there several years. Unfortunately she had to leave her job because her mother suffered a brain hemorrhage and had no one to take care of her. Her father is retired but works in construction. Once her mother's health had improved, Ana began to work again as a secretary, but in time her mother suffered another brain hemorrhage and she was forced to leave her job in order to care for her mother. This time she used her savings to buy a car, which she now rents out. For eight years she has worked selling beauty products and shoes from catalogs. She got married a year ago. Since she's begun working with Finca she's grown a lot as a small-business owner. Finca made it possible for her to save up and buy her car, and the advice she's received has been very useful for her. She needs a loan of 1600 soles, which she will use to paint her car and do some needed repairs. Ana's dream is to become pregnant and have a daughter. She is undergoing fertility treatments. They are expensive but she works hard and with God's help will see her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Painting and repairing her car

loans.name: María Alicia

texts.es:
La señora María Alicia U. M. tiene 36 años, vive en el sector Víctor Raúl del distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio hasta 2do de secundaria, abandonó los estudios debido a que sus padres no la quisieron apoyar y se dedicó al negocio, tiene 03 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella. 
María tiene una bodega, se inicio en el negocio vendiendo en la puerta de su casa frutas, galletas y mazamorra, poco a poco fue implementando su bodega con abarrotes, gaseosas y ahora cuenta con una bodega surtida, también compro una mesita de fulbito. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres  del Milenium”, lo invirtió en la compra de una mesa de fulbito.
Con este crédito de 400 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su bodega.
Maria sueña con tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María Alicia U. M. is 36 years old and resides in Víctor Raúl, in the county of El Porvenir, in Trujillo province, in La Libertad, Perú. She completed her education through the second year of secondary school. Then she left school because her parents did not want to support her, and and went into business. She has three children who depend entirely on her for support. Maria has a small grocery store. She began her business by selling fruits, cookies, and crackers from her front door. Gradually, she turned into a real grocery store by adding various snacks, carbonated beverages, and now she even has a stocked wine cellar. She also bought a foosball table. She runs her store out of her own home. With her first loan of 300 soles from the Communal Bank "Women of the Millennium," she purchased the foosball table. With this loan of 400 soles, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase groceries for her shop. Maria dreams of owning her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her shop

loans.name: Bron's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group of five borrowers. K. is 25 years old and is the mother of one young child. She is married to Sokhov, age 35, who runs a bicycle and motorbike repair service in front of his house. K. owns a general store where she sells cooked ingredients, kid's sweets, and plastic and tin containers to the whole community. 

Because her store is located in the middle of a busy street, K. can sell many products every day. She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor. To meet her family's demands, she has recently planned to increase her income based on her selling. Therefore, K. is taking a loan to buy more ingredients and more products for her store. The loan will benefit her business. 

There are four other members of the loan group. M., age 22, owns a small grocery store front of his house. He is looking a loan to buy more cooked ingredients for his store. N., age 47, owns a shop where she sells breakfast food. She is taking a loan to renovate her shop. P., age 29, is a motor taxi driver who is applying for a loan to buy a new motor because his old motor is broken very often. P., age 31, is a furniture maker who is looking for a loan to buy a electric machine for his home. 

Mr. M. and Mr. P. were not available when the photograph was taken so their wives appear in the photograph instead.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients and more products for her store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria T. is thirty eight years old and is a married mother of four children. According to Victoria, her children are still in school. The oldest is in senior high school and the remaining are in junior high school and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Although her husband is employed, she still needs to work to make additional income to support the family.

Victoria is a food vendor that runs a ‘chop bar’. Chop bar is a restaurant where local dishes are mostly served. She sells local foods such as ‘fufu’ (from pounded cooked cassava), ‘banku’ (from cooked corn dough), and many other local dishes. She procures the items and ingredients from the wholesalers in her community. She has been in business for twelve years. Victoria would like a loan to procure more goods and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business. She aspires to give her children the best education she can afford to provide.

loans.use: To procure cassava, plantain and food ingredients.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thi O. is a 37 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, O. works in a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  O. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, O. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  O. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  O. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by O. from TYM Fund.  O. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Short Street Strikers Group

texts.en:
Those pictured are Zainab T., Mohamed P. K., Alhaji B., Ibrahim J. and Aminata S.. They named their group Short Street Strikers, named after the street where the group leader sells. They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. 

They are requesting a loan to enable them to buy more goods to sell. With more goods at their disposal, they will be able to make more profit and improve on their livelihood. 

Zainab T. (front row left) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-three years old and a widow with three children.  All of her children are still in primary school. Zainab pays their school fees and also feeds and clothes them with the little profit she makes out of her business. With this loan her profit margin will increase and her living situation will improve.  Zainab sells soft drinks and “rubber drinks” (novelty coasters), cold water, and gari (food made out of cassava). She has been in this business for three years. She will invest this new loan on the same business because she is familiar with these types of items and can do well with them.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and invest in the gari business.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean de Dieu U.! He is 28 years old and is single and no dependents. He lives in the Gasabo district of the city of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Jean de Dieu owns a shop where he sells a variety of items in retail. He is seeking his first loan in the amount of 500,000 Rwf from Kiva lenders, but it is his second with Vision Finance Company to be paid back in 12 months. His first loan was in the amount of 300,000 Rwf.

He started his shop six years ago and has two full-time employees to help him run his business. He opens for business at 6 a.m. and closes at 10 p.m.

He used to earn a monthly profit of approximately $110. With this loan, he intends to expand his business, and expects increased profits from this investment. He will reinvest these in his business with the goal of acquiring more savings.

loans.use: To expand his retail shop business

loans.name: Amam Group

texts.en:
This is the Amam group, led by Amam. There are five members in this group and they would like to expand their businesses. They are requesting a group of loan 50,000 Afghani.

Amam wants to receive a loan for his general store.

Zakara wants to receive a loan for her bakery.

Parwe and Khare Gul wants to take a loan for their husbands who have fruit and vegetables shops.

Najeba wants to take a loan for the business of a clothes-selling shop.

They are happy about this process of loans that can support the entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To support his general store

loans.name: Izatullo

texts.en:
E. Izatullo has a butcher shop and has been running a meat-selling business for 10 years. He provides the markets with meat and his family with food. Izatullo is 40 years old and married with four children. He is requesting a loan of $3,000 US. This micro entrepreneur is qualified to receive this loan considering the profitability of his business, his determination, and his experience. Izatullo is counting on your help. Your support will really help him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Sayad Hasyan Group

texts.en:
S. Hasyan is the group leader of the S. Hasyan group. There are three members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for his/her own business.

Pary Gull wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving. She wants to buy the necessary materials for her business. Toba wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to expand her business. S. Hasan wants to take a loan for his business of health services. He wants to make his shop larger. They are very happy with these loans to Afghanistan.

They want to say that these loans are very useful because they can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses and become stronger in business and in life. This group appreciates this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: Make their businesses larger

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis M. tiene 55 años de edad, está casado con la señora Cristina. El mismo posee una parada de taxi propia donde trabaja como taxista hace 3 años aproximadamente, también realiza trabajos para varias municipalidades como contratista de obras hace 11 años.
Su esposa lo ayuda en los trabajos del hogar junto a una de sus hijas, en total tiene 4 hijos, 2 de los cuales viajaron hace varios años a España en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, hoy en día los mismos consiguieron afirmarse logrando empleo y formar su propia familia en dicho país, mientras que el ultimo hijo lo ayuda en la parada de taxi cuando el señor Luis tiene trabajos que atender como contratista de obras. 
El préstamo que solicita es para reparar e innovar algunas partes descompuestas o viejas de su vehiculo que utiliza como taxi.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis M. is 55 years old and married to Sra. Cristina. He has operated his own taxi service for 3 years and also works as a contractor for several municipalities, which he has done for the past 11 years.

His wife and one of his daughters help with the housework. He has four children in total, two of which have traveled to Spain some time ago in search of a better life. Today, they have secured employment and started their own families abroad. Meanwhile, the youngest child helps with the taxi service whenever Sr. Luis is working on a contractor job.

The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for repairs on his taxi since some of the parts are old and have decomposed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Marlon Jose

texts.es: El señor Marlon José Velásquez Reynosa, tiene la edad de 46 años habita en  el barrio, buenos aires, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales, desde hace 19 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , él inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , el préstamo lo quiere para la comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y lograr una buena cosecha. Lo cual será de muchos beneficios para sastifacer los gastos de su familia. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Marlon José Velásquez Reynosa is 46 years old and lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood, which located in the town of Ticuantepe. Both he and his wife work and support one another with the household expenses. They have 3 children. Their future plans include improving their living conditions and supporting their children so that they can become professionals.

Sr. Marlon has worked as a farmer for 19 years. His greatest challenge has been a lack of financing. He began farming with the help of his parents. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase fertilizers and supplies so that he can cultivate his crops for a good harvest, which will enable him to cover his family expenses. He thanks the Institution for making it possible for him to develop his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & farming supplies

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.en:
H. Ahmadjon is from the district of Kostakoz, Tajikistan. Currently, he dedicates himself to his livestock business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region. He is the father of three children whom he cares for and has the responsibility of educating. His wife (pictured) actively helps him with operations. It’s important to note that Ahmadjon is very conscious of his duty to support his family financially. It’s for this reason that he turned to IMON International to obtain a loan to purchase some pregnant cows to help him increase his income. With your help, Ahmadjon will be able to make his business succeed and support his family. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Erick Antonio

texts.es: El joven Erick M. de 29 años de edad, labora en la cooperativa de transporte urbano de la capital de Managua, el cual desde los 19 años comenzó a trabajar ya que se caso a temprana edad, su esposa le tiene dos hijos y reside en el barrio Camilo Ortega, cuando comenzó a trabajar empezó como ayudante cobrando, lo cual ganaba menos pero logro poder ser el conductor, es un trabajo agitado ya que desde horas muy temprana sale de su casa, y da como diez vuelta en toda la capital, para poder ganar bien el día. Este es su sexto ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara materiales de construcción para hacer más grande un cuarto y poder estar cómodo junto a su familia, pues poco a poco ha  logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa. Y su anhelo es poder algún día tener su propia unidad de transporte mediante un financiamiento. Da las gracias a la institución por aprobar el préstamo el cual comenzara con su proyecto.
texts.en:
Erick M., 29, works in an urban transportation cooperative in the capital of Managua. He started working there when he was 19. He married at an early age; he and his wife have two children. He lives in the Camilo Ortega neighborhood. When he started working he was a helper collecting fees. He earned less doing this, but he was able to become a driver. It is hectic work because he leaves his house very early and does about ten routes around the city to be able to earn well in a day. This is his sixth cycle with Afodenic. He will use the loan to buy construction materials to enlarge a room and be able to be more comfortable with his family. Little by little he has made improvements on his house. His goal is to one day be able to, through loans, have his own vehicle for transportation. He is grateful to the institution for approving the loan, which he will use to start his project.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to enlarge a room

loans.name: Abduhalim

texts.en:
Abduhalim is married with a three children. He had to find a way to support his family and that is how he ended up as a taxi driver. He owns a car and provides transportation services throughout Khujand, Tajikistan. The business is the only source of income for his family. Abduhalim works very hard, sometimes without days off or vacation, in order to bring in enough income. Abduhalim has been in this business for 3 years. His determination and strong will to succeed have helped him keep his business stable and sustainable and have promoted its expansion. Abduhalim would like to get a loan for $2600 USD in order to replace his car with the new one. With that way he will improve his business and earn more money by attracting more clients. We are confident that the modesty, diligence and responsibility that have helped Abduhalim develop his venture and gain a good reputation among other taxi drivers will help him promptly repay this loan and allow him to succeed in his business endeavors. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a new car for improving business

loans.name: Massaja E Namuyomba Aisha Group

texts.en: N. Aisha is a hardworking businesswoman. She is twenty-nine years old and married with three school-age children. She has been operating a restaurant business for seven years. She wants to use the loan to purchase a fridge and utensils in order to add capital to her business. She hopes for improvement in her business. She wants to obtain a house and a car and to provide an education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge and utensils in order to add capital to her business

loans.name: Aleja

texts.en:
Aleja T. is a 69-year-old self-supporting woman and a wonderful grandmother to her grandchildren. At her age, a vision of giving herself things she didn’t have in her earlier years, as well as being a financial support to her child in raising her grandchildren, inspire her to grow her business. She wants to increase her store's earnings for her vision to come true; thus, she has requested a loan through ASHI.

Throughout Aleja’s membership in ASHI, she has proven her integrity by paying back on time and keeping her business in existence. Moreover, she wants her membership to last while she lives, and until her dreams are reached, not only for herself, but also for the rest of her group mates and co-members in the ASHI center. She wants to set an example to other women, that with loans through MFIs, poverty can possibly be abolished if a person is determined and persistent in achieving their dreams in life.

loans.use: To increase inventory of goods in her variety store

loans.name: Daniel Mungui

texts.en:
Daniel is married to Judy and they have three children. Their children, Elizabeth, Shine and Christine, are ten, six and two years old, respectively.

Daniel was introduced to KADET by existing groups and he is requesting his second loan. His primary source of income is rental rooms but he also has been running a retail shop for eight years. The client's area of business is densely populated with middle class residents as the main customers. He has applied for a loan, which he will use to add to the milk that he supplies to other shops in his area of business. With the extra profits, Daniel will purchase another plot of land and build more rental rooms. 

Daniel hopes to expand his business from retail to the wholesale level and he describes himself as  determined, hardworking and focused.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase the stock of milk supply.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 35 and is married with three children aged 7 and 14 years. All her children go to school. She resides in a two-room house that she owns and lives in with four people. Eva takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and no piped water and gets three meals a day.

She incurs transport costs in buying foodstuffs in Nakawa market, one of the busiest places in Kampala city. Eva has a restaurant and sells all types of food, like chips and traditional food. She works in Nakawa market and pays 25,000/= as rent and 1,000/= as daily market dues. She works in a semi-urban area that is in the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people.

Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees for her children, and the monthly rent for her business. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the rainy season, which hinders her from reaching her customers. She has been in this business for four years and with Micro Credit for Development and Transformation (MCDT) for five years. She is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. Eva joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more foodstuffs like Irish potatoes and bunches of bananas. She wants to see her business grow bigger and she would like to start a full hotel offering outside catering.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Joseph Okero

texts.en: Joseph runs a general shop, where he sells household goods to residents and walk-ins at Mukuru kwa Njenga, a slum area.  He has been in this business for the last three years.  His faces the business challenge of lack of funds to restock the goods sold.  He will use the requested loan of KES30,000 to buy more of the goods sold at the shop.  In the future, he wants to expand the business and be a wholesaler.  Joseph is married and has a three year old daugther.  He describes himself as hardworking, honest and dedicated to his work.

loans.use: To add stock of household goods.

loans.name: Oghenekume

texts.en:
Oghenekume lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old and married to a commercial driver. She is LAPO client. The Lift above poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. 

She is a fashion designer and she makes lovely designs for her customers. She has been in this business for 7 years. She also sells sarongs. Oghenekume is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase a sewing machine and also more supplies of sarongs. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and supplies of sarongs to sell

loans.name: Humberto Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Humberto José Téllez T., Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene  cinco hijos a su cargo, y cuatro se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado siete créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, clavos, para su casa de habitación por lo que este se encuentra en mal estado.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Humberto dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una vivienda más segura.
texts.en:
Mr. Humberto José Téllez T. works as a janitor in the Mayoreo (wholesale) Market in Managua; he is married and has 5 children under his responsibility, 4 of them are of school age. He has had seven loans with CEPRODEL in 7 years; during this period of time he has invested some loans to improve the house where he lives and he is thankful for the loans granted by CEPRODEL. The requested loan will be invested in buying construction materials such as roofing material and nails since his house is in poor condition and needs repairs; his objective is to provide more safety and a better quality of life for his children. Humberto said that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL he has benefited much since he now has a safer house.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements and additions

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 35-year-old married man. He has five children who still go to school. He has owned a car repair shop in his town since 2001 and has 18 years of experience in this field. In addition to repairing cars, he also does car painting. He receives a good number of clients in his shop, which is situated in a large depot. Today, Rabih is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more spare parts and car paint to meet the requirements of his clients and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and car paint

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es:
María Jesus es soltera, tiene 21 años de edad y vive junto a sus padres y sus hermanos menores en el sector El Romero del distrito de Mórrope, una zona rural ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Al igual que la mayoría de pobladores de la zona se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Ella cría pavos desde hace cuatro años y los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona constantemente, este negocio le brinda los recursos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a la economía del lugar, ya que su padre trabaja como agricultor y su madre confecciona alforjas y los que ambos perciben no es suficiente para mantener a la familia.

María Jesús desea mejorar la calidad de los animales que cría para poder venderlos a mejor precio, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una jovencita responsable y bastante trabajadora. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y cariño. En la imagen aparace junto a los pavos que está criando.
texts.en:
María Jesus, 21, is single and lives with her parents and younger siblings in the El Romero sector of Mórrope district; this is a rural area located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. As most of the residents of this area, she raises small farm animals. She has raised turkeys for the last four years and sells them to merchants who constantly visit the area. This business provides her with the necessary resources to meet her personal expenses and to help out with the family economy because, although her father works as a farmer and her mother makes knapsacks, what they earn together is still insufficient to support the family. María Jesús hopes to improve the quality of the animals she raises to that she can sell them for a better price. For this reason, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan to help her meet this objective. She is a responsible and very hard-working young lady. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high regard. In the photo, she appears with the turkeys she is raising.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced turkey feed.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Savoeun S., 38 and his wife, Mrs. Botum Um, 29, (pictured together) have been married since 2000 and just have a young son who attends school. Besides his son, Savoeun also has his elderly mother living with him. They live about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

The couple has two lines of business: (1) raising pigs and (2) producing rice wine. Savoeun hopes to expand his business to make it bigger so that he will be able to generate more income as well. So, he is asking for his first loan of $300 to purchase rice to produce more rice wine.

loans.use: To purchase rice to produce more rice wine

loans.name: Janifer

texts.en:
Janifer is a 74-year-old widow with eight adult children. She has been farming for over 50 years in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. She sells a wide variety of produce at the local market, including potatoes, maize and beans, while she also earns income from her ownership of a few rental homes. She says that there remains a number of challenges in her farming, including high costs of production and high feed prices for animals. 

Janifer has a successful history with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo, recently completing a loan for 32,100 Kenyan shillings. She has now requested this loan for 62,400 shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. As Janifer has all adult children, she says that the extra income from this loan will help her support her grandchildren in some ways, but the proceeds will mainly be used for philanthropic activities in her church, helping the needy in her area. 

In the future, Janifer hopes that her business will be big enough to help other people in the community. She hopes to provide employment opportunities to more than 10 people in the next few years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es: María Lourdes F. D. C. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento D. Morazán. Vive junto a sus tres hijos D. 16, 14 y 6 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una panadería en la cual se encarga D. elaborar pan dulce y pan tipo baguette. La panadería está ubicada en su propia casa, lugar en el cual no posee ningún tipo D. competencia, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes. María es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza a diario por brindarles todo lo necesario a sus tres hijos, ya que ella es madre soltera y por esta razón debe esforzarse en gran manera.
