Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, miel, azúcar, y todos los elementos necesarios para la elaboración del pan.
texts.en:
María Lourdes F. D. C. is 35 years old and lives in San Francisco Goteras, located in the Morazán department. She lives together with her 3 children - 16, 14 and 6 years of age, who all study. María has a bakery where she makes sweet bread and bread such as baguettes. The bakery is located in her own house, in an area where there is no competition, so owing to this she has many customers. María is a very hard-working woman who works hard every day to give her children everything they need. She is a single mother and for this reason must work very hard. María is seeking a loan with which to buy flour, honey, sugar, and all the ingredients necessary to make bread.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make bread

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Adom Ahenwa Trust Group

texts.en:
Kenneth is a hard-working man and resourceful on behalf of his family. He is married to a petty trader who sells cereals and together they have four children who are from age 2-12. He is also a trader who purchases brand-new motorcycles from importers and sells them to customers. Motorcycles are one of the most common means of transport in the middle and northern parts of Ghana, hence selling motorcycles is a lucrative job for traders. He also purchases cows from the northern part of the country and sells them to butchers and restaurant operators.  Kenneth and his wife want to make sure they are financially able to support all their children through university education.

Kenneth is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “Adom Ahenwa”, (translated as 'The Seat of Grace'), made up of nine members. The other members are engaged in trades such as manufacturing, baking, grocery sales, used clothing sales etc. They are the major bread winners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. Their common dream is to be financially self sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase motorbikes and cow for resale

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie P. is from the village of Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 22 years old. Lanie is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Lanie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Lanie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $150 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Lanie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Lanie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which again will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Barikama Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Barikama sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des relations de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le marché de Bagadadji. 
Elles font le commerce de spaghetti,  de riz, de savons, de pagnes wax et brodés. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de faire leurs achats au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles  sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kadia D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 300 cartons de savons de marque Sama (Éléphant) contenant chacun 12 morceaux. 
Elle se ravitaille en savon avec les fabricants de Bamako qui font des produits de très bonne qualité d’après elle-même. Elle les revend en détail au comptant et à crédit à domicile, au marché de Bagadadji parfois et en ambulant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Kadia D. à l’instar des autres femmes du groupe espère avoir un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner et prendre en charge les petits besoins de la famille en condiments. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’ouvrir des magasins de vente de leurs marchandises dans leur quartier dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women of the Barikama group are married and mostly live in monogamous families. They are on average 44 years old, with four children and live in the Bagadadji quarter of Ségou (the fourth largest administrative region in Mali), and met through neighbours and their revenue-generating businesses in the Bagadadji market. They sell spaghetti, rice, soap, wax cloths and embroideries. In order to increase their business funds and to purchase goods by cash, the group members have called upon Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their third loan. Madame Kadia D. aims to use this loan to purchase 300 boxes of Sama (Éléphant) soap, each containing 12 bars. She replenishes her soap stock through Bamako suppliers who, in her opinion, make good quality soap. She sells these for cash and credit through home sales, sometimes at the Bagadadji market and sometimes door-to-door sales, to a customer base of men and women. Madame Kadia D., like the other women in the group, hopes to generate an average monthly profit of 35000 FCFA which she would save and use to meet her family's modest needs. The women would like to open stores in order to sell their wares in their local quarter, thanks to a partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase soap

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan P., 35, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products.

P. buys rice for resale and earns an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a civil servant at the commune hall, earning an income of about USD 4 per day.

P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more rice to add to her stock and also to repair her house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her business. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more rice to add to her stock and to repair her house

loans.name: Babara's Group

texts.en:
Babara lives in a city called Lahore, famous in Pakistan for its historical places and Punjabi foods, with her family. Her husband is a tailor; he stitches men’s clothes while Babara stitches women's clothes. She has a son who is getting an education. Babara wants to make him a doctor, that’s why she works very hard to afford his education expenses. 

Babara is very much worried about her family’s financial future. That’s why she wants to expand her business by purchasing an extra stitching machine and hiring a worker. This will increase her income and her family’s living standard will become better.

loans.use: Purchase another sewing machine to expand sewing business

loans.name: Borith

texts.en:
Mr. Borith P., 35, and his wife, Mrs. Houch Real (pictured together), 30, have been married since 2003 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One attends school and other two are still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Borith is a motor taxi driver and fisherman. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children. The house where they live is old and breaks down in some parts, and Borith wants to repair it but he does not have money. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to make the repairs.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Christ In Me Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Christ In Me” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni city, in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Ramatu B.. Ramatu is age twenty-eight; she was born in Makeni and is single with two children who are attending primary school. 

For six years now, Ramatu has been selling market food – rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, Maggi, salt, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase furniture and other needed items.

loans.name: Sherozjon

texts.en:
H. Sherozjon is 25 years old. He is married with two small children. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of their children. Thus Sherozjon is the main bread-winner in the family. Sherozjon’s children are small now, but he is already working hard in order to ensure the best future for them. For more than 15 years Sherozjon has been baking the national bread “lepeshka”. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes "lepeshka" and other breads so that people can have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. He purchases all the ingredients such as flour, salt and yeast from the local market. Now Sherozjon is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni. The loan will be spent on purchasing flour and coal for baking “lepeshka”.  Sherozjon deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the country's already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasing flour for baking national bread “lepeshka”

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom A., 47, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. A. is employed as a garment factory worker for an income of $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $4 per day. Every month the family has to spend $61 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on their children's education and $5 on transportation. 

A. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a plot of farmland to grow rice for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a plot of farmland to grow rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca A. is from the village of Oscariz Ramon. She is 57 years old. Francisca is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty tiene 36 años y esta casa con el señor Efraín, juntos tienen 2 hijos de (10 y 6) años, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos pero muy unida, tienen una pequeña y humilde casa que tan solo cuenta con 2 habitaciones donde una lo usan los padres y el otro los dos hijos en la cual todos están incómodos.
La señora Betty vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad Esquilan Grande, su principal actividad de la cliente es la producción de la leche cruda cuyo producto vende a otra señora la cual se dedica a la elaboración de quesillo, el esposo se dedica al servicio de albañil todos los días de la semana. De esta manera los dos trabajan mucho para ofrecerles un mejor nivel de vida a sus dos hijos.

El préstamo  será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, con lo cual se incrementara la producción de la leche y de esta manera incrementara sus ingresos.

Entre sus sueños y metas de doña Betty es realzar una nueva construcción de su casa , la cual tenga más comodidades para sus hijos y para ellos , también doña Betty tiene un gran sueño de crecer en su actividad hasta tener una pequeña granja de 20 cabezas de ganado lechero.
texts.en:
Betty is 36 years old and she is married with Efrain. Together they have 2 children (aged 10 and 6 years old). It is a family who has very limited financial resources but they are very close to one another. They have a small and humble home that has only 2 rooms. One of the rooms is used by the parents and the other by the children but the home is not comfortable for anyone. 

Betty lives in the city of Cochabamba within the community of Esquilan Grande. Her primary business is the sale of raw milk, product that she sells to another woman who makes fresh cheese from it. Her husband works every day of the week as a construction worker. They both work very hard to provide their children with a better quality of life. 


The loan will be destined to purchase another dairy cow. She will be able to increase the volume of milk this way and she will see an increase in her income. 


Among Betty's goals and dreams is to start building a new house to afford greater comforts to her children and her husband. Another one of her great dreams is to have a dairy farm with 20 heads of cattle.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib J. is a 44-year-old trader who sells food products in Sabirabad. He started his business in 2006 and since that time he has been doing well. He sells flour, beverages, candies, macaroni and other stuff. 

Sahib is married and has four children; the eldest son is also helping him in the shop. Income from this shop is the only financial source in Sahib`s family and he is set on increasing it.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise to increase income

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal LAS ESTRELLAS, es su primera secuencia, está formado por 10 clientes, 9 mujeres y 1 varón, la mayoría de las socias pertenecen a la Zona de Alto Pacasa, Las socias se dedican a la venta de diversos productos como ser, venta de comida, ropa cosméticos, venta de dulces y otros. Son integrantes nuevas que por primera vez ingresan a obtener un crédito de la institución. Asistieron a todas las charlas, son organizadas y con deseos de superación.
Rossmery Es la representante, actualmente toma el cargo de la presidenta del banco se dedica a la costura de mandiles, cuenta con esta actividad hace 5 años, también trabaja en el Restaurant la Llave en el centro de la ciudad, el préstamo será destinado para la compra de tela e hilos para la costura de mandiles para su posterior venta en el mercado. Casada con el señor Marcos tienen 3 hijos. Su meta es tener un taller grande con varias maquinas de costura y formar una microempresa.
En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una líder que dirige al grupo.
Dora   Socia que asume el cargo de tesorera del banco, es una ama de casa y en sus tiempos libres trabaja como ayudante en venta de comida con sus familiares, el préstamo esta destinado a la compra de bienes para el hogar. Casada con el señor Juan que trabaja de chofer de minibús en un sindicato de la ciudad tienen 5  hijos de los cuales 2 dependen de la pareja y 3 son casados y viven en otros domicilios.
Es una de las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha colaborado en la conformación del grupo y en las verificaciones. en la fotografia una de las socias vino con su hermana.
texts.en:
The 'Las Estrellas' (Stars) community bank is in its first loan cycle.  It has ten members; nine women and one man.  The majority of the members live in Alto Pacasa district.  The members sell a variety of products such as food, clothes, cosmetics, sweets, etc.  They are new members who are applying for their first loan from our institution.  They have attended all the talks, they are organized and they have a desire to succeed.

Rossmery is the group's representative.  She is currently the bank's president and her business is sewing aprons.  She has been in this business for 5 years.  She also works in La Llave Restaurant in the center of town.  Her loan will be used to buy fabric and threads for sewing her aprons which she will then sell in the market.  Rossmery is married to Marcos and they have three children.  Her goal is to have a big workshop with several sewing machines and to create a small business.  She has stood out in her community bank as being a leader of the group.

Dora is the bank's treasurer.  She is a housewife and in her spare time she works as an assistant, selling food with her family members.  Her loan will be used to buy goods for her home.  She is married to Juan who works as a minibus driver as a member of a union in the city.  They have five children, two of whom are still financially dependent on their parents and three of whom are married and live in their own homes.

Dora is one of the community bank's representatives who worked on setting the group up and on carrying out the necessary checks.  In the photo, one of the members brought her sister along.

loans.use: To buy fabric and threads for making aprons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To keep his crops healthy

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma M. P. de 42 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Tacachico, en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus tres hijas. Irma es madre soltera, por lo que debe esforzarse el doble por contar con todo lo necesario para su hogar, ella posee una venta de ropa para hombres y mujeres, así mismo comercializa cosméticos, y zapatos. Su venta esta ubicada en su casa de habitación y así mismo sale para realizar ventas ambulantes, de forma que pueda obtener la mayor cantidad de ganancias posibles, las cuales son muy necesarias en su hogar. Irma solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar: ropa, zapatos y cosméticos por mayor y de esta forma obtenerlos a precios más bajos, lo cual le deje mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Irma M. P. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Tacachico, in La Libertad department, together with her three daughters.  Irma is a single mother which means that she must work doubly hard to have everything she needs for her household.

Irma has a business selling men's and women's clothes.  She also sells cosmetics and shoes.  Her sales location is in her home and she also goes out to make sales as an itinerant street vendor so that she can make as much money as possible which she desperately needs for her household.  

Irma is requesting a loan so that she has the money she needs to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics wholesale as this means she can get them at lower prices which makes her more profits.

loans.use: To buy clothes, cosmetics and shoes to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 45 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida plants and harvests rice for sale. Zenaida has been farming for 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

Zenaida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 54 años, su actividad económica es destace de cerdos. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio, a Francisco le gusta su actividad, por lo que labora con este negocio para incrementar sus ingresos ya que poco a poco ha mejorado su vivienda y además que todos en su comarca lo conocen, pues el servicio que ofrece es el mejor y la comunicación con sus clientes es la mejor. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento que es para capital de trabajo y comprar cerdos y pago de transporte. Francisco sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda pues su techo tiene algunos desperfectos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 54 years old and has a business butchering pigs. He has been in this business for more than 30 years and enjoys what he does. Francisco works in his business so that he can increase his income and gradually make improvements to his home. Everyone in the region knows him since he provides the best service and communicates well with his customers.

He is requesting this loan to use as operating capital to acquire pigs and pay to have them transported. Francisco hopes to make repairs to the roof of his home since it has a few defects.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Las Perlas 1 Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la señora Elvira una integrante del grupo LAS PERLAS 1, que esta ubicado en la localidad de Veracruz, México, se ve en la foto al grupo de señoras muy contentas. La señora Elvira se dedica a la venta de pan que inició hace 10 años, solicita el prestamo para la compra de triciclos para comercializar su produto, al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente muy contenta por que así va a poder distribuir en más lugares su pan, tiene 38 años, no estudio, es casada y tiene 3 hijos; 2 mujeres y un varon. Ella espera poder hacer crecer su panaderia y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientas. Angeles T. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 41 años, estudió hasta el bachillerato y es casada, ella vende cosmeticos que inicio hace 3 años, solicita el prestamo para hacer crecer su negocio y adquirir nueva mercancia, ya que no se da abasto con los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, ella comenta que con el prestamo podrá comprar sus productos y así logrará una estabilidad economica para su familia logrará ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una carrera profesional. El grupo esta formado por 10 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in the home of Mrs. Elvira, one of the members of the Las Perlas (Pearls) 1 Group, located in Veracruz, Mexico. This photo shows a group of very happy women. Mrs. Elvira began selling bread 10 years ago, and asked for a loan to buy tricycles to sell her products. Asking for the loan made her very happy because she will be able to distribute her bread in more places. She is 38 years old and did not attend school. She is married and has three children, two girls and a boy. She hopes to be able to grow her bakery and offer better service to her customers.

Angeles T. is the group's president. She is 41 years old and graduated from high school. She is married and has sold cosmetics for three years. She is asking for a loan to grow her business and buy new merchandise, as she currently does not have enough to supply for her customers' requests. She comments that with the loan, she will buy her products and will then achieve economic stability for her family and offer her children a better quality of life and professional careers.

This group is made up of ten members and it is the first time they have requested a loan.

loans.use: To buy tricycles to sell bread

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, de 34 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su hija cielo de 10 años, quien es el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. El negocio de Judith es la venta de anticuchos, los cuales prepara desde la tarde para venderlas llegada las 7 de la noche, su carretilla es muy llena y concurrida, ya que tiene una sazón muy especial para cocinar los anticuchos, ya sean de carne de pollo o salchicha, todo depende del gusto del cliente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y atenderlos de la mejor manera, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que quedarse vendiendo hasta altas horas de la noche, espera  con el tiempo poner una tienda de anticuchos, donde pueda vender con más comodidad. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará una nueva parrilla freír anticuchos.
texts.en:
Judith is 34 years old and a kind and hard-working woman.  She lives in her parent's house with her 10 year old daughter, who is her main motivation for all of her efforts.  

Judith's business sells kebabs, which she prepares in the afternoon to sell at 7:00pm.  Her cart is very full and crowded because she has a special seasoning that she cooks the kebabs in.  They are made of chicken or sausage, depending on what the customer wants.  The thing she likes best about her work is talking to her customers and serving them in the best way.  She has done this work for two years, and she thinks the most difficult thing about her work is staying up to sell until late at night.  She hopes that in time she will be able to have a kebab shop where she can sell more comfortably.

This is her first loan with MFP and she knows that she has to make her payments on time and she is ready to do so.  She is a well-liked member of her community bank.  With the 500 nuevos soles she has requested, she will purchase a new grill for frying kebabs.

loans.use: to purchase a new grill.

loans.name: Savon

texts.en:
Mrs. Savon O. and her husband, Mr. Lorn Nov (pictured together), live in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children--one son and four daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home; two are garment factory workers, one is a weaver and another one stays at home.

Savon and her husband are farmers; they grow rice and lotus. In addition, Mr. Lorn Nov is also a horse cart driver. Savon is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice and lotus farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice and lotus farm.

loans.name: Mpeki Selewa

texts.en:
Mpeki Selewa L. is 29 years old, married and has one child. He has been a wheat farmer for the past seven years and earns a monthly income of KES.1000.

He found out about KADET, LTD., through a registered client, and he has applied for his third loan of KES.45,000 from KADET LTD.   He plans to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. 

He hopes to make a profit and use it to purchase sheep for fattening. He dreams that, at the age of thirty, he will be stable and his children will live better lives.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Aydalina

texts.es:
Aydalina pequeña comerciante dedicada al trabajo, para el bienestar común de la familia. Su negocio es la venta de nacatamales, palmea tortilla, ahora también invirtió en ropa y cosmético, logrando obtener mejores  ingresos. 
Con el capital que trabaja ha sido parte de sus ahorros y préstamo con Afodenic, donde, lleva cuatro ciclos de los cuales ha logrado mejores inversión como mejores ventas. Lo que quiere con este nuevo financiamiento es comprar: ropa, variada para dama y caballeros, cosmético y perfume ya que logro la captación de clientes, mediantes estos productos.asi como la venta de tortilla.Lo que esta contenta por poder apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Aydalina is a small businesswoman who dedicates herself to her work so that she can provide for the welfare of her family. Her business involves selling Nicaraguan tamales and handmade tortillas. Now she will also invest in clothing and cosmetics so that she can earn more income.

Aydalina has built up working capital using her savings and the loans from AFODENIC. She has participated in four loan cycles and improved her investment through better sales. With this new loan she will buy various clothes for women and men, cosmetics, and perfumes so that she can attract customers. By offering these products and selling tortillas, Aydalina is pleased that she is able to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: El Clavel Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Clavel lo conforman Johana del Socorro, Mercedes de Lourdes  y Maricela Auxiliadora  tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Nindiri. Este grupo tiene siete ciclos trabajando con Adim en los cuales han sido personas responsables y sus negocios han crecido.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Johana de 24 años quien inicio 4 años vendiendo meneítos, gaseosa y fresco en la actualidad entrega almuerzos, los fines de semana instala su  fritanga donde  vende enchiladas.
Ella con el crédito con el crédito comprara arroz, frijoles, aceite, plátano…etc. con la meta de seguir mejorando su negocio.

La señora Mercedes de 38 años tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita y Maricela de 29 años desde hace tres años vende frescos, meitos y enchiladas.
texts.en:
The group “El Clavel” (The Carnation) consists of Johana del Socorro, Mercedes de Lourdes, and Maricela Auxiliadora. These three hardworking and enterprising women are originally from Nindiri. This group has worked with ADIM for seven loan cycles and they have demonstrated that they are responsible people. As a result, their businesses have grown.

The group coordinator is Sra. Johana. She is 24 years old and started a business four years ago selling snack foods, sodas, and refreshments. At the moment, she prepares lunches. On the weekends, she manages a “fritanga” (a restaurant that sells fried foods) where she serves enchiladas. She will use her loan to buy rice, beans, oil, plantains, and other products. Her goal is to continue improving her business.

Sra. Mercedes, age 38, also has a “fritanga” since fried foods are popular. Maricela, age 29, has been selling refreshments, snack foods, and enchiladas for three years.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, plantains, and other products.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is 38 years old, married and has four children. He repairs worn out shoes to earn a living. He has eleven years of experience in the business. Evans was previously employed before he went into the business. He is determined to expand his business in the future. With 20, 000 KES, he will buy shoe soles and leather for repairing shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoe soles and leather for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, a 31-year-old married father of two children, lives in Tyre-South Lebanon where he has worked as a barber since 1996. Working hard in order to provide his family with a good living standard and education, he is talented in his business and loved by most of his clients who are mainly friends, neighbors and relatives.

Having already borrowed twice from Al Majmoua with very good business results, Ahmad is requesting his third loan in order to do needed redecoration and buy some necessary new equipment and products for his shop. Ahmad hopes to expand his business and improve his family's social and financial situation in the future.

loans.use: to do needed redecoration and buy necessary equipment and products for his shop.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is a mother of two children who are ages four and six years old. Her husband is a civil servant. Consolee sells second-hand clothes and she has been selling clothes for the past eight years. Throughout these years, this business has enabled her to pay her children school fees and meet the needs of her family. She needs a loan to buy more clothes and hence make more profits. With the profits she plans to save until she can afford to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Clara Maria

texts.es: Clara Maria tiene 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchos deseos de sacar adelante a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como pantalones, cosméticos, calzado y otros productos.  La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan variedad, por lo que ella tiene que buscar la forma de complacerlos. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de esta materia. Clara es una mujer muy alegre y disfruta de realizar esta actividad cada día.
texts.en: Clara María is 35 years old.  She is a very hard working woman who very much wants to move her family forward.  She sells general merchandise like pants, cosmetics, footwear and other products.  Most of her customers always request variety so she must find ways to please them.  Because of this she’s asking for this loan to buy this merchandise.  Clara is a very cheerful woman who enjoys doing this work every day.

loans.use: to buy pants, cosmetics, footwear and other products.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with eight children. Five of her children attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumptions like maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join to because of favorable loan procedures.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
2.	Luis es un señor de 44 años que vive con su esposa e hijos en un pequeño pueblo en Guanacaste llamado la Garita. La Garita es una planicie de clima bastante cálido donde se desarrollan actividades tales como la ganadería, Agricultura y el Turismo Rural.

Desde hace varios años Luis se dedica al alquiler de maquinaria Fernanda S.A, en el cual los vecinos de su comunidad se muestran muy satisfechos. Dice que inicio su negocio a sus 22 años teniendo su propia maquinaria pesada, que fue una herencia que le dejaron sus padres. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.

Actualmente Don Luis está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de repuestos para la maquinaria, para reparar sus maquinarias y asi seguir brindando su servicio a sus clientes, además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto el espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. 

Don Luis es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito, y espera poder seguir participando de manera más activa en este tipo de organizaciones. Y nos afirma que la ECC ha tenido gran impacto en la comunidad, ya que antes no tenían oportunidades para ayudar económicamente a los habitantes.
texts.en:
Luis, age 44, lives with his wife and children in a small community in Guanacaste called La Garita. It is located on a plain with a very warm climate where activities such as cattle-raising, agriculture, and tourism, among others, occur.

For several years Luis has been working by renting Fernanda S.A. machinery.  His neighbors in the community are very satisfied.  He says that he started his business 22 years ago.  He had his own heavy machinery, which was an inheritance that his parents left him.  He also says that the project is very interesting to him because he has seen how, little by little, his business is growing and there is more demand.

Luis is currently requesting a microloan for ¢500.000 (five hundred thousand colones) to buy replacement parts for the machinery.  He will repair his machinery, and that way he will continue to offer his customers good service.  This is in addition to expanding and strengthening his place.

With this he hopes to make his business grow more and to improve his quality of life.  His business is going well, but due to his lack of money he has not been able to make it grow more.

Luis is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita, one of the 110 member organizations with EDESA in Costa Rica.

This will be his first loan, and he plans to continue participating more actively in this type of organization.  

He assure us that ECC (Communal Credit Companies in English – are small credit organizations created and run by the very people who borrow from them) has had a great impact on the community because they previously did not have opportunities to financially help the inhabitants.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for machinery to rent.

loans.name: Christian

texts.fr:
Cliente de 35 ans,marie et père de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 6 et 10 ans. N'ayant pas d'appui considérable pour la poursuite de ses études , il s'est lance depuis 2006  dans la restauration .

Soucieux de son ambition de devenir propriétaire d'un restaurant avec grille moderne , ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer le stock des bidons d'huile, sac haricot, carton de poisson sale , carton de poulet et des tas de maniocs. 
Pour atteindre son objectif  il envisage beaucoup epargner et avec ses obligations parentales, il cherche a subvenir a la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This 35 year old client is married with 2 children, ages 6 and 10. As he didn't have enough support for his studies, he became a caterer in 2006. His goal is to have his own restaurant with an up-to-date grill. This loan will allow him to increase his stock of barrels of cooking oil, bags of beans, boxes of salted fish, boxes of chickens and cassava.

In order to reach his goal, he plans to save a lot and, to meet his obligations as a parent, to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy barrels of oil, beans, boxes of salted and smoked fish.

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.fr:
Ildephonse est né au Rwanda et a 27 ans. Il est marie, il a 2 enfants de 1 an à 5 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de primaire. 
Ildephonse est agriculteur et commerçant des bananes. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des bananes en gros pour les revendre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’élargir son business en élevant son capital et de louer et une camionnette pour les distributions des bananes. Ildephonse voudrait devenir un grand distributeur des bananes et faire commerce comme profession, et il voudrait améliorer le bien être de sa famille et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ildephonse was born in Rwanda and is 27 years old. He is married and has two children, ages 1 and 5 years old. He has a 3rd grade education. 

Ildephonse is a farmer and sells bananas. This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy bananas wholesale to resell. His strategy for business growth is to expand his business by increasing his capital and renting a truck for distributing bananas. 

Ildephonse would like to become a major distributor of bananas and to work professionally in commerce. And he would like to improve his family's well-being and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy bananas wholesale to resell

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 35-year-old married woman living with her husband and seven wonderful children in Dahieh, Lebanon. She has been an owner of a grocery store since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, and dairy products. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. Her store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers coming in and buying.

Nada decided to apply for a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy new products for her store that she believes her customers will like. This is her second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower; she has a very good loan history. Nada hopes to increase her profits in order to provide a better life for her big family.

loans.use: To buy new products for her store

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Tete, norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos todos maiores de idade. Fez  4ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal em missão de serviço, é pensionista militar ha mais de 20 anos e tem uma pensão de 6.800.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construcao de construcao de uma casa (areia, pedra, cimento, barrotes, e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua casa. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 4.000.00mt, 8.500.00mt, e 12,500.00mt, para sua obra.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alberto was born in the province of Tete in northern Mozambique. He is married and the father of five adult children. He went to school through the fourth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He left Tete in order to fulfill his military service. He retired from the military after 20 years and earns a pension of 6,800 meticals a month. He uses the pension to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account. He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his fourth loan, in the amount of 16,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (sand, stone, cement, rebar, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. His first loans, in the amounts of 4,000, 8,500, and 12,500 meticals, were all also used for his home. He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku so he can finish his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, stone, cement, rebar, etc.) for his house.

loans.name: Im

texts.en: This borrower comes from Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Im has been spending all of her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she had learned from her parents when she was young. Im has been in the farming business since 1979. Im is married to Mr. Thol who generates income alongside her. From this business activity, Im can earn about $1USD per day. This humble couple has given birth to four kids who are all singles. To assist her income, three of her children are employed as garment factory workers in Phnom Penh city where they can get enough salary for each month; another is attending school. To upgrade their living condition, Im wishes to have a motorbike to facilitate her son’s traveling, but lacks cash, so she has decided with her husband to apply for a loan through HKL, a partner of Kiva. She hopes that this loan will make her family meet happiness and prosperity all the time. This is her first loan with HKL. She is very thankful to all kind lenders that help her family. She is shown with her husband in this photo.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Carlita has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, bread & snacks like rice cakes. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Carlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Carlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Mercy Susana

texts.es:
Mercy Susana tiene 34 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres  en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

Mercy  se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, soya y cacao las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

 Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insumos, abonos  para los cultivos. 
Con la ayuda del préstamo mejorará la calidad del producto, Enfrenta desafíos que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas a los cultivos.

El sueño es llegar a comprar una casa para vivir tranquila con la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en: Mercy Susana is 34 years old.  She is unmarried and has no children.  She lives with her parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolivar province.  Mercy Susana works in farming, growing corn, soy beans, and cacao.  She makes purchases and sells her produce in San José del Tambo each weekend. She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer, supplies, and manure for the crops.  This loan will help her improve the quality of her produce. The most frequent challenges she faces are competition and blight.  Her dream is to buy a house where she can live peacefully with her family.  In her free time, she enjoys the carnival festivities.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer, supplies, and manure for the crops.

loans.name: Menu Farmers Shg Group

texts.en:
Wycliff is the facilitator of the Menu Farmers SHG group. His group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Wycliff takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Wycliff had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Wycliff and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. With income from maize sales, Wycliff will invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Menu Farmers SHG group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.
In the photograph above, Wycliff is pictured with his group members. The field officer appears in the far left of the photograph.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kahanda Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Fred wants a loan to buy maize produce for resale. Aged 49 years, Fred hails from Kyenjojo District in Uganda. He is a father of six children and he lives with them and their mother in a semi permanent house. Having started by growing pineapples, Fred saved money to start up that business, which has grown over four years. His dream is to educate his children and he hopes to acquire a motorcycle to make transportation easier.

loans.use: to buy maize produce for resale.

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Neema Group in Western Kenya! Leonard is the facilitator of the Neema group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Leonard takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Leonard had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest five bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Leonard and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Leonard will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Neema group will each plant between one half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es: María, necesita continuar fortaleciendo el negocio, comprara arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carnes, vegetales, condimentos, para continuar ofreciendo a los clientes los platillos con el sabor de calidad, con los préstamos anteriores ha logrado hacer una buena inversión, dando un mejor servicio a los clientes y manteniendo el negocio bien surtido.
texts.en: Maria needs to continue strengthening her business. By buying rice, beans, sugar, oil, meat, vegetables, and condiments, she will continue offering her customers dishes with a quality taste. With previous loans she was able to make a good investment, giving better service to her customers and keeping her business well supplied.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, meat, vegetables, and condiments.

loans.name: Haykuhi

texts.en:
Haykuhi is 24 years-old. She is married and has two small children. Haykuhi and her family live in Vanadzor city. 

For more than a year Haykuhi has run her own food and household goods trading business. She rents a shop where she sells produce, which she buys from suppliers. Haykuhi’s husband is a trainee at one of the Vanadzor organizations and every evening and weekend he helps his wife in the shop. Thanks to the business Haykuhi and her husband provide for their young family.  

Haykuhi is seeking for a loan of 800.000 AMD in order to buy beverages, candies, various canned foods, household goods, etc. for her shop. This will help Haykuhi to increase her shops assortment before the New Year’s holiday, when trading is very active.

loans.use: to buy beverages, candies, various canned foods, household goods, etc. for her shop

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He owns a textile business which is five-years old. Elijah is a married father of two. He first worked as a gatekeeper, saved some money and applied for a loan to start up his business. 

Elijah is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase cotton linings and clothes materials for the textile business. He looks forward to being a supplier of school uniforms to institutions.

loans.use: to purchase cotton linings and clothes materials.

loans.name: Mary Mwarabu

texts.en:
Mary Mwarabu is a 43-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mariakani. She is a married mother of four. She has been running her business for the past two years with great success. 

This is Mary’s first business loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil, and tea leaves. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a well-known business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 45 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married and has two children.

Leonora is a dressmaker and earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 9000 for additional capital.
Leonora has been a member of PMPC since this year, 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: for additional capital

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en: La'azarus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. La'azarus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Lidiya, Yakubu and Zulaihatu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, La'azarus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, La'azarus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, La'azarus  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lourinda

texts.en:
Lourinda is 25 years old, married with one child

Lourinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lourinda requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lourinda has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lourinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is married with two children. He started his business making and selling bicycle parts three years ago after failing to find work.  He raised the initial capital from the sale of farm produce on his family land. With the first loan from PEMCI he was able to boost his business and to buy himself a small piece of land. Life has greatly improved for him and his family. With this second loan of US$150 he plans to diversify his stock of bicycle parts to include larger components. Bicycle transportation is the major mode of transportation in this part of the country and demand for spare parts for repair and maintenance is high. This is a much needed service to the local community and the economy at large.

loans.use: Buy Bicycle parts

loans.name: Mahabbat

texts.en: Mahabbat is 37-years old, married and has two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, Kilsali village, settled in Khirdalan settlement. Mahabbat has rented this paper-mill for 12 years. She buys paper-manufactured products as raw materials, cuts the paper with benches and prepares new papers in different formats for selling. Mahabbat began her business with a loan of $500 to buy paint and paper. Now she requests a loan of $1200 to buy more paint and paper which will allow her to expand production and offer employment to others in her region. She loves her work and is excited to be engaged in this business.

loans.use: To buy paint and paper

loans.name: Minerva Nery

texts.en:
MINERVA IS 47 YEARS OLD, MARRIED, TWO CHILDREN. SHE GOES OUT TO SELL IN THE COMMUNITIES NEAR HER HOUSE, SELLING PRODUCTS SUCH AS: CLOTHING, SHOES, NECKLACES, BRACELETS. SHE ALSO MAKES BREAD AND SELLS IT TO HER NEIGHBORS. SHE REPRESENTS THE GROUP "FLOR DE LIZ," WHICH IS MADE UP OF THREE WOMEN. THE OTHERS WORK IN THE FOLLOWING FIELDS:

NORMA E. B. VILLA (SELLS CLOTHING)

GLORIA GOMEZ HERNANDEZ (SELLS HANDICRAFTS)

THE GROUP HOPES TO USE THIS LOAN TO INVEST IN BUYING MORE MATERIALS TO AUGMENT THE SALE OF THEIR PRODUCTS. THIS IS WHY THE AMOUNT WILL BE DIVIDED IN THREE EQUAL PARTS. (Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

MINERVA TIENE 47 AÑOS, CASADA, DOS HIJOS ELLA SALE A VENDER A LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS A SU CASA PRODUCTOS TALES COMO : ROPA , ZAPATOS, COLLARES , PULSERAS Y ADEMAS ELABORA PAN Y LO VENDE ENTRE SUS VECINOS. ELLA REPRESENTA AL GRUPO FLOR DE LIZ 1 QUE ESTA CONSTITUIDO POR 3 MUJERES LAS CUALES LABORAN EN LAS SIGUIENTES ESPECIALIDADES :

NORMA E.B. VILLA ( VENDE ROPA )

GLORIA GOMEZ HERNANDEZ ( VENTA DE ARTESANIA )

EL GRUPO ESPERA CONTAR CON EL PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAS MATERIALES PARA AUMENTAR LA VENTA DE SUS PRODUCTOS.ES POR ESO QUE SERA REPARTIDO EL MONTO EN PARTES IGUALES .

loans.use: clothing sales

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Mrs. Juliet U. is happily married with four children, she is 44 years old and is from Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is a tailor and would like a loan to buy a new sewing machine machine and fabric.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and fabric for her tailoring business

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji, 34 years old, father of 2 children, owns a small games and internet cafe in Bourj Hammoud, in the Northern Suburbs of Beirut. 
This is the first time Naji requests a loan from Al Majmoua. Like many other micro-entrepreneurs, he heard about our Institution through word of mouth. 
Naji's cafe is located in a highly populated area and he needs a loan for an amount of USD 1,200 to expand his business. Indeed, in order to answer the demand, he wants to buy 2 new computers.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 new computers for his games and  internet cafe

loans.name: Elisa Armando

texts.pt:
Elisa Amado C. was born in 1965, in Maputo, Mozambique. She's 42 years old and lives with her partner and children. At the age of 6 she went to live with her grandparents, and was able to attend school until 4th grade. She has been with her partner, the father of her children, since she was 17. Right after starting a small business selling basic groceries, in 1992, Elisa got ill and was forced to stop working for a year. Once she got better she decided to dedicate herself to the business of selling clothes, which she has been doing for 4 years now. Elisa buys the clothes in downtown Maputo (the children's clothes are the most lucrative ones) and rents a car to have the pieces delivered to her neighborhood, where she sells them at a stand located near home. Elisa doesn't have a bookkeeping system to keep track of her transactions (she doesn't know how to do it and says she prefers to keep it all "in her memory.") Business is going very well for her, and she wants to use her loan to increase her inventory. Profits from the sales are divided between helping with the household expenses, reinvesting in the business and saving. The Hluvuku loans have had a very positive impact on Elisa's life so far, and she hopes it will help her buy a piece of land in her home province, one day.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro ferroviário –Maputo Cliente:Elisa Armando C. Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 15,000.00mt ( 600usd) Aplicação: venda de Roupas Início: 08/10/07 Fim: 30/01/2009 Elisa Armando C., nasceu aos 25 de fevereiro de 1965 em Namaacha província de Maputo, tem 42 anos de idade, casada maritalmente tem filhos estudou até 4ªclasse . Viveu com os pais até aos 6 anos e com ausência do pai teve que ir viver com os avôs até aos 16 anos , aos 17 anos junta-se com seu marido. Em 1992 iniciou o negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade num dos mercados da cidade, algum tempo depois fica gravemente doente facto que lhe obrigou ater que parar durante um ano.depois de melhorar retoma o negócio tendo mudado o tipo de negócio passando a vender a roupa até então e faz este negócio a 4 anos. Não tem formação neste negócio e não emprega ninguem por enquanto.Com o empréstimo de 15,000.00mt comprou fardos de roupa para revenda. Abre o seu negócio as 8 horas e para chegar no seu posto de trabalho não usa nenhum meio de transporte por este se localizar perto de casa. Adquiri a mercadoria na cidade e aluga uma viatura para transportá-la. O melhor período do negócio tem sido no fim do mês, a receita diária tem sido de 1,000 a 1,500,00 sendo a roupa da crainças que tem dado o maior lucro. Não faz registos de vendas por igoráncia acha que não tem muitas contas a fazer tudo oque faz é possível afixar na sua memória. As dificuldades tem sido em certos momentos onde o puder de compra diminui mas que não pode prejudicar os reembolsos de crédito uma vez que o seu marido trabalha e é pensionista e poderá lhe ajudar nesses momentos. O negócio está caminhar bem e a margem de lucro mensal tem sido de 5,000.00 mt e com os rendimentos faz o reinvestimento , ajuda o marido no sustento da família e uma parte deposita no banco. Futuramente almeja abrir uma machamba na sua terra natal e para tal poderá recorrer ao empréstimo. O empréstimo modificou positivamente o seu negócio e está satisfeita.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Rosa A. is married and mother of 8 children. She is in the business of selling cow heads, which she does from home and at a street stand in Trevo-Matola, Mozambique. She joined the credit program in 2006 and has paid previous loans timely. Rosa plans to use this, her 5th loan to date, to increase her stock of cow heads.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa A. portadora de BI nº 110002315P, casada de 8 filhos vive no bairro trevo é negociante vende cabeças de vaca na sua propria residencia entrou no projecto no ano de 2006 tomando 1800 agora esta no 5º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 20000 mt para pagar em 8 meses tambem faz o negocio ambulante.

loans.use: stock increase

loans.name: Lufula B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 48-year-old widow with 4 children. She sells used clothes. With the extra profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Musilimot

texts.en: Musilimot O. is 40 years old, married with 4 children and hails from Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells and produce snacks e.g. fish roll, kpof-kpof and meat pies. She has been in business since 2004 and requests a loan of $450 to enable her buy  an oven and produce a large quantity.

loans.use: To buy an oven to enable her to bake meat pie.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Mrs. Tep N., 43, is a mother of two children and, with her husband, works selling firewood from their house. They normally earn around $5.50 a day of income. One child  works as a motor-taxi driver, making on average $2 a day of profit and the other is employed by a garment factory and earns a salary $60 a month. To raise the family's standard of living, the husband requests a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to run as a motor-taxi to produce additional income. Mrs. Tep N. can manage the firewood selling business without her husband. (Mrs. Tep N. and her husband were not available for the picture so her son is pictured with the motorbike they hope to purchase).

loans.use: To purchase a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Maria Teresa Alberti

texts.es:
Maria Teresa M. is a widower with one son. She makes skirts, blouses, shirts, pants, curtains, etc. This is her source of income that allows her, along with her 3 sisters, get ahead in life. She has been working as a seamstress and tailor for 15 years now. Currently, she owns 4 electric sewing machines, and two of her sisters help her make the clothes. She runs her workshop from home and searches for new customers in town. Right now she makes physical education sportswear for two schools. She goes out personally to look for customers so as to create more business for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Teresa M., viuda, con un hijo; se dedica a los tejidos; hace faldas, blusas, camisas, pantalones, cortinas etc., Es una fuente de ingresos que ella tiene de la cual le sirve para salir avante junto a sus 3 hermanas. Lleva 15 años trabajando como costurera y sastre, actualmente cuenta con 4 maquinas eléctricas y las dos hermanas de ella le ayudan en el trabajo de tejidos y otros. Tiene su taller en su casa, y desde allí, ella sale a buscar clientes a quien le puede trabajar; actualmente tiene dos colegios de los cuales les hace los uniformes de educación física, así mismo sale a buscar clientes en forma directa para poder tener una mayor producción de prendas.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy more material with which to make clothing items.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is forty nine years old. She is married with five children. She is a food vendor who has sold Kenkey for the last 24 years. Kenkey is one of the popular local foods prepared from milled maize grains. It is eaten with either hot pepper and fish in tomato sauce or stew. It is enjoyed as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Joyce supports three of her children in school, while two have completed school. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize, vegetables and fish to increase her production. This will allow her to increase her income to support her children’s education. She belongs to the community called Nkwabin Ladies. In this group, members use social collateral to guarantee the loans for one another. They use positive peer pressure to encourage each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, vegetables and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a wide range of goods to restock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S., 46, lives with her husband, Bou Tha, their two children, and their niece in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Their niece works in a local garment factory and helps to support the family with her income. Leng S. operates a small karaoke business in her village and makes $5 USD each day. Her husband operates a motortaxi service can typically make $2.50 USD each day.

The family believes that it is running a successful karaoke business and would like to investment to improve their equipment. Leng S. has asked for a loan of $600 USD to invest in her karaoke business and would like to see her income increased as a result. She sees a lot of potential in her small business and is grateful for the opportunities that this loan presents.

loans.use: Invest in karaoke business

loans.name: Jazmina De Los Angel

texts.es:
Jazmina sells clothing and various shoes both by traveling and in her house. Sometimes, she also sells clothes that she herself makes; she hopes to be able to strengthen her clothing production business. The business is 6 years old and since she began the business, she is most affected by the low sales that she has in some seasons. She is 30 years old, is a single mother of a son, who is in elementary school. She lives in the Sabana Grande area, which is a remote area near the city of Managua. Previously, Jazmina rented a room in her house, and with the income she earned, she was able to begin selling clothes and shoes. Her plans are to be able to increase her clientele through more sales. As a result, the loan she is requesting will be used to buy pants, shirts, and intimate apparel for women. In this way, it will be invested into her business.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Jazmina se dedica a la venta ambulante y en su casa de habitación de ropa y zapatos variados. En ocasiones también vende ropa que ella misma confecciona y espera poder fortalecer el negocio de la confección. Tiene 6 años y medio de haber empezado el negocio, en lo que la mayoría de las veces lo que más le afecta son las ventas bajas que en algunas temporadas se dan. Tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo que se encuentra en educación primaria. Habita en la comarca Sabana Grande, un lugar alejado de la ciudad de Managua. Anteriormente Jazmina alquilaba una habitación en su vivienda, y con los ingresos obtenidos pudo empezar las ventas de ropa y zapato. Sus planes son poder aumentar la clientela a través de más ventas, es por eso que el crédito solicitado lo usará para la compra de pantalones, camisas y ropa de interior de damas, y así invertirlo en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, and intimate apparel for women

loans.name: Victoria Gladis

texts.es:
La señora Victoria Gladis, tiene 34 años, actualmente es conviviente, estudió la carrera de obstetricia, no la culminó porque salió embarazada, después tuvo una amenaza de aborto y como no podía subir las gradas del instituto Alexander Fleming  porque  estudiaba en el 3er piso, es por este motivo  que decidió retirarse, tiene 03 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
Para ayudarse económicamente empezó vendiendo productos cosméticos de belleza, una amiga le hizo la propuesta para que ofrezca  estos productos, ella aceptó porque quería trabajar,  además en tiempo de verano vende cremoladas, arroz con leche, mazamorra. Tiene 02 años en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su amiga la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “MUJERES AL ÉXITO II” ella decidió pertenecer en este Banco porque quería incrementar el capital  y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró hielos, vasos, cucharas, maíz, chuño, azúcar, arroz, leche.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00  que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de productos cosméticos más cómodos tales como: perfumes, labiales, aretes, relojes, cremas, para después venderlos  a otro precio.

En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de fiscal, cuya función es informar a las nuevas socias, explicarles  en que consiste la ONG Manuela Ramos.
La socia sueña con comprar un local para vender ropa, calzado o tener una pequeña juguería y a parte seguir vendiendo productos cosméticos.
texts.en:
Miss Victoria Gladis is 34 years old, at present she is a domestic partner. She studied the career of midwifery, but she didn't finish because she became pregnant, and later she had an abortion threat and since she couldn't go up the stairs to the third floor of Alexander Fleming Institute, she had to stop. She has 3 children who are all in school. They live in the District of Trujillo in the Department of La Libertad.

In order to help herself economically, she started selling beauty cosmetic products. A friend suggested her to sell these products, she accepted because she wanted to work. Also during the summer she sells smoothies, rice with milk, and maize with honey.

She has been with the Manuela Ramos for two years, a friend recommended her to the MUJERES AL ÉXITO Communal Bank. She decided to belong to this Bank because she wanted to increase her working capital and with the first loan of $115 she bought ice, glasses, spoons, corn, potato flour, sugar, rice, and milk. With this loan of $350 that she will repay over a period of 4 months, she plans to buy cosmetic products that are easier to sell such as: perfumes, labials, earrings, clocks, creams. In the Communal Bank where she belongs she has a legal role where she informs to the new partners what Manuela Ramos is about. The partner dreams of buying a retail space to sell clothes, footwear or to have a small toy store and still be able to sell cosmetic products.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale cosmectic products.Compra de productos cosméticos al por mayor.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel B. is a 54 year old businessman. He is a husband and father of four children, who are currently in school.  He belongs to the community group named 'Adjinyemise' Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another in repaying their loans. 

He sells goats and sheep. He buys the goats and the sheep from the northern part of the country and supplies them to restaurant operators. Goat meat is enjoyed by many Ghanaians because of the good flavor and affordability. His business has been slow to grow because of inadequate funds to buy the animals. With the loan, he wants to buy in bulk. He believes the loan will allow him to meet the demands of his customers. He also hopes to save more money to provide for his children.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La  señora Rosa L. R. tiene 21 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II  y vive en la calle Jorge Chávez 391 del balneario de Buenos Aires Norte de la provincia de Trujillo del departamento de La Libertad.
Terminó la educación secundaria pero por  falta de medios económicos no continúo estudiando. Tiene una hija que depende de ella.
Rosa responde en dos negocios, uno que lo hace por su cuenta y consiste en la venta de ropa interior en el mercado de su sector, lo realiza en las mañanas y otro negocio que es familiar y lo realiza por las tardes en su casa es un locutorio.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas compró algunas cosas para el negocio familiar y prendas de ropa interior.
Con este crédito de 300 soles devuelto en 4 cuotas ampliará el negocio comprando otra clase de ropa.
Rosa es emprendedora y le interesa mucho sacar adelante a su hija, enseñarle lo bueno y lo malo de la vida, incentivarla a continuar sus estudios y guiarla de tal manera que sepa sus derechos y obligaciones como mujer. 
Rosa sueña con tener un negocio muy grande, bien implementado y muy bonito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa L. R. is 21 years old and belongs to the Enterprising Women II Community Bank. She lives at Jorge Chávez 391 in the Buenos Aires North resort in the Trujillo province in the La Libertad department. Rosa finished secondary school, but wasn't able to continue her education due to economic factors. She has one daughter, who depends on her. Rosa has two businesses. She sells underwear in the local market each morning, and is the sole proprietor of this business. She also runs a family business in the afternoons, which is a shop where people can pay discounted rates to make international phone calls. With her first loan of 300 soles Rosa bought some things for her family business, and also supplied her underwear business. She repaid the loan in four installments. With this loan of 300 soles she'll expand her business by purchasing different types of clothing. She'll repay the loan in four installments. Rosa is a hard worker and very motivated to help her daughter get ahead, to teach her about the good and bad things in life, and incentivize her to continue her studies. Rosa would like to guide her daughter so that she knows her rights and obligations as a woman. Rosa dreams of having a large, well-run, and beautiful business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy underwear wholesale.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun S., 56, and her husband, Mr. Ngoun Tor, 46, live along national road number one about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1992 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them study in a local school.

Yun and her husband have been farming for five years. Currently, they grow cauliflowers on their farmland. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to use on her cauliflower farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for using on her farm.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar M. Arif Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar baji is a 40 year old married lady and resides in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 15 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he has a business selling utensils. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. Parveen baji has five kids: three daughters and two sons. All of her children are getting an education in a local school located near to the house. Parveen baji also sells utensils in the community to help her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy more utensils to expand the business.

Parveen baji is the leader of a group with a few more women of her locality. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy material (cooking oil and sugar) for her sweetmeat business. Rani baji wants a loan to buy meat to resell. Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Tahmina baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Nagina baji wants a loan to buy electric switches and wires for her electric shop.
