This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy utensils to resell.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es: Florentina tiene 40 años, vive con su pareja cerca de 22 años, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos viven con ellos en una casa alquilada mientras puedan construir su casa.  Cuando empezó a convivir con su esposo trabajaban de sol a sol en la chacra; ahora quien más se dedica a la chacra es su esposo, mientras que ella lo apoya de dos a tres veces por semana, el resto de días se dedica a comprar frutas ya cosechadas, las transporta a su casa, las selecciona para luego acomodarlas en javas de 12 kilos. Por su parte su esposo también carga sus propias frutas, de ese modo alquilan un solo carro para trasportarlas al mercado. Florentina trata de tener productos variados por lo que compra plátano, palta y otras. Cuando lleva una carga de 1500 soles de inversión gana 500 soles líquido, y si es que todas las frutas se mantienen sus precios gana mucho más. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, durante el segundo crédito tenia el cargo de vocal, donde convocaba a reunión a todos los socios con eficacia. El dinero que ha solicitado es para la compra de una camionada de frutas, para que le sirva de capital para sus próximas ventas.
texts.en:
Florentina is 40 years old, she lives with her partner of nearly 22 years, and she has 6 children, 3 of whom live with her in a rented house while their own home gets built. When she began her partnership with her husband they worked from dawn to dusk on the farm; now her husband is more involved with the farm, and she helps him two to three times a week. The remaining days she buys fruit, transports them to her home, and then selects the fruit to make crates weighing 12 kilos. Her husband also loads his own fruit, so they rent one car to transport everything to the market. Florentina tries to carry a variety of products so she buys bananas, avocados and other fruit. When she invests 1,500 soles she earns 500 soles in profit, and if all fruit prices remain stable she earns more. This is her fourth loan with MFP, during her second loan she served as a vocal member where she called all partners to meetings. The money she has requested is to purchase a truckload of fruit, and it will serve as capital for future sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a truckload of fruit

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion C. has been growing rice since 1985. For almost 23 years, she has spent her whole life on the farm. She tills the soil, feels the heat of the sun, plants the rice seedlings and waits for the good harvest to come. She is 54 years old and has three children; one in college and two still in high school. She is already a widow. Her husband died from an illness. Now she is the only one who manages the farm. Her children help her on the farm during their free time.

She is requesting a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer for her farm. She believes that her loan will bring her a good harvest. The fertilizer will allow her farm to produce a good yield. She is also willing to look for some other income-generating activities. In this way, she could support fully the needs of her children.

CEVI helps Visitacion with her farm. She has access to the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that CEVI gives to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima M. Nadir Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima baji is the wife of M. N. who is a fruit seller by profession. Fatima baji has been a citizen of  Vehari, Pakistan for the last 10 years. She is the mother of five kids: four sons and one daughter. All of her kids are getting an education at a school located near her house. Fatima baji’s husband sells fruit on a cart. He shouts out in different areas, so that people hear his voice and buy fruit. He has been in this business for the last five years. Fatima baji is a very hardworking lady. She keeps herself busy with her clothing business. She sews clothes to pay off the school fees of her kids and to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruit to expand her husband’s fruit-selling business. 

She is the group leader for other women in her location. Shahnaz parveen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy electrical supplies (electric wires and switches) to sell. Sana rubab baji wants a loan to buy a movie camera for her movie-making business. Rafia baji wants a loan to buy a donkey for her donkey cart. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Salma M.riaz Group

texts.en:
Salma is a wife of M. who lives in a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan.  Her husband runs a garment shop in the cloth market.  People come to him to buy garments because he has a good collection with new designs.  He has been in this profession for the past seven years. 

Salma is a housewife but she keeps herself busy knitting clothes.  Her activity gives her rewards in the shape of money.  She knits sofa sets and table covers and sells in the markets.  

Salma successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy garments for her husband’s business.
 
She is the group leader of four another women from her locality.  Hanifan wants a loan to buy shoes to sell.  Nasreen wants a loan to buy scrap for her business.  Asia wants a loan to pay the remaining installments of her auto-rickshaw (three-wheeled motor vehicle).  Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy garments to sell for husband's business.

loans.name: Gilber

texts.es: Gilber cuenta con 37 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus hermanos en la casa de sus padres. Él es un hombre apasionado por las labores agrícolas, ya que sus padres sembraban en extensiones numerosas y la mayoría de las veces armaban sus fincas en compañía de todos sus hermanos para los meses de cosecha, de ese modo iban viendo, de forma constante, la evolución de los fertilizantes en cada uno de sus cultivos. Él era quien cuidaba la maduración de los frutos de café, hasta que tornen a un color guindo, en seguida cosechaba para después lavarlos y hacerlos secar. Para Gilber, los cultivos de café es un medio muy importante en el desarrollo y crecimiento de su familia, por ello que nunca dejaría tal labor, y está muy agradecido con la Divina Providencia, por haber gente que le brinde apoyo para seguir trabajando. Con sus ganancias quiere comprar un terreno en la ciudad para alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Gilber es un cliente muy puntual en cada uno de sus pagos, este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, por lo que hace compromisos de pagar con la misma responsabilidad. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá netamente en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
5 Gilber is 37-years-old, single, and lives with his siblings in their parent's house. He is a man who is passionate about agricultural work since his parents planted many expanses of land and usually filled their farms with the company of all of their brothers and sisters during the harvest months. This is how they made a living. Constantly changing the fertilizers for each one of their crops. He was the one in charge of the maturation of the coffee growths. Once they turned a cherry color, they had to be harvested right away, then washed, and dried. For Gilber, cultivating coffee is very important to the development and growth of his family. This is why he would never give up this work. He is very grateful to Divine Providence for the existence of people who offer him support so he can continue working. He would like to buy some land in the city with his earnings to take advantage of a higher quality of life. Gilber is a client who is very punctual with all of his payments. This is his second loan with MFP to whom he promises to pay back with the same level of responsibility. He will invest all of the money he is applying for in the cultivation of coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de inversión para sus cultivos de café

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “Las Reynas” organizadas bajo la presidencia D. la señora Polina van cursando su primer ciclo con entusiasmo y ganas D. salir adelante con sus diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. comida, venta D. cosméticos y a actividades como la artesanía, construcción D. viviendas, carpintería y al servicio D. transporte público D. pasajeros. La competencia en el mercado no es impedimento para las socias puedan salir adelante ya que ellas aseguran que sus productos son D. buena calidad y a un precio razonable. El destino del financiamiento es para la ampliación D. sus negocios con la adquisición D. materiales y herramientas que coadyuven al mejoramiento D. sus negocios y por enD. a sus ingresos familiares para brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y una mejor calidad D. vida para ellos. En general el grupo tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios ya que obtenían crédito D. instituciones similares a la Fundación agrocapital por lo que saben administrar bien los fondos para que estos sean un beneficio para cada uno D. sus miembros.
texts.en:
The “Las Reynas” Communal Bank, with Señora Polina as their president, are embarking on their first loan cycle with enthusiasm and a desire to succeed. They run a variety of businesses, some selling meals, cosmetics, and traditional crafts and clothing; and others doing construction, carpentry, and running public transport services. The group's members have a lot of experience in their respective fields: they know that the quality of the goods and services they offer is high while their prices remain reasonable. This loan will be used to buy the materials and tools needed for the group's members to expand and improve their businesses, thus increasing each of their household's income and allowing them to offer a better education and overall quality of life to their children. Most of the group's members have previous experience with communal banking and know how to responsibly manage loans so that every member of the group benefits equally.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
El Sr. Nicolás de 43 años de edad es comerciante y está casado con la Sra Mirta de 34 años de edad, tuvieron 4 hijos: Ana quien es la mayor de 14 años, Liza de 12 años, Rossana de 11  años y Richard de 9 años de edad.
Todos sus hijos siguen  sus estudios gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres quienes trabajan día a día para sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ellos no tuvieron la oportunidad de estudiar.
Nicolás posee una despensa que funciona en su propio domicilio y que hoy día le genera muy buenas ganancias.
Comenzó su actividad en el año 2004, sus comienzos fueron muy difíciles, porque necesitaba  capital de trabajo, y con muchos hijos lo fue aún más.
 Con mucho esfuerzo y la ayuda de toda su familia pudo salir adelante y hoy cuenta con un negocio bien surtido.
  
El Sr. Nicolás solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio con  la compra de lácteos, carne, fideo, cerveza, gaseosa, embutidos, verduras, y otros.
Al tener mayor número de mercaderías piensa que su clientela aumentará, sus ingresos consecuentemente también y por lo tanto podrá obtener una mejor calidad de vida tanto para él como para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Nicolás is a 43 years old businessman and is married to 34 year old Mirta and they have 4 children: 14 year old Ana, 12 year old Liza, 11 year old Rossana, and 9 year old Richard. All of his children ar ein school thanks to the efforts of their parents who work day after day to help their family get ahead, as they did not have the opportunity to study. Nicolás owns a store located in his home and today it generates very good earnings. He began his business in 2004. It was difficult at first because he needed working capital, and with many children even more so. With great effort and the help of his family he was able to be successful and today he has a well-stocked business. Nicolás is seeking a loan to invest in buying products for his business such as dairy products, meat, noodles, beer, soda pop, canned goods, vegetables, and more. When he has more merchandise he believes his customers will grow, and subsequently his income also thereby enabling him to be able to have a better quality of life for him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dairy products, meat, noodles, beer, soda pop, canned goods, vegetables,  etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr: Emmanuel A. est un jeune homme de 27 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est revendeur de chaussures à Lomé. Emmanuel désire avec ces fonds relancer son activité en s’approvisionnant de nouvelles marchandises afin répondre aux besoins sans cesse de la clientèle. Il exerce ce commerce depuis 3 ans et cette activité est sa principale source  de revenus.
texts.en:
Emmanuel A. is a young man of 27, married and the father of one child. He sells shoes in Lomé. Emmanuel wants to use this loan to get his business going again by buying new merchandise so as to respond to the never-ending demands of his clientele. He has been in this business for 3 years and it is his principal source of revenue.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing shoes for resale

loans.name: Babughirana Women’S Group Kabongo Sharon

texts.en: K. Sharon is 23-years of age, married with one child. She also looks after three dependents who are all in schooling. She is a tailor and she has been performing her tailoring business for over three years now. She is going to use the loan to purchase clothing material for school uniforms,traditional wear (bitegi, gomes, etc.) for her customers. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase material for uniforms.

loans.name: Joaquín Antonio

texts.es: Joaquín Antonio A. Y. reside en Ciudad delgado en el departamento de San Salvador. Joaquín tiene 35 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos Joseline de 12 años y Eunice de 2 años de edad. Joaquín posee una chatarrera donde compra a muy bajo precio hierro reciclado para ser reutilizado, el deseo de Joaquín es comprar mas hierro y aluminio para aumentar sus ventas ya que posee buena demanda con fabricas que buscan de su producto es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de este material que luego el ofrece  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Joaquin Antonio A. Yanez lives in Ciudad Delgado in the San Salvador department. Joaquin is 35 years old and lives with his wife and 2 kids: Joseline, who is 12 and Eunice who is 2 years old. Joaquin has a junk yard where he purchases recycled iron at a very low price to be reused. Joaquin's wish is to purchase more iron and aluminum to increase sales since he has steady demand in the factories that ask for his products. This is why he requests this loan for the purchase of material to offer to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of iron and aluminum

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy peanuts to sell

loans.name: Loisith

texts.es:
La señora Loisith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y 06 hijos, 05 que aun dependen de ella.

Con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas preparadas y poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes, sus ventas los realiza a partir de las 6:00 pm. cerca de un colegio y paradero de camionetas interprovinciales, donde hay mucho movimiento.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su negocio y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Loisith, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Loisith belongs to the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 42 years old, married, and has 6 children, 5 of whom are still financially dependent on her.

In order to help with the household income, she came up with the idea of opening a small business selling prepared foods. She gradually gained experience in running her business and soon became known and well-liked by her customers. Her establishment opens at 6am and is located near a school. That particular area experiences a lot of traffic from the interprovincial cargo trucks that pass through the region.

Sra. Loisith continues to serve her customers who frequent her business on a daily basis. She greets them personally with the warmth and kindness that she is known to display.

With her loan of 3000 soles she will buy rice, sacks of sugar, a variety of vegetables, eggs, and cases of chicken. She will also purchase kitchen utensils to replace her current set so that she can provide better service and attention to her customers.

Sra. Loisith feels more secure, is eager to succeed, and has peace of mind thanks to the contribution of Manuela Ramos in helping her fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing meals

loans.name: Vick

texts.en:
Vick is a member of the Sokoni borrower group in Kiboriloni,Kilimanjaro, She is 25 year old woman,she is single.

Vick has owned a Tailoring business  for 5 years. She works 8 hours a day and earns monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Vick`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, She requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more Fabric materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Vick hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Afiavi Honorine

texts.fr: D. Afiavi Honorine est née le 25/02/1977 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Afiavi Honorine est mariée et mère de trois enfants respectivement âgés de 11 ans, 6 ans et 4 ans et respectivement en classe de sixième, CE1 et CI. La famille réside depuis treize ans à Kowégbo, un quartier de la ville de Cotonou. Afiavi Honorine a pour activité principale la vend des tissus, des bijoux, qu'elle live sur commande et à crédit à sa clientèle. Afiavi Honorine a diversifié son activité par la vente de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) et des vivres (haricot, riz, maïs, farine de manioc, etc.). C'est devant sa maison que Afiavi Honorine vend les divers. Afiavi Honorine a été confrontée aux difficultés d’approvisionnement dues à son faible fonds de roulement. C'est pourquoi, elle a recours à ALIDé depuis 2006. Afiavi Honorine a déjà eu quatre crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Afiavi Honorine demande un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Afiavi Honorine D. was born on 25 February 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Afiavi Honorine is married and has three children aged 11, 6, and 4, who are in 6th grade, 2nd grade, and kindergarten, respectively. The family has lived in Kowégbo, a district in the city of Cotonou, for thirteen years. Afiavi Honorine runs as her main business the sale of fabric and jewelry, which she delivers on order and on credit to her clientele. Afiavi Honorine has diversified her business through the sale of various items (sweets, biscuits, cans of milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, food pastes, soap for laundry, dishes, and bathing, batteries, candles, etc.) and food (beans, rice, maize, cassava flour, etc.). It is in front of her house that Afiavi Honorine sells her goods. Afiavi Honorine has faced difficulties in obtaining supplies due to her low working capital. This is why she has been working with ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners) since 2006. Afiavi Honorine has already obtained four loans through ALIDE, all of which she repaid without problems, and with which she was able to raise the standard of her business. To continue developing her business, Afiavi Honorine is seeking a fifth loan to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, jewelry, food items, and other articles

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with two grown children: a 30-year-old daughter and a 25-year-old son. She is an entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. She runs a retail business selling women’s and children’s clothing and footwear. Mariya owned four retail kiosks in the same market called Central Industrial Market. However, a recent fire in a storage where she used to keep all he inventory destroyed most of her merchandise and caused much damage to her business. As a result of fire damage, Mariya currently owns only two kiosks. One of the main attractions of her business is affordable prices. Mariya has been in this business for 12 years. Presently, her monthly income is about 6,000 Grivnyas. 

Mariya is requesting a 12,000 Grivnya loan to purchase 20 women’s suits, 30 blouses and 40 sweat suits. She is hoping to generate additional income and make some savings for upcoming winter when market sales usually go down. One of Mariya’s long-term plans is to open a second vending location.

loans.use: To purchase suits, blouses,and sweat suits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase corn for stockpiling

loans.name: Horl

texts.en: Horl T. is 37 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. Since 2000, she has been making and selling religious tools at the local market to earn a living.  She is able to make about $5 each day, while her husband is a construction worker who is able to make $3.30 every day. This couple has eight children, five of whom are in school and two are employed as garment-factory workers. Horl T. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase materials to make religious tools.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make religious tools

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Venta de frutas, jugos, verduras, ropa y tención de tienda de barrio son los diversos negocios de las integrantes del grupo Emprendedoras, que se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Senkata. Se agruparon por la necesidad de incrementar su capital de trabajo, algunas comprando mercadería, otras comprando insumos. Un claro ejemplo es Alejandra M. casada y madre de 5 niños, que en el pasado había trabajado con Pro Mujer, integrando otro grupo, pero ahora ha vuelto para formar parte de este grupo, porque además del crédito le gusta el ahorro y la atención en el consultorio. Alejandra desde muy pequeña se  dedica a la venta de fruta, en un inicio  ayudando a su madre y ahora  dueña de su propio negocio y piensa invertir el préstamo comprando uva y manzana, ella vende en la zona Máx. Paredes  de la ciudad de La Paz, en un carrito y adquiere su mercadería en la zona El Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz porque es económico.
texts.en:
Members of the Emprendedoras (Enterprising Ones) group are involved in a variety of activities, such as: sale of fruits, juices, vegetables, clothing and tending to neighborhood general stores. They meet every two weeks at the Senkata communal bank. They formed in order to increase their working capital, some to buy merchandise, others to buy ingredients. A clear example is Alejandra M., married with 5 children, who in the past had worked with Pro Mujer in another group, who has returned now to be part of this group because, in addition to the loans, she likes the savings and the care at the health center. Alejandra, from a very young age, has sold fruit; first, as a helper to her mother, and now as owner of her own business. She intends to invest the funds buying grapes and apples. She sells from a little vending cart in the Máx. Paredes area of the city of La Paz and she gets her merchandise in the El Tejar area of the city of La Paz because it is less expensive there.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (grapes and apples).

loans.name: Solanda Adelaida

texts.es:
El banco comunal  Ave Fénix se reúne en un sector retirado de la ciudad donde habitan muchos portovejenses que se dedican a varias actividades, la señora Solanda es una socia fundadora de este banco, dedicada a varias actividades, muy a pesar de su problema de salud ella se enfrenta todos los días a los desafíos de la vida.

La señora Solanda se dedica a la preparación de alimentos por pedidos para fiestas, además de tener en su casa la venta de agua en bidones (envases), vende sabanas,  y alquila departamentos en su casa, cuando el esposo murió ella decidió seguir en el trabajo no cruzo sus brazos y no ha descansado y cada día le va mucho mejor.

Con este nuevo préstamo la señora Solanda invertirá en comprar bidones y viajar a la ciudad de Guayaquil a comprar más sabanas pues tiene varios pedidos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Ave Fénix meets in secluded area of the city where many local people work in a variety of trades. Solanda is a founding member of this bank, and works at various activities, and in spite of her health problems she confronts life's challenges every day. Solanda caters food for parties. In addition, she sells water in jerry cans from her home, sells sheets, and rents rooms in her house. When her husband died, she decided to continue her work rather than crossing her arms, she never rests, and every day things are better for her. With this new loan, Solanda will buy jerry cans and travel to the city of Guayaquil to buy more sheets as she has various orders.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jerry cans and sheets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of mobile telephones

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun K. is 45 years old and lives in Preaek Thum village in Kandal Province. He is the father of five children, all of whom are studying at the local public school. His wife, Mrs. Koem Oraun, is a Khmer cake maker, and is shown on the left of the photo.
Mr. Bunthoeun K. is a rice middleman and also a motorbike taxi driver. Since his rice-selling business is going well, he wants to expand it and is therefore requesting a second loan to buy more rice to resell.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Esmilda Selena

texts.es: Doña Esmilda Selena R. se Dedica a la elaboración de refrescos naturales y venta de hielo y helados, ella es casada con 02 hijas en la universidad con muchas dificultades las ha podido sacar adelante, ella necesita un préstamo para comprar materia prima como son frutas, azúcar, y otros ingredientes que utiliza para hacer sus refrescos además de estos ella vende hielo y helados, tiene 3 años de trabajar con Ceprodel en los cuales ah tenido tres préstamos y estos le han serviso de mucho ya que con uno de ellos lo utilizo para gastos universitarios de su hija ayudándole a que se graduara y así mejorar su condición de vida
texts.en:
Esmilda Selena R. earns a living making natural drinks and selling ice and ice cream. She is married and has 2 daughters who are studying at the university level; after much difficulty she has been able to get ahead. She needs a loan so that she can purchase raw ingredients such as fruits, sugar, and other items that she will use to make beverages, in addition to selling ice and ice cream. She has worked with Kiva partner CEPRODEL for 3 years, and in that time has had 3 loans. These loans have helped her a lot, since she used one loan to pay for one of her daughters' university expenses, which will in turn help her to graduate and thus improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for making natural drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase banana in bulk

loans.name: Gilma

texts.es:
LA SEÑORITA GILMA G., TINE 30 AÑOS Y VIVE EN LA LOCALIDADA DE MIZQUE QUE ESTA A 4 HORAS DE LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA, UN PUEBLO PEQUEÑO DONDE LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA AGRICULTURA, Y GANADERIA.

GILMA TRABAJA LA TIERRA Y TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE LECHE EN EL PUEBLO, ELLA ACTUALMENTE ESTA 
HACIENDO UNA MAESTRIA EN ADMINISTRACION DE EMPRESAS, QUIERE EJERCER SU CARRERA LO MAS ANTES POSIBLE PARAA SI PODER TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR LA CASITA QUE TIENE JUNTO  A SU MAMA Y SU PAPA.LA SEÑORITA GILMA TAMBIEN A SIDO POSTULADA POR UN FRENTE POLITICO PARA OPTAR POR EL CARGO DE CONSEJAL DE MIZQUE, TENIENDO MUCHA OPORTUNIDAD DE GANAR POR LA SIMPATIA Y CARIÑO QUE LE TIENEN, YA QUE SABEN QUE ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA Y QUERENDONA DE SU FAMILIA Y SU PUEBLO.

LA SEÑORITA GILMA SOLICITO EL CREDITO PARA PODER SALIR ADELANTE JUNTO A  SU GANADO Y TIERRA, YA QUE QUIERE CRECER MAS COMO AGRICULTORA Y GANADERA, EL SUEÑO QUE TIENE ELLA ES EL QUE A SU FAMILIA NO LE FALTE NADA, TERMINAR SU MAESTRIA Y QUE SUS TIERRAS SEAN LAS MEJORES DE LA ZONA.
texts.en:
Senorita Gilma G. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mizque, four hours from the city of Cochabamba, it is a small town where the principal activity is agriculture and livestock. Gilma works the land and also sells milk in the town, she is actually working on a Masters in Business Administration. She wants to practice her career as soon as possible so that she is able to finish building the house that she has with her mother and father. Gilma has also been nominated by a political group for office on the Council of Mizque. She has a good opportunity to win due to the kindness and affection that she has, people know that she is a very hard working person and she is loved by her family and town. Gilma is seeking a loan to be able to get ahead with her cattle and land, she already wants to grow more as a farmer. The dream that she has is that her family doesn't lack anything, to finish her MBA and that her land is the best in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food for dairy cows

loans.name: Luan

texts.en:
Luan T. N. (id: 010117090054) is 45 years old and lives in Dai Bi village with her husband and three children.

Luan T. N. has a business breeding pigs and poultry. She is a dynamic women. Sometime, she also does casual work in order to have more income. Her husband is a builder and her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND.

Luan T. N. has borrowed loans from SEDA for five years. This time, she wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND as additional capital for her business breeding pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business breeding pigs and poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es: Roxana Elizabeth R. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para una empresa privada, y es con el ingreso, en gran parte, que él genera que esta familia logra salir adelante. Los pequeños dos hijos D. esta pareja, D. 11 y 12 años D. edad, Alesandra y Rodrigo respectivamente se dedican a estudiar. También habita dentro D. este grupo familiar el suegro D. Roxana, quien a sus 70 años D. edad es un jubilado y ayuda en la atención del pequeño negocio familiar. Roxana posee una librería, en la cual comercializa cuadernos, lápices, borradores, diferentes tipo D. papel, cinta adhesiva y otros más. Así mismo posee una pequeña tienda en la que comercializa productos D. primera necesidad. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, que por contar con muy buena localización, cuenta con muchos clientes fijos, quienes en varias ocasiones buscan ciertos productos que Roxana no posee. Es por esta razón que Roxana desea poder contar con el dinero necesario para poder surtir  la librería y así mismo comprar granos básicos para la tienda, D. esta manera ella podrá satisfacer a sus clientes D. todo lo necesario, y así aumentar sus ventas y ayudar mas a la economía D. su familia.-
texts.en:
Roxana Elizabeth R. D. M. is 34 years old. She lives in Santa Tecla, located in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband who works for a private business. She also lives with her two children, aged 12 and 11, who work, and with her father in law who is retired. Roxana has a book store where she sells notebooks, pencils, erasers, different types of paper, tape and other things. She alsoohas a small store where she sells basic necessities. The business is located in her own home and she has many regular customers. They come on various occasions and look for certain producs they haven't been able to find. This is why Roxanne wishes to have enough money to beable to supply her bookstore and also buy basic grains for the store. This way she will be able to satisfy her clients with everything they need and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for a book store

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Kurmanbubu's Group

texts.ru:
Когда, среди народа, находятся люди, которые посвящают свою жизнь ремеслу, изготовлению разного рода изделий, сёдел, музыкальных инструментов, шитью национальных костюмов и т.д.; и при этом, когда у этих людей, получается, иметь не только моральное удовлетворение, но, а также и конкретную прибыль, становится очевидным, что эти люди заслуживают особого уважения и почтения.  Асыркулова Куманбубу – лидер данной группы. Курманбубу пятьдесят шесть лет. Курманбубу вырастила пятерых детей, и все её дети уже выросли и сами зарабатывают себе на жизнь. Муж Курманбубу – поливальщик, а сама Курманбубу уже двадцать лет занимается изготовлением национальных изделий. Она этому ремеслу научилась у своей матери и сейчас в условиях рынка, Курманбубу научилась находить применение своему таланту и очень успешно реализует свои изделия своим клиентам. Ей удаётся зарабатывать до десяти тысяч сомов в месяц. Учитывая, что её начальный капитал составлял всего лишь около трёхсот сомов, Курманбубу довольно преуспела в своём бизнесе. Сейчас Курманбубу нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить шерсть и краски для производства. 

Партнёры Курманбубу по группе:

Керимовой Майрамбубу пятьдесят восемь. Майрамбубу с мужем вырастили шестерых детей. Все дети уже взрослые и активно помогают родителям по хозяйству. Майрамбубу обратилась за этим кредитом, так как ей нужны средства, чтобы купить ГСМ для посева и семян картошки.

Чокчоевой Шайыр сорок семь лет. Шайыр – вдова и мать восьмерых детей. Старшие дочери замужем. Шайыр научилась у соседки изготавливать национальные изделия и сейчас это ей помогает зарабатывать на жизнь и кормить младших детей. Шайыр очень надеется получить этот кредит, чтобы купить шерсть и краски для производства. 
Акматовой Майрамкул сорок четыре. Майрамкул – мать пятерых сыновей. Муж Майрамкул работает в крестьянском хозяйстве. Майрамкул же продаёт потребительские товары и вместе с мужем содержат скот. Сейчас их доход составляет около восьми тысяч сомов ежемесячно. Майрамкул хочет увеличить товарооборот и надеется сделать это, получив этот кредит и вложив его в бизнес. 

Бекбоевой Арсарбубу пятьдесят пять. Арсарбубу открармливает скот для продажи и тем самым кормит себя и двух своих детей. Она вдова и ей помогает двадцатилетний сын, который и занимается непосредственной продажей скота. Арсарбубу надеется получить этот кредит, чтобы вложить средства в посев земельного участка. 
Агыновой Акжолтой двадцать один год. Она не замужем и сейчас шьёт национальные ковры из войлока, которые носят название «ширдак» и зарабатывает четыре тысячи сомов в месяц. Акжолтой нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить шерсть и краски для производства. В этом деле Акжолтой активно помогает мама. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
When there are people who devote their lives to a craft, making various types things, saddles, musical instruments, sewing national costumes, etc., and when these people can have not only a moral satisfaction, but also a concrete profit, it becomes obvious that these people deserve a special kind of respect and homage. Kurmanbubu A. is the leader of this group. She is fifty-six years old. She raised five children, all of whom are already grown and make their own living. Kurmanbubu’s husband is a waterer, and Kurmanbubu has been involved in making national crafts for twenty years. She learned this craft from her mother, and now Kurmanbubu learned to use her talent in market conditions and successfully sells her crafts to her customers. She is able to earn up to ten thousand som per month. Considering that her starting capital was only about three hundred som, Kurmanbubu is quite successful in her business. Currently, she needs a loan in order to buy wool and dyes for production. Kurmanbubu’s group partners are: Mairambubu K. is fifty-eight years old. Together with her husband, she raised six children, all of whom are already grown and actively help the parents with the business. Mairambubu requested this loan because she needs means to buy fuel for sowing and potato seeds. Shaiyr Choksoeva is forty-seven years old. She is widow and a mother of eight children. The oldest daughters are married. Shaiyr learned how to make national crafts from her neighbor, and now this business helps her earn a living and provide for the younger children. She hopes to obtain this loan in order to buy wool and dyes for production. Mairamkul A. is forty-four years old. She is a mother of five sons. Her husband works at a farm. Mairamkul sells consumer products and keeps livestock with the help of her husband. Their current income is about eight thousand som per month. She wants to increase goods turnover and hopes to do that by obtaining this loan and investing it into the business. Arsarbubu B. is fifty-five years old. She fattens livestock for sale and uses this business to support herself and her two children. She is a widow, and her twenty-year-old son helps her with livestock sales. Arsarbubu hopes to obtain this loan in order to invest it into sowing on a land plot. Akzholtoy A. is twenty-one years old. She is single and currently makes national rugs from felt, called “shirdak.” She earns four thousand som per month. Her mother actively helps her with this business. Akzholtoy needs a loan in order to buy wool and dyes for production.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool and dyes

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR JOSE CARLOS C. G. TIENE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD Y VIVE EN LA ZONA DE SENAC EN EL BARRIO LUIS DE FUENTES DE LA CIUDAD DE TARIJA, JOSE AUN NO ES CASADO NI TIENE HIJOS , VIVE EN LA  CASA   DE SUS PADRES . JOSE DESDE HACE TRES AÑOS QUE TRABAJA EN UNA EMPRESA DE SERVICIOS DE AGUA CON EL CARGO DE ENCARGADO DE MANTENIMIENTO TECNICO DESEMPEÑANDO SUS FUNCIONES CON MUCHA DEDICACION Y RESPONSABILIDAD. 
                                                                                                                                                            JOSE TIENE PENSADO FORMAR UN HOGAR EN UN FUTURO PROXIMO TENER HIJOS Y NIETOS. JOSE SEGUIRA ACOMPAÑANDO A SUS PADRES PORQUE ES EL UNICO HIJO QUE ESTA A SU LADO. EL CREDITO QUE ESTA SOLICITANDO SERA DESTINADO A LA COMPRA DE REPUESTOS DE SU VEHICULO EL CUAL ES SU MAYOR HERRAMIENTA DE TRABAJO OUES LAS DISTANCIAS QUE TIENE QUE RECORRER SON MUY GRANDES PARA REALIZAR LOS TRABAJOS DE MANTENIMIENTO DE SISTEMAS DE AGUA.
                                                                      
JOSE NOS CUENTA QUE SU MAYOR SUEÑO ES PODER DARLES TODA LA COMODIDAD A SUS PADRES PARA QUE SEAN FELICES. TAMBIEN NOS DICE QUE EL PROXIMO CREDITO QUE SOLICITE LO UTILIZARA PARA PODER MEJORAR LAS CONDICIONES DE SU CASA
texts.en:
Jose Carlos is 33 and lives in the Senac area of the Luis de Fuentes neighborhood in Tarija. Jose is single with no children, and lives with his parents. For the past three years Jose has worked for an aqueduct in charge of technical maintenance with great dedication and responsibility. Jose has plans to form a family soon and have children and grandchildren. Jose will stay with his parents as he is the only child caring for them. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy replacement parts for his vehicle, which is his most important work tool since he needs to travel vast distances to perform maintenance on the aqueduct. Jose tells us that his dream is to provide everything his parents need to be happy. He also tells us that the next loan he requests will be for home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work Vehicle Maintenance

loans.name: Erlany

texts.en:
Erlany C. is from the village of Old Damulog, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Erlany is single. To make a living, Erlany owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Erlany has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlany joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlany has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Erlany is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Erlany from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Eleanora S. was born in Gavrilovka village (Chui oblast), where she still lives. Eleanora is 36 years old. She grew up in a low-income family, which is why she was unable to continue her studies after graduating from high school and began to help her parents with housework. When she was 27, Eleanora married and gave birth to a son one year later. Now her son is already 8 and studies in a rural school. Eleanora works as a freelance associate editor at the local rural newspaper “Narodnaya Tribuna” (The Peoples’ Tribune). Eleanora’s husband works as a security guard. Their income is hardly enough for their small family.

Like many other people in the village, Eleanora and her husband decided to do animal husbandry. With initial capital of only 15,000 Kyrgyz Soms, the family bought a cow in 2001. With the first earnings from the sale of milk, the family finally reached a stable income. Now Eleanora wakes up without worrying where to get money to feed her family, provide her son with clothes and prepare him for school. 

Eleanora's parents helped her buy a house in the same village. After getting her own home Eleanora pondered over the expansion of her business. Her son is getting older and to allow him to study at a good university, she needs to start saving money today. Eleanora wants to use her loan of 80,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy another cow to increase milk production, as well as 4 bull-calves and 5 sheep for fattening and resale. 

This hard-working and optimistic woman would like to have another child and sign up her son to a sports section and give him a good education. Because all of this is very costly, Eleanora plans to significantly expand her business in order to always wake up in the morning with confidence and "a penny in her pocket”.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Kiva borrowers benefit from a 5% discount on the interest rate if they pay back without delay.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, bulls and sheep

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda G., 60, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Edito G. and they are blessed in their marriage. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own direct-selling business of undergarments, clothing and cosmetics for the past few years.

Rosalinda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her direct-selling business.

To ensure the success of her business, Rosalinda would like to apply for a PHP 14,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business, enabling her to buy advance orders for the customers of her direct-selling line.

Rosalinda dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy advance orders for the customers of her direct-selling line

loans.name: Lemeloi Ole

texts.en:
Lemeloi has been buying cattle, fattening them, and selling them later at a profit in Naivasha town for the last four years. He is 27 years old, is married to Mayia Ene Terepe, and they have three children.

Lemeloi was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the money to buy more cattle which he will sell in the future at a profit.

Lemeloi also plans to start processing animal skins and hides to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun C., 34, is a professional handicraft-maker living in Takeo province. Since 2005, she has been using beads and other materials to make flowers on women's clothes or pillows to earn a living and typically making US$ 1 each day. Her husband, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver. On average, he makes US$ 4 in profit a day. This couple has four children living at home to support. Bun C. is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a trailer for her husband to attach to his motorbike so that he can transport several people in one time.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike trailer

loans.name: Royal Family Group

texts.en:
Marol Y., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Royal Family. She is 22 years old, is single, and has three children between the ages of nine months and 8 years. She is a college freshman.

For three years, Marol has been selling sugar, red oil, and rice in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 26,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 62,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more sugar, red oil, and rice to sell.

Marol describes herself as a trustworthy woman whose dream is to improve her business, build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, red oil, and rice to sell

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom C., 60, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. C. and her husband grow rice and raise animals, earning an income of USD 2.50 each per day, and two of her children are employed at a factory, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Every month the family has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 5 on their electricity supply, and USD 25 on their children’s education.

C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty N. currently sells beer. She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase more crates of beer to sell. Betty is 28 years old; she is married to a businessman. She has three children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: purchasing more crates of beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jessenia Annabel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco La Nueva California.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jessenia, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 10 años que está estudiando en la escuela. Su marido es Ing. Eléctrico.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo. También vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y la ropa compra en una distribuidora.

Este crédito es para invertir más en su negocio y además para comprar sabanas que sus clientes le piden y quiere también vender estos productos. Está en el Banco Comunal  hace tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para sacar su negocio adelante. Su sueño es comprar un carro para visitar a sus clientes con más comodidad.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank, "Banco La Nueva California," meet every two weeks in the La California neigbhorhood of Portoviejo, Manabí capital, known for many years as the city of Royal Tamarinds (by the number of trees in the area).

Here we met Jessenia, who is 36 years old and maintains a common-law relationship.  From the relationship she has a 10 year old son who is studying in school.  Her husband is an electrial engineer.

She is a homemaker who sells clothing by catalog to have her own resources.  She also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accesories for women).  She works three days a week, leaving her products on credit and charging every week or every two depending on what her customers want.  She receives her products at home and buy clothes at a distributor.

This loan is to invest more in her business and also to buy bedding that she would also like to sell because her customers ask for it.  She has been in the communal bank for the last three cycles and enjoys the support they give her to take her business forward.  Her dream is to buy a car to visit her clients more comfortably.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, clothing, and bedding.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a forty-six-year-old married man with five children living in their own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His aspiration is having all his children graduate and work in reputable institutions. He is a poultry farmer and has been in the business for four years.  He has been able to increase the number of chicks almost every month. Patrick intends to use the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Paying school fees for his children

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly T. is a widow who lives in Prk. 9 Acco, Brgy. Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and a food vending business. 

Nelly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 24 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nelly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 25th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to buy more stocks of goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future needs of her family.  Nelly T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El joven Juan Manuel S. Figueredo, es soltero sin hijos, tienen un local de ventas de Bebidas varias y anexo recarga de Tigo Personal y Claro, su negocio esta ubicado cerca del mercado municipal número 2 lo cual le asegura una clientela variada. Es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta. Le ayuda su madre día y noche la cual con sacrificio monto el negocio.
Solicito apoyo crediticio para la compra de mercaderías como gaseosas, vinos, cervezas, golosinas, minicargas, etc. para aumentar su stock porque en esta época empieza a aumentar la demanda.
El señor Juan Manuel agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad brindada porque gracias a eso él podrá seguir dando abasto a sus clientes, y de esa forma poder seguir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel S. Figueredo is single and doesn't have any kids. He has a business selling various drinks and a reload station for Tigo, Personal and Claro [cell phone companies]. His business is located close to the municipal market number two, which assures him a varied clientele. He is a very hard worker and an honest person. His mom helps him day and night with the mounting sacrifice of the business. 

He requests a loan for the purchase of merchandise such as soda, wine, beer, sweets, cell phone reloading, etc. to increase his stock because this season is when demand increases.

Juan Manuel appreciates Fundación Paraguaya [Paraguayan Foundation] and Kiva for the opportunity offered, because thanks to them, he can have products for his clients. This way he can continue improving his standard of life.

loans.use: Purchase of candy, beer, soda, juice, etc.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang R., age 52, is married with two children, both of whom are single and attending school. She is a domestic rice trader who owns a rice hulling machine inside her home. She provides rice milling services to her neighbors. She also buys rice for milling in bulk at a reasonable cost, and sells the finished rice to people for income. Usually, she generates around $6 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family.  Her husband has worked in the farming business since 2005. This rice harvesting season Heang R. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store for selling, and to continue their farming.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice to store for selling, and to continue farming.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is married and lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by a general store and an electronic re-loading business. Her husband Jaime B., who is 68 years old, is a retired employee. She has five children who are between 35 and 40 years old. Four of them have families and one is working to help her. Sherlita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sherlita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell to save up for home appliances and home repair. Sherlita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gulchahira

texts.en:
Gulchahira R.  is 46 years old. She was born into a family of farmers and since childhood has been engaged in cattle breeding. Gulchahira married early and became the mother of four children.  Her  family is very united, where all members help and support each other.

To find a means of subsistence for her family, Gulchahira began her business in cattle breeding and land cultivating. Owing to her wide experience in these  activities, she managed to develop her farm successfully.  Currently, she grows barley and clover, and has two cows on her farm whose milk she sells to the local dairy farm.  

With the revenue from these activities, Gulchahira was able to give her children a good education. Now, Gulchahira plans to use this loan for 50,000 KGS to purchase two bull calves to fatten and resell. With the revenue from this investment, she plans to give a dowry to her daughter. 

In the future, Gulchahira plans to maintain a big farm with a large number of cattle. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase two bull calves

loans.name: Alicia Angelica

texts.es:
Alicia, de 61 años, vive al lado de su esposo Aníbal (61), que es profesor, y de sus dos hijos mayores de edad. 

Esta empeñosa mujer se dedica, desde hace 18 años, a la repartición de comida en un comedor popular de su zona, empieza al mediodía y termina a las dos  de la tarde, además  dice que le gusta mucho esta labor pues esta acostumbrada y es muy conocida por las buenas raciones que brinda. Además, desde las seis de la tarde, todos los días  instala una pequeña parrilla afuera de su casa y empieza con la venta de trozos de pollo y carne a la parrilla, junto a su hija menor, y esta muy satisfecha pues tiene muchos comensales a diario es por esta razón que obtiene regulares ganancias. Alicia tiene muchos planes para el futuro y uno de ellos es comprar una pequeña máquina productora de panes con hot dogs calientes para empezar este productivo negocio junto a su nuera. 

Alicia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de una máquina productora de panes con hot dog calientes pues quiere mejorar sus ganancias para terminar de construir su casa de material noble.

Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Alicia, 61, lives with her husband, Aníbal, 61, who is a professor, and her two adult children.

This dedicated woman has been selling food in a popular eatery in her neighborhood for 18 years.  She starts at noon and finishes at two in the afternoon.  She says she enjoys the work very much because she’s used to it and is very well known thanks to the good portions she provides.  Besides, from six in the evening on she sets up a small grill outside her house and starts to sell grilled chicken and meat daily with her youngest daughter.  She is very satisfied because she gets lots of diners daily and this produces regular profits.  Alicia has lots of plans for the future.  One of them is buying a small machine that produces hot dogs and hot bread to start this productive business with her daughter-in-law.

Alicia plans to use the requested funds to buy a machine that makes hot bread and hot dogs because she wants to improve her profits in order to finish building her house with substantial materials.

This is her 4th loan with MFP and she promises to repay on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who make the money possible that will allow her to stay in business in search of progress.

loans.use: For a hot dog machine.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su pareja Fernando de 35 años y sus tres pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Desde hace dos años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una marca reconocida. Esta muy satisfecha con su labor pues le permite cuidar de sus hijos y obtener ganancias no solo de la venta de sus productos si no también de los electrodomésticos que gana por el puntaje de sus pedidos. Antes trabajaba en una empresa, pero cuando tuvo su primer hijo decidió dedicarse por completo a cuidarlo y así emprendió este negocio que le genera regulares ganancias. Ella ofrece mediante los catálogos a sus amigas y conocidas, luego les trae los pedidos para que le paguen a crédito; además compra productos de belleza cuando están en promoción, los tiene un tiempo en stock para venderlos al precio real. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un bazar donde ofrezca sus productos y también útiles escolares, pues por la zona donde vive no  existe competencia. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible  este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Maribel tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de productos de belleza, y perfumes pues quiere tenerlos en stock ya que tiene varios pedidos pendientes.
texts.en: Maribel, 35 years old, lives in her own house along with her partner Fernando, 35 years old, and their three small children. Every day they make an effort together to get ahead. For the last two years this enterprising woman has worked selling the beauty products of a recognized brand. She is very satisfied with her job as it allows her to take care of her children and make a profit, no only from the sale of her products but as well from the household appliances she earns from her order points. She used to work in a company but when she had her first child she decided to dedicate herself completely to taking care of him and that is how she started this business which regularly generates profit. She sells through catalogues to her friends and acquaintances and then brings them their orders for which they pay by credit. As well, she buys beauty products when they are on sale and keeps them in stock for a while to sell them at regular price. Since she is an enterprising woman, she has planned for the future to install a variety store where she can offer her products as well as school supplies, since there is no competition in the zone where she lives. This is the second loan she has had with MFP and promises to make her repayments punctually as she doesn't want to make a bad impression on the people who made possible the contribution which will allow her to continue working in search of progress. Maribel is planning to invest this loan in the purchase of a number of beauty products and perfumes as she wants to have them in stock because she has several pending orders.

loans.use: To stock up on beauty products

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SACSAYHUAMAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Cesar; el tiene 41 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía el elabora todo lo que son nacimientos del niño Jesús el trabaja desde su casa y ahí lo buscan sus clientes para comprar sus diseños, él socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le gusta mucho lo que realiza.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para la realización de sus trabajos como yeso, harina, esmaltes entre otros.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Cesar belongs to the Sacsayhuaman Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Cesar is 41 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  He alternates his daily activities with his business of making handicrafts.  He makes everything about the birth of Jesus.  He works from his house, and his customers look for him there in order to buy his designs.  He has had this business for years, and he really likes what he does.

Cesar is requesting the loan to buy work materials like plaster, flour, and glaze, among others.

He is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy work materials like plaster, flour, and glaze, among others

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria B., 54, exerts her best efforts as she manages two micro-businesses at the same time. Her poor educational background of not being able to reach college doesn’t factor much into her current position, considering the amount of entrepreneurial training and Biblical encouragement she receives from CCT*. Victoria is married to Leonardo, part of the maintenance personnel. They have two children; one is in college while the other is in elementary school. They presently reside at Sta. Cruz 1, Dasmariñas, Cavite. 

Running a "carinderia" (food stall) is Victoria’s daily task. Often, she prepares the menu and cooks the meals. She also does the serving, as she has no employees at present. She is quite knowledgeable about her customers’ preferences, based on her seven years of experience in this kind of business. Also, she sells "Yakult" (is a Japanese probiotic milk-like product made by fermenting a mixture of skimmed milk with a special strain of the bacterium Lactobacillus casei Shirota) drinks to her neighbors. Altogether, she is able to earn PHP 8,000 as a net income monthly.

She exerts another effort to level up her business in terms of applying for a loan amounting to PHP 11,000. This will greatly help her grow her business. It will enable her to purchase quality ingredients and expand the meals she cooks for her customers. Improvement of facilities and utensils will be paid attention to as well. Victoria acknowledges that the loan will impact the profitability of her business and will allow her to save up for future use.

It is Victoria’s desire to be successful and for her family to have a better standard of living. That is why no matter how hard the challenges are she strives to give her best efforts to attain the best she can be.  As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she has received.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare additional meals.

loans.name: Mary Wanjiru

texts.en:
Mary, 56 years old, has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past four years. She sells her products at the local market. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and on time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nidia Mercedes

texts.es: Nidia Mercedes tiene 34 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Tiene más de 6 años en este negocio ha logrado obtener una gran experiencia por la gran cantidad de clientes que tiene. Ella tiene un hijo menor de edad, la ayuda a su Mama en lo que puede y sale a ofrecer sus productos con ella. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes para niños y formales.
texts.en: Nidia Mercedes is 34 years old and she sells clothing and cosmetics. She has been in this business for over six years and has been able to gain a great deal of experience due to her large number of customers. She has one young son who helps his mother however he can, going out with her to sell her products. The requested loan is for buying pants, shirts, skirts, suits for children, and formal suits.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits for children, and formal suits

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger — a Mongolian yurt — in Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband is a carpenter who manages a business making woodenproducts. Her older son, age 18, goes to a college while the younger one, age 8, is in secondary school. She sells vegetables at a rented stall at a local market. She started the business with working capital of 200,000 MNT in 1999. Since then her business has been quite successful, which allowed her to increase her working capital to 2,000,000 MNT. With her earnings she feeds her family and pays the education fees of her children. She is planning to buy a plot of land in order to build storage for preserving harvested vegetables. Bolormaa is a polite and well-known businesswoman in her town. She says, "I want my children to be educated and have better jobs in the future." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more potatoes and onions for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes and onions

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 35 years old and lives in the Gardnersville area; he’s single and has no children. For the past six years Shadrack has been running a mini shop where he sells many items (Cosmetic, Footwear, rice, milk, etc). One of the main problems he faces is that he has low capital to build up his business.

Shadrack is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice for his business. He plans to advance his business and take care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice for his business.

loans.name: Serphine

texts.en:
Serphine is 36 years old and is married.  She runs a boutique in Mikindani, Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for the last three years. 

Serphine has been a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase bales of clothes and shoes to sell in her business.  The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to support her family. Her dream is to own several outlets in the future.

loans.use: purchase clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Grossiste d’eau  minérale mise en sachet appelée chez « PURE  WATER » depuis 2008. Mariama s’approvisionne chez les producteurs de l’eau  et revend à la maison. Son mari est tôlier et ils ont en charge 03 enfants.
texts.en: Since 2008, Mariama has been a wholesaler of mineral water sold in bags of the "Pure Water" brand. She buys from the producers and resells the water from her home. Her husband is a sheet metal worker and they care for three children.

loans.use: to buy mineral water

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Fortunata nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 67 años de edad. Actualmente, Fortunata vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y tiene dos hijos y donde desarrolla sus actividades. Fortunata es cesante de educación pero ahora se dedica  a hacer manualidades ósea teja chompas para niños, bebes, damas y caballeros. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana, hilos y otras más.
texts.en:
Fortunata's peers invited her to participate in Asociación Arariwa's "Chaska" communal bank because of her qualities as a hard-working and responsible person.

Fortunata tells Asociación Arariwa that she was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and is 67 years old. Currently, she lives and works in the same city where she was born and has two children. Fortunata used to work in education but now works making handicrafts such as knit sweaters for children, babies, women, and men. She has been doing this work for several years and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

At this time, she needs a loan to buy wool, thread, and other materials.

loans.use: to buy materials like wool and thread

loans.name: Kichangani Group

texts.en:
Fransis, who is in his mid-40s, is married and has four children who are still at school. He has been running two businesses, a hardware shop and a a general store. He works from 6 a.m to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Fransis' 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to expand the hardware shop and to pay school fees and household expenses. He has repaid all his loans successfully. Fransis hopes for a loan to increase his general store inventory. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Fransis will share this loan with his group "Kichangani" which consists of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To increase his store's inventory.

loans.name: Porn

texts.en: Porn, 40 years old, is a security guard with her husband in a casino. Their income is $8 per day. She has one child who is 12 years old and still studying at school. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $7 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work with her husband. In the future, she wants to sell grocery goods at home when she has enough money. For her daughter, she wants to send her to learn a skill after she finishes high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to travel

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 31 years old and married to Miriam. He supports a family of six people. Evans has been doing horticultural farming for four years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. He has been loaned KES 40,000, which he invested in his farming activities to buy pesticides and a knapsack for spraying them.

Evans plans to use the anticipated profit from his farm to expand the irrigation scheme of his vegetables, onions and tomatoes. He has repaid his first loan and this is his second one. He hopes to become an excellent farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and a knapsack for spraying them

loans.name: Catalina Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Catalina tiene 29 años, es madre soltera con un hijo de 3 años de edad. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de mercadería en general tal como ropa, zapatos cosméticos, útiles escolares, etc. La señora empezó este negocio cuando tuvo a su primer hijo, buscando una fuente alternativa de ingresos con que brindarle una manutención necesaria a su niño pequeño.
