Cabe señalarse, ella trabaja en una zona franca desde hace dos años, y ella aprovecha trabajar allí para distribuir sus productos con sus compañeros de trabajo. Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar unas compras de sus artículos, principalmente artículos escolares, ya que desea aprovechar las ventas que se aproximan.
texts.en:
Catalina is 29 years old. She is a single mother with a 3 year old child. She has a business selling general goods such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, school supplies, etc. She began this business when she had her first child, looking for a different source of income to provide child support for her little one.

It should be pointed out that she has worked in a free trade zone for two years. She takes advantage of working there to distribute her merchandise with her colleagues. She is currently seeking a loan in order to buy some items, mostly school supplies to take advantage of coming sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetics and school supplies.

loans.name: Muloma Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinace Turst is very pleased to present to you this group of entrepreneurs from the city of Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of 800,000 SLL for each in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Kadiatu, the leader of this group of entrepreneurs, is 37 years old, married to a trader, and the mother of two children, one in primary school and the other not yet of school age. A native of Kenema, Kadiatu sells market food – margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), rice, sugar, bulgur wheat, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now, and with her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy margi, rice, sugar, bulgur wheat, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida, tres de sus seis hijos, y un nieto. Sus tíos le enseñaron a ganarse el pan de cada día como agricultor, y actualmente tiene 20 años de desempeñar esta labor. Anteriormente el trabajaba como jornalero.

Para comprar sus insumos don Leonardo debe caminar cinco kilómetros y luego abordar un bus que recorre otros dos kilómetros. Luego, él paga un carro para que lo lleve a su casa ya con los productos comprados. El viaje completo demora mas o menos tres horas ida y vuelta. Este viaje lo hace dos veces al año, en mayo y agosto, cuando es época de cultivación.

Don Leonardo esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de una yunta de bueyes, debido a que se aproxima la temporada de recolección de las cosechas de maíz que el produce. Con la nueva yunta de bueyes él podrá sacar la cosecha de manera mas rápida, ya que podrá sacar el doble de producto en un solo viaje. Adicionalmente, con la nueva yunta Don Leonardo prestará sus servicios de acarreo y arado de tierra a las personas de su comunidad. Con mayor eficiencia, y los ingresos adicionales mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia. De igual forma, él siente que ayudará a las personas de su comunidad prestándoles un servicio que les ayudará a tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 57 years old, lives with his life partner, three of their seven children, and one grandson. His uncles taught him to earn his daily bread as a farmer, and now he has been doing that work for 20 years. Previously he worked as a day laborer.

To buy his supplies, Leonardo must walk five kilometers and then get on a bus that goes another two kilometers. Then, he hires a car to take him to his house along with his purchases. The entire journey takes about three hours round trip. He makes this trip twice a year, in May and August, when it’s planting season. 

Leonardo is asking for a loan from Fundación Campo to buy a team of oxen for the upcoming corn crop that he grows. With the new team of oxen he will be able to harvest the corn more quickly which means he will be able to double his product in one trip. Also, with the new oxen Leonardo will rent his hauling and plowing services to people in the community. With more efficiency and additional income he will improve the quality of life for his family. By the same token, he feels he will help the people of his community by providing them a service that will help them get more income.

loans.use: to buy a team of oxen

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and a father of two children.

Raed has been an owner of a bookshop since 2004, selling books, office supplies and stationery. He has a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well-known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to purchase additional inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Sotheara

texts.en: Sotheara, 25 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a worker who earns $3 per day. They have one child who is 5 years old. Every month, Sotheara has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a plot of land for farming. She wants to get a new career but now she doesn't know what she wants to do because she doesn’t have enough money.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for farming.

loans.name: Imelda Doraliza

texts.es:
Imelda Doraliza tiene 59 años de edad es viuda tiene una hija vive con la hija en el Cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

Imelda  se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, soya y cacao las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insumos, abonos  para los cultivos. 
Con la ayuda del préstamo mejorará la calidad del producto, Enfrenta desafíos que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas a los cultivos.

El sueño es llegar a tener una finca para poder sembrar lo que necesite.
En los tiempos libres le gusta le gusta cuidar mucho de los cultivos
texts.en:
Imelda Doraliza is 59, a widow, and has a daughter. She lives with her daughter in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  Imelda is a farmer, and grows corn, soy beans and cacao. She carries out her purchases and sales in San José del Tambo, every weekend. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers and agricultural supplies for her crops. With the help of the loan, she will improve the quality of her product. She very often faces challenges, such as competition, and crop pests.   

Her dream is to eventually have a large farm to grow what she needs. In her free time she likes to take very good care of her crops.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, and agricultural supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 38-year-old married man and is an owner of a grocery store. Hassan is a hard worker; he improves his living and his business. Through four loan cycles from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, he has been a good standing borrower and at the same time, they reflected positively on his social and financial situations.

Hassan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to start a new trade that will increase his income through selling mobile prepaid cards, which are highly requested in his area. 

Hassan will also start distributing bread early in the morning to make sure that his family's needs are met. Hassan hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can through introducing new products to his customers.

loans.use: to start selling prepaid mobile cards

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is taking another Kiva loan of Kshs 40,000 to improve his business. 

With the loan, he wants to purchase bundles of oranges, cassava, coconuts, and mangoes to boost his fruit selling business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of oranges, cassava, coconuts, and mangoes.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Josie has a shop that sells Tupperware products. She has had this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of Tupperware to sell. 

Josie joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Josie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of Tupperware to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es de la ciudad de Itá, tiene 68 años de edad, vive acompañada con el señor Amado, tiene 8 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes a ella.
La misma posee 4 vacas lecheras, gallinas y cerdos. Nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de leche, carne de cerdo y huevos hace varios años, su cónyuge es albañil. Ambos se ayudan por medio de su trabajo para poder sacar adelante la casa y de esa forma poder tener una vejez digna. El sueño de ella es poder seguir creciendo y tener más animales, es por ello que solicita el crédito.
Desea el crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera, con lo cual podrá aumentar su producción de leche. Agradece la oportunidad dada a kiva y a la fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca lives in the city of Itá.  She is 68 and lives with her common-law husband, Amado.  She has eight adult children who live independently.

She has four dairy cows, chickens and pigs.  For several years she has been selling milk, pork and eggs.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  They work together to provide for the household and prepare for retirement.  Her dream is to continue growing and have more livestock, therefore she is requesting the loan.

She plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production.  She is grateful for this opportunity from Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mr. Chim, 41, is a married man who has been residing in Baray district. He is not working in a well-paid job; presently he operates a firewood-selling business. Everyday he has to collect the firewood from other places or buy in bulk from his frequent suppliers, then he takes them to sell through the commune and local markets by using a buffalo to haul his trailer. His wife also helps him in earning income through a micro pig-raising business. Mr. Chim has four single children who depend on his income. 

Recently Chim has hired some local construction laborers to fix some broken parts of his house. Chim now wants to acquire some funds to complement his existing capital to pay for the construction fees. He feels very happy to see his house completely repaired. He hopes that it’ll provide his family with a more comfortable place to live.

loans.use: to pay for construction fees

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old and married with four children. 

Gloria is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Gloria has been raising ducks for 5 years now, and has borrowed in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos un productor de bebida muy popular en el sector llamada chibcha, la cual por su diferentes sabores y bajo costo es muy demanda entre los habitantes del sector. Gracias a la buena acogida de su producto Carlos ha podido brindarles un hogar a su pareja, estudio y alimentación a los 3 hijos que tiene con ella. 
Su principal sueño es poder tener una casa propia y asegurar los estudios universitarios de sus tres hijos y para ello quiere hacer de su producto el más consumido en su barrio, obteniendo ingresos que le permitan darle forma a sus sueños ya sea comprando ladrillo, por ladrillo para su casa, todo lo anterior lo piensa lograr con ayuda de un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de frutas en grandes cantidades para bajar el costo de la materia prima y pueda obtener mayor rentabilidad en la venta de sus bebidas.
texts.en:
Carlos is a producer of the local popular drink called chibcha. Due to the different flavors and the low cost it is in demand amongst the inhabitants of the area. Thanks to the warm reception of his product Carlos has been able to provide a home for his wife and food and education for the 3 children he has had with her.

His main dream is to have his own house and assure the university education of his three children. So he wants to make his product the most popular in his neighborhood. This would generate revenues that would permit him to bring his dream to life, even if it is buying one brick at a time to build his house. He thinks he can achieve all this with help of a loan which he will invest in buying great quantities of fruit to lower the cost of his raw material and increase the profit he gets from the sale of his drinks.

loans.use: to buy fruit in large quantities to produce the drink called "chibcha".

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is the group leader of her group in Webuye District and she is representing 10 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of one child. Mary joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 20 years.

Like many other farmers, Mary decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

Mary's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 4.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights, as, even though Mary decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and repair her pig pen.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending business.

Nelma dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and repair her pig pen.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Madam Comfort L. sells utensils. She carries her wares in a small tray on her head and moves from one place to another. It is her desire to own a shop and sell more of the utensils. She is therefore seeking a loan of $950.00 from Kiva. She is also very hardworking and will put this loan to good use.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Edith Maribel

texts.en:
"I began work on the construction of a room a year ago, but because of the lack of funds I cannot continue, my home only has 2 rooms, the bathroom and the kitchen and there is not enough space for our family of 6. I am asking for a loan of $1,200.00 dollars to be able to finish this project."

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

“Hace 1 año empecé con la construcción de un cuarto pero debido a la falta de dinero ya no puede seguir, mi casa tiene solo 2 cuartos, el baño y la cocina así es que no hay suficiente espacio ya que somos 6 de familia”. Solicito 1,200.00 dlls para terminar la construcción.

loans.use: Finish the construction of one room.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 24 years old and has a restaurant in Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1200 to purchase an oven and new furniture for the restaurant. He lives with his mother and father. He wants to enhance his living standard and develop his restaurant.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase oven and purchase new furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Investing in the purchase of an industrial kitchen, tables and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Gurikhan

texts.en: Gurikhan B. and her husband (her husband is pictured) own and operate a small tea house in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Gurikhan was born in the Russian Federation territory of Dagistan in 1968 and then moved to Khachmaz. Gurikhan and her husband have been operating this tea house for the last ten years and have two children together. They are currently requesting a loan of $500 so that they can purchase new equipment for their tea house.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her tea house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his milk business

loans.name: Nabweru South B-2079(I) Group

texts.en: Robina is 30 years old and divorced with three children. She has a charcoal business but sells at retail level. She intends to use the extra profits to reinvest in the business so that it can grow. Teopista sells hardware equipment and wants to use the loan to add inventory. Sarah sells fruits and vegetables. Cate wants to use the loan to buy a fridge so as to improve her juice business. Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her business and start selling at wholesale level

loans.name: Kisura

texts.en:
Kisura is 40 years old and is single with one child aged 18 years old. Kisura sells clothes, a business she started in 2001. She works every day from 6 am to 6 pm at her business.

In the past, Kisura has taken out loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Tukae

texts.en:
Tukae is 31 years old and is married woman. Tukae owns a small pharmacy, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $23 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her pharmacy

loans.name: Elvia Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Elvia Rosa R. L. belongs to the group Mientras Tanto "La Union hace la Fuerza" lives in the San Martin Region, San Martin Province, Tarapoto District. She resides in the Jr. Amorarca #228 where her grocery store business is also located.

The opportunity of a loan with Manuela Ramos has allowed her to open this business that she has always planned. She is also dedicated to rent rooms at her dwelling. With the 1,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy general groceries like: sacks of rice and sugar, boxes of milk and others, also some furniture since the one she has now belonged to a previous business.

She is 42 years old, has 4 children, lives with her husband and 2 of the children still depend on her. She has her family's support in developing her business and servicing her customers

Translated from Spanish by Maria R.-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elvia Rosa Ramírez León pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “La Unión hace la Fuerza” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Amorarca Nº 228 donde también esta ubicado su negocio de venta de abarrotes – bodega. La oportunidad de un préstamo en Manuela Ramos le ha permitido aperturar este negocio, que siempre lo tenía planificado, también se dedica a alquilar cuartos en su mismo domicilio. Con el crédito por S/. 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: abarrotes en general como: arroz, azúcar, en sacos leche en cajas y otros, ya que los muebles tenía de un negocio anterior. La señora Elvia tiene 42 años, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su esposo y 2 de sus hijos que dependen de ella, tiene el apoyo de su familia en el desarrollo de su negocio en cuanto a la limpieza y atención a los clientes.

loans.use: She will buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia is a widowed 42 year old teacher. She has three children who are studying in elementary school, high school, and the university. Her parents help to support her as she works as a teacher in a rural area teaching multiple grades. She has served as a teacher for 20 years and she stays the entire week in the area where she works. She asked for a transfer from an urban area since she earns a better salary in rural areas. Her parents help to take care of her children. She is a very responsible, honest and dedicated woman who provides a great service for children who have no opportunity to study in the city.

Ms. L. would like to add an additional bedroom to her parents’ home, since she does not own her own home. Due to her small salary and the costs of her children’s studies, it is impossible for her to get her own home. With this loan, she would like to provide better living conditions for her children. She had wanted to continue her own studies, but upon the death of her husband, she decided to focus on her children and their studies since she believes that is the best inheritance she can leave them. With their studies and knowledge, they will be able to face life head on, since their knowledge can’t be sold and will never end.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La profesora Lucrecia de 42 años es viuda, tiene 3 hijos estudiando primaria, secundaria y universidad. Recibe el apoyo de sus padres, ya que ella trabaja como maestra en la zona rural atendiendo multigrados, tiene 20 años de servicio y permanece toda la semana en la zona de trabajo. Nno ha solicitado su traslado a la zona urbana debido a que en la parte rural tienen mejor salario, sus hijos son cuidados por sus padres; es una persona responable, honesta y dedicada a brindar el pan de la enseñanza a niños y niñas que no tienen la posibilidad de estudiar en la ciudad. La Sra. L. realizara la construccion de un dormitorio anexo en casa de sus papás, ya que ella no posee vivienda, pues con el bajo salario y el estudio de sus hijos no es posible llegar a obtener una vivienda, con este credito quiere darle una mejor comodidad a sus hijos. Sus deseos fueron continuar con sus estudios, pero al quedarse viuda prefirio apoyar a sus hijos ya que considera que la mejor herencia que puede dejarles es lo que aprendan porque con ello podran hacerle frente a la vida ya que los conocimientos, no se venden, ni se terminan.

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Sokneng

texts.en: Mrs. Sokneng S. is a farmer in Snam Pok village in Kampong Speu province. Her husband, Mr. Thy Not, is also a farmer. Mrs. Sokneng S. wants to start a pig-selling business. She is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike to transport the pigs that she will sell door-to-door as well as pigs to sell. Mrs. Sokneng S. has four children, one of whom is attending school while the remaining three are at home because they are young. Her husband is also pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike in order to sell pigs door-to-door

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 52 years old, married, and has three children. The living conditions of her family are difficult, and she has therefore decided to start a business of selling corn dough, used to prepare banku, kenkey, and other local dishes. Charity needs a loan to be able to buy bags of maize during the harvest season to avoid price hikes later. By selling corn dough, she hopes to increase her family's income and future savings. Charity is a member of the group called Gospel Light whose members agree to provide a guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of maize for making corn dough

loans.name: Mery, Gladys Y Sofia Group

texts.es:
Mery, Gladys and Sofia are members of the Banco Comunal Manatial community bank.

Mery is married, is 36 years old and has 2 children. She makes hamburgers, cakes, and appetizers that she makes at home using her small gas oven. She started her business in Lima and she works constantly to proviD. more variety in her desserts. Her sales are mainly to stores, restaurants and cafes.

Gladys is married, is 37 years old and has 2 children. Gladys travels to the markets twice per week where she sells her clothing but there, she also purchases cheeses that she then resells to the market in Nery. In addition Gladys has an alfalfa plantation and she sells her product also in the markets.

Sofia is married, is 41 years old and has 6 children. Sofia travels to the markets in the region where she sells groceries. And while she's at the markets she also purchases cheeses, cereals, and chicken and she then resells her purchases in the markets of Ayacucho.

The greatest dream from Mery, Gladys and Sofia are to have a large pastry shop, a clothing store, and a to see their children attend school so that they may see a better life than they have./p>

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Mery, Gladys y Sofia son social del Banco Comunal Manantial.

Mery es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Mery se dedica a la elaboración D. tortas, queques, bocaditos, que prepara en su casa para lo cual cuenta con un horno pequeño a gas, actividad que aprendió en la ciudad D. Lima y actualmente se sigue capacitando constantemente para ofertar más variedad D. postres, sus ventas los realiza por mayor a las tiendas, restaurantes, cafetines.

Por otro lado Gladys es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Gladys viaja a las ferias dos veces por semana donD. venD. ropa y D. las ferias compra quesos que venD. por mayor en el mercado Nery. Además Gladys siembra alfa que venD. en el mismo mercado. Mery, Gladys y Sofia necesitan préstamos D. 750 soles, 750 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. harina, azúcar y mantequilla, faldas, ropa D. niños, cereales, azúcar y arroz.

Los sueños D. Mery, Gladys y Sofia son tener una panadería granD., una tienda estable D. venta D. ropa y que sus hijos estudien y sean mejores que ellas.

loans.use: Mery, Gladys and Sofia request a loan in the amount of 750 soles, 750 soles, and 600 soles. These funds will be invested in the purchase of flour, sugar, butter, skirts, children's clothing, cereals, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Lucía Adelaida

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia vende repostería y cosmético desde hace tres años. Negocio que puso con capital propio y ha ido sacando adelante poco a poco. Comenta que ha tenido tiempos difíciles debido a la cara que está la vida actualmente, pero no a perdido las esperanzas y ha logrado mantener el negocio. El uso del préstamo es para comprar materia prima para elaborar las reposterías y también invertirá en la compra de cosméticos y así poder fortalecer su negocio. Lucia habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene 49 años de edad, y con tres hijos mayores de edad, de 18, 24 y 30 años,  su esposo trabaja y siempre ha estado pendiente de las necesidades de la familia. A largo plazo es establecer su negocio en un local amplio y poner una cafetería ya que eso le generaría mas ingresos, ayudar a su hija de 18 años a salir a delante y a que se prepare ya que es la única que esta a su cargo porque los otros están casados.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucia has sold baked goods and cosmetic products for three years. She started the business with her own capital, and has continued moving forward little by little. She has had difficult times as a result of the high cost of living, but has not lost hope and continues running her business. Mrs. Lucia will use the loan to purchase raw goods from which she will make her baked goods. She will also use the loan to purchase cosmetic products, and strengthen her business in this way. Lucia is 49 years old and lives in the Laureles North neighborhood. She has three children, ages 18, 24 and 30. Her husband works and has always been sensitive to the family's needs. In the long term, Lucia would like to move her business to a larger location and add a cafeteria, which will increase her profits. With the additional income she will support her 18 year old daughter, as she is the the only one currently living in the house because Lucia's other children are married.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make baked goods, and purchase cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Ashkabur

texts.en:
Ashkabur M., age 65, is a cattle breeder and a responsible father of six children who has always watched over his family’s financial security. He accomplishes this by caring for his animals on a daily basis. He clearly remembers the time when he decided to become independent, with a small number of animals and a small patch of land. Ashkabur has more than 20 years of experience. 

He has high hopes for the present season. He wants to provide a secure environment for his family and save the money needed for the marriage of his adult sons. For this purpose, Ashkabul has applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase four calves. 

Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en: Mr. Khoeun K. is a villager in Prey Run village in Takeo Province. He is president of his village. His wife, Mrs. Nup Net, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land so she can cultivate rice. In order to plant her crops, she always hires a laborer with two oxen to plow her field. So Mr. Khoeun K. is requesting a loan buy buffalo for breeding and to plow his field which will reduce his expenses. Mr. Khoeun K. is 32 years old and the father of three children who are attending the local school. His wife is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To purchase buffalo for breeding and to plow his field

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami M. is 40-year-old farmer who breeds sheep in the small village of Sabirabad City. Nizami has 13 years of experience in sheep breeding. He purchases lambs at a low price, feeds them, and after 3-6 months, sells them in the local livestock bazaar for a higher price.

Nizami is married and has a daughter. He also works at a school as a teacher, but his main source of income is sheep breeding. Nizami has applied for a loan of 1200 USD to purchase 15 sheep and the fodder they need (the approximate price for one sheep is 70-80 USD).

loans.use: Purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Kosar Begum Maqsood Ahmad Group

texts.en:
My name is Kosar begum and I am 38 years old.  I am married with four children: two sons and two daughters. All of my children are getting an education in a school near my house.  I own a two-room brick house and have been living in it with my family for the past 8 years. My husband's name is M. A..  He sells milk and has 5 years of experience. I help my husband get milk from buffalo and transfer the milk into milk pots. I’ve successfully repaid two loans which I took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand our milk-selling business. 
 
I am the leader of a group with three other women from my town. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Sumera baji and Irshad baji each want a loan to pay the installments on their auto-rickshaws (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for a milk-selling business

loans.name: Palmi

texts.es: Palmi tiene 52 años,  es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos que ya son independientes y viven lejos D. ella. En la actualidad vive sola en su casa que es propia y a pesar que está sola es muy emprendedora y vela por su futuro. Se dedica a la venta D. bebidas (gaseosas, cervezas y otros) tiene su pequeño bar al costado D. su vivienda, en donD. con su gran amabilidad y buena atención cuenta con una gran clientela que consumen sus bebidas heladas. Palmi inició este negocio por encontrarse en una buena zona y lo vienen haciendo ya desD. hace 4 años. Ella atienD. a cualquier hora del día, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque muy a parte D. generarle ingresos aprenD. a administrar cada vez mejor sus ganancias y sobre cómo debe ser el trato con sus clientes, ya que por parte D. una empresa cervecera recibe capacitaciones constantes. Este es su 6to crédito con MFP, y con la cantidad solicitada comprará más productos (cervezas y gaseosas) y también hará algunas reparaciones a su local para dar una mejor acogida a todo aquel que ingresa y consume sus bebidas.
texts.en:
Palmi is 52 years old, a single mother of three whose children are all now independent and live on their own. She is living alone in her home, which she owns, and because she is alone she is very enterprising and ensures her future. She sell refreshments such as soft drinks, beer, and so on. Her small bar is set at the siD. of her house, where she has many customers who drink her cold refreshments because of kindness and good service. Palmi opened her business four years ago because she was in a good location. She is open at all hours and very much enjoys her work because not only does she make money, but every day she learns to better manage her profits and above all how to treat her customers as she receives regular training from a beer company. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She will use the loan to buy more goods (beer and soft drinks) and make some improvements to her bar to give a better impression to the people who come in and drink her refreshments.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more refreshments.

loans.name: Tout

texts.en:
Tout S. is 27 years old and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. 
She grows and sells various kinds of vegetables at the market, earning around US$2 per day. She has been in business for five years. Her husband catches fish in the lake and sells his catch in the market to earn approximately US$3 of profit per day. 
They have three children, two of whom are in school. 
Mrs. Tout S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a water pump. This pump will help her to irrigate her fields from the lake in case of difficulty due to climatic variability.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Dorcase Achieng

texts.en: Dorcase is a 35 year old single mother raising one son. This is her second loan which she will use to purchase more products for her shop. She lives and works in Nyamasaria and assures Kiva lenders that her son, while an only child, is a good boy. She says it is a challenge raising a child by herself and she wishes she could make more money. Dorcase insisted that we come to see her shop after she receives her loan, which we plan to do.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Selesitina

texts.en:
Selesitina F. is married with four children. She has four years of experience in the plantation/vegetable business. She sells to village people and the general public three days per week.

Selesitina has three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

SPBD loans are Selesitina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase farm supplies and repair her home.

loans.name: Elieser

texts.es: El señor Eliézer tiene 39 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijas menores que estudian la primaria, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace tres año administra, el cual inicio con prestamos y la liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic el cual se ha beneficiado para mantener un buen  inventario y crecer. Con esta solicitud va invertir en la compra de granos básicos, pollo, canes, productos enlatados y productos de limpieza para poder sastifacer  a sus clientes y vender  más. Sus planes es poder terminar de hacer las mejoras a su casa, y poder apoyar a sus hijas con los estudios.
texts.en:
Eliezer is 39 years old and lives in the neighborhood Laureles Sur in the city of Managua with his wife and two daughters, who study at primary school. Eliezer has a small general store which he has run for 3 years. He started his business with the help of loans, and with savings from his previous work. This is his third loan with Afodenic, which has enabled him maintain a good inventory and grow his business. With this new loan, he will purchase basic grains, chickens, sugar cane, dairy products as well as cleaning products. This inventory will help him meet the demands of his customers and continue to grow his business. Eliezer's plan is to be able to finish necessary work on his house, and to be able to support his daughters' education.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his store, including basic grains, chickens, dairy products and cleaning products

loans.name: Ivonne Monica

texts.es:
Ivonne es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Ivonne es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Ivonne junto a su esposo brindan servicios de cerrajería, reparación, elaboracion de llaves, chapas, actividad que realizan a domicilio y tambien en un puesto ambulante en el mercado Magdalena.
Ivonne necesita un prestamo de 2000 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de chapas y llaves.
Los sueños de Ivonne es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ivonne is a member of the Maria Celeste Village Bank. She is 29, and has a common-law husband and 2 children. She and her husband work every day, providing locksmith services, and making and repairing keys and locks, from home and from a cart in the Magdalena market. Ivonne is seeking a loan of 2,000 soles to buy locks and keys. She dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy locks and keys.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate A. is forty-two years old. She is married and blessed with five children. Currently, three of them are pursuing education in junior and primary schools. She lives together with her family in a family house in a town called Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works with all zeal as a resourceful parent to support her family and help provide for the children's fees. She is a fishmonger and sells all kinds of fried and smoked fishes. She sells through "hawking" (door-to-door sales). She procures her goods from big time fishmongers in Yeji and Mankessim towns, who sell at wholesale prices. She has been in business for five years. According to Kate, most of her customers are food vendors in her community.

Kate believes this loan will enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Ahotefo ("righteous") Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and to support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure fried and smoked fish and tilapia.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock of goods.

loans.name: Silas Aura

texts.en:
Silas W. is married with three children. He runs a semi-permanent food stall in Kisumu City's industrial area and has been in this business for the past year. He has two employees who assist him in serving his clients. His clients are mostly factory employees. He feels he has not fully exhausted his business's potential due to a shortage of capital. He learned about KADET through one of his friends after attempts to access a bank loan turned futile due to his inability to meet the requirements.

He intends to use the loan to increase his daily volume of supplies to be able to meet the demand for his clientele.  He hopes to expand the business and even relocate to more permanent premises.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To increase daily supply of fish and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Junolito

texts.en:
Junolito R. is from the town of Cabuan, Guinsiliban Camiguin. He is 37 years old. Junolito is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Junolito owns and operates a business venture in the service sector, providing transport services to the local market. Junolito has been engaged in his business for many years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities. He has also been engaged in providing tailoring services.

In 2009, Junolito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junolito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used for motor vehicle maintenance. Junolito is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials for his tailoring business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Junolito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn R., a 26-year-old single woman from the village of Batibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, owns and operates a sari-sari or general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Charlyn is just starting this business.

Charlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC, Charlyn is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy R. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin. She is forty years old and married with four school-age children. To make a living, Joy owns and operates a "sari-sari", a retail shop that sells a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately $160 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Joy joined HSPFI, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Joy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mitraudi

texts.en:
Mitraudi is a member of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 39 year old woman, She is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 16 and 12 years old. She also cares for other 1 dependent.

Mitraudi has owned a clothing business selling Fabric materials like Vitenge,Kanga for 2 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a  monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Mitraudi`s first loan form BRAC_Tanzania, She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more fabric.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Mitraudi hopes to save money, pay school fess and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios es Amor, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Pillpichaca, ubicado en el distrito del mismo nombre, provincia D. Huaytana, Departamento D. Ayacucho. Esta comunidad se encuentra ubicada a 02 horas del distrito D. Ayacucho, siendo sus actividades económicas principales, la ganadería y la agricultura.

Teresa es casada y tiene 07 hijos. Teresa se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, las cuales adquiere en las ferias y venD. en los colegios, en lo cual le ayuda su esposo y una D. sus hijas. Teresa solicita un préstamo con el cual comprara mas productos para sus ventas. Ella, quiere cambiar mejorar su calidad D. vida, así como la D. su familia, por ello se encuentra ahorrando.

Tomasa es casada y tiene 09 hijos. Tomasa tiene por negocio la venta D. prendas D. vestir, negocio en el cual recibe el apoyo D. su esposo e hijos. Ella compra sus prendas en la ciudad y las venD. en la comunidad. Tomasa necesita un préstamo, el cual le servirá como capital D. trabajo para adquirir mas prendas y poder venderlas.

loans.use: El Banco Comunal Dios es Amor, solicita un prestamo de 7,600 soles para que sus 15 socias inviertan en sus negocios

loans.name: Fotemogoban. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Fotemogoban sont  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 et 2 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à Kokouna un des villages de la commune rurale de Loulouni, 3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt. solidaire. Le premier s’est bien dénoué. 
Elles font la vente de  beurre de karité, de condiments alimentaires et de céréales.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 150kg de beurre de karité, 6 paquets de condiments alimentaires et 3sacs de 100kg céréales (maïs et sorgho).  Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Loulouni ville et les villages avoisinants et effectuent leur ventes aux marchés de Loulouni, Dallen et à domicile, au comptant, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille; l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un point de vente.
texts.en:
The four members of the Fotemogoban group are married women who on average are 37 years old, with two children. They are, for the most part in monogamous families living in Kokouna, one of the villages in the rural district of Loulouni, the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance company to meet their customers needs and are about to make their second loan. Their first loan has been repaid in full. They sell karite butter ( a cosmetic cream), basic food condiments and cereals With their new loan, they plan to buy 150 kg of karite butter, 6 boxes of basic food condiments and 3 x 100 kg sacs of cereal grains (corn and sorgho). They buy provisions at the market place in Loulouni and in neighboring villages and sell their products at the markets in Loulouni and Dallen and from their homes. They sell their products for cash to a clientele of both women and men. They each hope to earn a monthly profit of 22,500 Francs CFA. A part will be used for savings and family needs and a part to be invested in their businesses. They would like to increase their operating capital to increase their customers satisfaction and better manage their sales.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for resale

loans.name: Santusa

texts.en:
Our client is Santusa.  She is part of a communal bank consisting of sixteen neighbors who live in Cusco.  The group is called Santa Rosita de Lima, named after a virgin of Peru.  She is a native of Apurimac but now lives in Cusco.  She is 56 years old and is married with two children and two grandchildren.  

She buys and sells clothing in Tres Cruces, Paucartambo.  She sells approximately 80 soles worth of goods per day, which is approximately $28.  With this loan, she will buy more clothing from wholesale vendors in the area.

Santusa appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Mr. Un C., age 53, makes a living driving a taxi trailer-motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community for fees. He currently earns an average of $3 a day and has been running his business for years. Beside this, he raises poultry in a stall next to his house for extra profit. Un C. is the father of three school-aged children. His wife sells a few grocery items to earn a living. She is also a good housewife who cooks delicious meals. Un C. requested a loan to help increase his wife's business capital and buy more feed for his poultry.

loans.use: As business capital for his wife and to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Rosa Livia

texts.es:
El banco comunal San José se formó en la comunidad Inga pirca a una hora de la ciudad de Cuenca, este sector se caracteriza por su belleza natural, los diferentes sembríos  forman un gran rompecabezas de colores, aquí la mayoría de su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

La señora  Rosa S. es socia del banco comunal San José hace dos ciclos, ella tiene 35 años de edad vive en la comunidad de Inga pirca con su esposo  y sus cuatro hijos de 18, 9, 7 y 2 años, su primer hijo ya trabaja pero es solo para sus gastos personales, los otros hijos pequeños estudian en la escuela Ingapirca,  su  cónyuge trabaja en la construcción sacando siempre adelante a su familia, uniendo esfuerzos mutuos lograron construir su casa aunque pequeña pero acogedora.

Rosa trabaja como empleada domestica  hace mucho tiempo, con lo cual aporta para los gastos del hogar,  su horario de  trabajo es  de lunes a viernes  de 8 am a 4pm. Con el préstamo solicitado va a invertir en el arreglo de su casa.

Su meta es comprarse un carro para trasladarse desde su pueblo hasta la ciudad.
texts.en:
The community bank of “San Jose” was formed in the Inga pirca community, one hour from the city of Cuenca, this area is characterized for its natural beauty, the different crops are part of a large mosaic of colours, most of the population here works in agriculture and livestock. Rosa S. has been a member of the community bank San Jose for two cycles, she is 35 years old and lives in the Inga pirca community with her husband and four children ages 18, 9, 7 and 2, her oldest son works to cover his own personal expenses, her other children are in the Ingapirca school, her husband works in construction always getting their family ahead, joining mutual efforts they were able to build a house, which is small but cozy. Rosa has worked as a maid for a long time, she contributes to the home expenses, her working shedule is from Monday to Friday from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. The loan requested will be invested in house renovations. Her goal is to buy a car to drive from her town to the city.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House renovations

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is a 53-year-old married mother of three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Adwoa works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a baker who bakes bread and supplies to retailers. Adwoa buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for more than 20 years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace O. is a well known beef seller at the market in Benin City. She has been in this business since 2006. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) Peace is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more beef to sell.

Peace is 32 years old and married with three children. Her children are in school and she hopes to give them quality education. Her husband is an athlete and he also supports the family. Peace hopes to see her business grow and expand in the future. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Julie Mae

texts.en:
Julie Mae P. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is twenty-nine years old. Julie Mae is single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Julie Mae owns and operates a specialized retail store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready-to-wear items like pants, shirts, and more in the local community. Julie Mae is just starting this business.

In 2009, Julie Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie Mae is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Julie Mae's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional goods such as drinks, foodstuffs, etc.

loans.name: Ablanvi

texts.fr: Cette femme âgée de 43 ans, est née dans la ville d’Aneho au sud  du Togo, aujourd’hui elle est mariée et vit dans le quartier de bé kpota, elle a un enfant. En 2006 elle s’est lancée dans la vente de bijoux, elle exerce ce commerce au grand marché de Lomé où cette activité est très développée, voulant grandir son commerce elle s’est approchée de WAGES pour solliciter un crédit pour l’achat de divers bijoux afin de bien satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
This 43-year old lady was born in the town of Aneho in the south of Togo. Today she is married and lives in the Bé Kpota neighbourhood; she has one child. In 2006 she started selling jewelry and she carries out this business at the large market in Lomé where it is very developed. In order to expand her business she has approached WAGES to apply for a loan for the purchase of various items of jewelry in order to satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Before becoming a member of ASHI, Kiva’s field partner in the Philippines, Margie S.’s life was full of challenges. She and her family were very poor and she worked hard to help her fisherman husband earn money for the cash flow of her family and to be able to support the education of her children until they graduated from college.

When she became a member of ASHI seven years ago, loans Margie requested and received were spent on a business. Several businesses her loans have been financing include her husband’s fishing, and tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for hire businesses. She was able to purchase a fishing motorboat and also a tricycle which he operates once the fishing is off-season. He also sometimes uses the vehicle as a service for selling fish to the people in their village.

Margie was able to have her own business to manage as well, as she was able to purchase piglets for fattening. All these businesses still exist. As a matter of fact, her hog-fattening business has already grown and she has been able to sell more pigs to a lot of meat vendors.

Despite the time required to manage her businesses, since she is also helping her husband in selling the fish, she makes sure that she is also able to spend time with her children. She wants her productive and reproductive roles played fairly.

Margie’s children are inspired by the effort they see from their mother. They studied very hard to graduate from college to make their mother happy. Expenses for their education came from their mother’s educational loan from ASHI.

Even though Margie has been facing several failures and problems in life, she is still happy because she was able to achieve her dream of graduating her five children from college. Now, four of them have their own jobs and source of income.

However, Margie still aims to grow her fishing business. Her son, who is unemployed, will be operating another fishing boat she plans to purchase using the loan she is requesting from Kiva this time.

The proceeds of her businesses will be used to improve their house as well as making their life different from the one they once had.

loans.use: To purchase a motor fishing boat for her son to use

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia, 42 years old, is a rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She is married with seven children and her oldest child is aged 20 and goes to school.

Julia is involved in rice farming. She works hard to be able to keep up with the growing needs in her household. She hopes to send all her children to school and have them finish college.

Julia needs financing for her farm. She lacks farm inputs like seed and fertilizer. She is requesting a loan of Php 14,000 which she will use to acquire the farm inputs she needs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy A. is from the village of Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 39 years old. Daisy is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Daisy makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Daisy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Daisy from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Sam-Im

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-im E., aged 29, and his wife, Mrs. Chhean Tum, aged 27, live in a small village along National Road Number Three, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have a young daughter.
Sam-im has been a construction worker for ten years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for one year. He is requesting a loan of $300 to put an addition on his house.

loans.use: To put an addition on his house

loans.name: Balel Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Balel est composé de cinq femmes mariées majoritairement dans des foyers monogames avec en moyenne 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et d’appartenance à une même association des femmes du quartier. 
Elles ont comme activités, l’achat et la vente de pagnes wax,  de fruits et légumes tels la mangue,  des draps de lit et divers condiments alimentaires : poudre de gombo, feuilles de baobab, concentrée de tomate, piments, oignons etc. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et d’améliorer leurs conditions socio économiques, elles ont décidé de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 6ème  cycle de prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les cinq précédents.
Madame Sanata T. qui est un membre du groupe s’est spécialisée dans la vente de fruits et légumes et compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 chargements de charrettes en mangues, petit à petit, avec les producteurs de mangue des villages environnants de Ségou comme Banankoro, Diakoro et Nèrèkoro. Elle effectue sa vente à domicile, au marché Château et en ambulant dans les quartiers de Ségou, en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. 
A l’instar des autres membres du groupe, Madame Sanata T. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000FCFA qui sera réinvestir dans leurs activités, servira à assurer l’éducation et la formation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The Balel group is composed of five married women, most of whom live in monogamous households. They average 44 years of age, with 5 children. All are residents of the Hamdallaye de Ségou neighborhood, in Mali’s 4th administrative region. They became acquainted with one another through participation in a neighborhood women’s group. Their businesses include purchase and resale of pagnes, the beautiful cloth wraps that the women wear, bed linens, and fruits and vegetables, especially mangos, as well as various culinary condiments such as gumbo powder, baobab leaves, tomato concentrate, chiles, onions, etc. In order to augment their operating capital and improve their socio-economic conditions, these women have joined Soro Yiriwaso for a 6th group loan cycle, having repaid five previous loans. Madame Sanata T., a member of the group, specializes in sale of fruits and vegetables. She plans to use her loan proceeds to purchase 20 carts of mangos, gradually, from small growers in local villages near Ségou, Banankoro, Diakoro and Nèrèkoro. She sells from her home, at the Château market, and walking through Ségou neighborhoods. Her mixed clientele pays cash and she also sells on credit. With the support and encouragement of the other group members, Madame Sanata T. hopes to obtain a monthly benefit of 45,000 CFA which will be reinvested in group activities and will help assure the education and training of their children.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods for sale

loans.name: Nekaiyoni

texts.en: Nekaiyoni has been wheat farming in Naivasha town for nine years. He is 38 years old, married to Charity Katito, and they have three children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy wheat seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides in preparation for the new planting cycle. Nekaiyoni plans to buy his own set of farming equipment in the future which he will use at his pleasure, also saving him thousands of shillings which he has been using to rent this equipment.

loans.use: To buy wheat seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla J. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Perla is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling different varieties of ocean-caught fish in the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Perla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Perla is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Perla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 36-year-old mother of four who lives in Los Chiles, located in the Northern region of Costa Rica. Marina lives with her husband and two children. Like many member of the Los Chiles community, Marina is a farmer. She dedicates her time to the planting and harvesting of various subsistence and revenue generating crops including chili peppers among others. Marina´s husband hires himself out to other farmers in the region as a paid laborer. This work helps to complement the money earned from the sale of the family's own produce. 

This loan will be used to finance the production of Habanero chili peppers.  Specifically, Marina will use this money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, tools, pesticides, and other materials/ingredients necessary for the production of chili peppers. All labor and transportation tasks will be carried out by Marina and her family. 

In the mornings, Marina carries out domestic tasks such as housework and tending to the children. In the afternoons, Marina joins her husband to work their own plot of land. Marina´s goal is to increase the yield of her farm. She hopes to earn enough revenue from the production of chili peppers to keep her children in school. She hopes to improve her economic situation and offer a better standard of living to her family. A major difficulty and limitation for Marina has been her lack of working capital combined with previously unsuccessful harvesting seasons. She hopes to use this loan effectively to improve life on the farm for everyone.

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or, PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Los Chiles, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Marina, her family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Marina wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. She wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in her neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients to produce chili peppers

loans.name: Katungamo Women's Voice Group

texts.en:
It has now been 22 years since Vincent K. started up his farming business adventure in Ntungamo. The married father of five children is very aggressive and determined when it comes to lucrative business. He has since engaged himself in various farming practices, including livestock, which is his main source of livelihood along with growing and selling bananas and coffee. 

His main drawbacks include bad weather conditions and drought, which reduce the rate of production in terms of milk since animals lack water and grass to feed on, and also fluctuating prices. With this loan, he is looking forward to purchasing more cattle to fatten and sell off at profit. 

Vincent is very optimistic about getting more harvests and more sales revenue and thus be able to look after his family and pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: Buying more livestock, like cattle, for fattening

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo K., 38, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for high quality palm products. K. is a farmer and is able to earn an income of USD 1.50 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. K. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to provide a suitable wedding for one of the children.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: provide for a suitable wedding for her son

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married to a businessman with two children who all attend school. She has houses for rent and has been operating for the last ten years. Her other source of income is her husband's salary.

With a loan of 30,000 KES she wants to renovate her house and purchase new iron sheeting. Her potential customers are the neighbouring community and city dwellers.

Joyce faces a major challenge of theft in her business. Her major goal is to build a permanent house in the future. She decided to work with Yehu so as to get a loan to modify her business. She lives in her own house with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To renovate her house and purchase new iron sheeting

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa L. is from the village of Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Maria Theresa owns and operates a specialized retail store selling personal products, such as lotions, accessories and watches, in the local community. Maria Theresa has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Maria Theresa joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Theresa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man and the father of two school-aged children. He has made his living as an experienced construction worker. He has specialized in home construction for the past 25 years. He works on an average of two home projects per month, and he is thankful for his business income.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new construction tools to replace his old ones so as to improve his business expertise and ready himself for a new home project. As with the majority of Lebanese fathers, his main target is to satisfy the demands of his family.

In the future, he is planning to continue expanding his business and take on more projects per month to make more money for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new construction tools

loans.name: Gladys Esther

texts.es:
La alegre expresión de Gladys  N. es una muestra de la manera como vive su vida, entre las comunicaciones físicas y virtuales, pues ella tiene e justamente un negocio llamado “Comunicaciones Gladys, donde ofrece servicios de internet, fotocopiado, llamada y como ha logrado un mercado estable, también se las ingenió para vender mercancías variadas.  Ella es una mujer viuda que vive en el barrio Santa Elena de Barranquilla y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 29 a 33 años, e inició su vida empresarial con un negocio de confección una vez falleció su esposo, y quedó sola encargada del sostenimiento de su familia, lo cual  antes no lo hacía.  Con este negocio inicial, llegó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en un grupo solidario de 4 integrantes, gradualmente su crecimiento fue tan  notorio que debió independizarse,  pero decidió emprender un negocio de comunicaciones , que es el que actualmente  tiene, pues  es una de las aptitudes que la caracteriza; hoy cuenta con 6 equipos de cómputos  e impresora y ya tiene 20 créditos con esta organización, con la cual ha logrado ofrecer estudios a sus hijos y aumentar su calidad de vida familiar;  es notorio el mejoramiento de su vivienda y la autosuficiencia de Gladys acompañada con un buen comportamiento de pago de sus obligaciones, lo que la hacen merecedora de  la confianza de muchas instituciones que se le acercan.
En la actualidad  está solicitando su credikiva para   renovar sus equipos y prepararse para la temporada de vacaciones de los estudiantes, que muy pronto se avecina,  y sus equipos deben estar a toda marcha.  Su sueño es adecuar su   casa construyendo su segundo piso para separar el negocio totalmente,  tener una miscelánea donde vender sus mercancías y más adelante un carro propio donde pasear con su familia, tal como  como se lo merecen después de muchos años de esfuerzo y este es justamente su gran desafío.
texts.en:
Gladys N.'s cheerful expression is a sign of the way in which she lives her life in physical and virtual communications.  She has a business called “Comunicaciones Gladys” where she offers Internet, photocopying and 'phone services.  As she has achieved a stable market, she has also managed to start selling a variety of goods.  She is a widow who lives in the Santa Elena de Barranquilla neighborhood and has 3 children aged from 29 to 33 years old.  She began her business career with a dressmaking business after her husband died and she found herself alone and in charge of supporting her family, something which she didn't do before.  She arrived at the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with this initial business as part of a communal bank made up of four members.  Gradually her growth became so great that she decided to go it alone, setting up a communications business which is the one she currently has since it is one of the talents for which she is well known.  She currently has 6 computer systems and printer. She has already had 20 loans from this organization which have enabled her to provide an education for her children and improve her family's quality of life.  The improvements to her home and Gladys' self-sufficiency are well known as is her good repayment history which makes her worthy of the trust of the many institutions which approach her.

Gladys is currently requesting a Kiva loan to update her equipment and get ready for the student holiday period which is fast approaching. Her equipment needs to be working at full speed. Her dream is to adapt her house by building a second level in order to completely separate her business; to own a general store where she can sell her merchandise and, further in the future, she hopes to buy her own car so that she can go out for a drive with her family which is what they deserve after many years of effort.  This is her biggest goal.

loans.use: To purchase two computer systems

loans.name: Maribel
