texts.es: Maribel, de 35 años, es una mujer luchadora; hace tan solo 2 años que se separó de su esposo; pero como una madre responsable cuida de sus 2 hijos: Kainer, de 12 y Rocío, de 7 años. Desde entonces se convirtieron en una familia muy unida, que viven en casa de su madre, ubicada en la localidad de Casacoto. Cuando vivía, con su esposo; ella tenía un pequeño puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma, ahí vendía verduras a los pobladores que visitaban el mercado; pero como la inestabilidad económica llegó a su hogar producto de su separación, ella decide dedicarse a la agricultura, es así que con el apoyo de su madre, se establece en el pueblo, donde comienza a sembrar papa y maíz. Sus productos son muy buenos, y en cada cosecha que obtiene, puede ver sus esfuerzos plasmados, asimismo lleva esta mercadería fuera de la capital, donde negocia su producción a buen precio. Pero como trabajadora incansable, ella por las noches vende hamburguesa, en la esquina de su casa. Así cada día agradece a Dios por el apoyo que le brinda, y desea seguir sembrando y ganar más experiencia. Es el primer crédito con MFP y, está  feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde las personas son emprendedoras, que triunfan a pesar de las dificultades. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 8 sacos de abono, para su cultivo de papa que recién sembró.
texts.en:
Maribel, age 35, is a tenacious woman.  It has only been two years since she separated from her husband, but as a responsible mother she takes care of her two children.  Kainer is 12, and Rocío is 7.  Since that time they became a very united family.  They live in her mother’s house, which is located in Casacoto.

When she lived with her husband she had a small stand in the central market in the city of Tarma.  She sold vegetables to the people who came to the market.  However, due to the economic instability that came to her household because of her separation, she decided to work in agriculture.  That is why, with her mother’s support, she set herself up in the village where she is starting to grow potatoes and corn.  Her products are very good, and her efforts are reflected in each harvest.

She also takes her merchandise outside of the capital, where she negotiates a good price for her production.  She is a tireless hard-worker, and she sells hamburgers at night on the corner of her house.  Every day she is grateful to God for the support He gives her.  She wishes to keep farming and to gain more experience.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is happy to belong to her communal bank.  The members are enterprising, and they triumph in spite of the difficulties.  She will use the requested loan to buy eight sacks of fertilizer for her potato crop, which she recently planted.

loans.use: To buy eight sacks of fertilizer for her potato crop

loans.name: Mwale Group

texts.en:
Husna S. is in her mid 20s and has a five-year-old daughter. Husna has been running a tabletop fruits and vegetables business since 2008. The shop is open between 5:00 am and 5:00 pm daily and earns Husna a low monthly profit. 

This will be Husna's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Husna used her first loan to increase her business and to start supplying other people with fruits and vegetables. Husna has since successfully repaid that loan. With her second loan, Husna aims to open a salon in Tabata. Her dream is to  open a clothing shop.

Husna will share this loan with her loan group Mwale, which has 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. 

In the picture, Husna can be seen wearing a yellow shirt in the first row.

loans.use: To open a salon

loans.name: Rhevy

texts.en:
Rhevy B. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 51 years old. Rhevy is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies like the Filipino delicacy, bibingka, in the local community. Rhevy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rhevy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. 

Rhevy is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Suma Sartawi Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “Suma Sartawi” está iniciando su ciclo número uno en el Centro Focal de GERMAN BUSCH. Cuenta con ocho integrantes, un varón y siete mujeres.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Nilda, por la tesorera, la señora Virginia y como secretaria de actas Jaqueline.  Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio, producción  y servicio, como ser: venta de ropa, taller de cerrajería (elaboración de cocinas), venta de fruta, venta de salchipapas, taller de cocinas, artesanìa de mantillas en lana de alpaca, artesanìa en tejidos y venta de comida. 


La señora  Nilda presidenta de la BC “Suma Sartawi”, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Es profesora y también artesana, pues elabora variedad de artesanías: pintado en tela, macramé, tejido, bordado.  Para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos, la señora Nilda  indica que cada cierto tiempo pasa clases de actualización y ella a su vez también da clases a otras señoras interesadas.  Expone sus trabajos en las ferias y exposiciones de unidades educativas.  Este es el primer ciclo de crédito de la señora en Pro Mujer, aunque comenta que no es la primera vez que ha solicitado crédito.  Ella comentaba con mucha satisfacción que las promotoras de Pro Mujer llegaron justo a tiempo, pues ella necesitaba un crédito para impulsar su negocio.  Cuando le consultan sobre  qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y la posibilidad de crecer con el grupo. El crédito que esta recibiendo será utilizado en la compra de materiales para artesanía.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Suma Sartawi," is starting their first cycle in the Centro Focal de German Busch.  It is composed of eight members, one man and seven women.  The director's board consists of the president, Nilda, the treasurer, Virginia, and the secretary, Jaqueline.  The women's businesses are related to sales, production and service, such as, the sale of clothes, locksmith (the elaboration of kitchens), the sale of fruit, "salchipapas" (french fries with sausage), cooking workshops, artisan blankets of alpaca wool, woven items, and the sale of food.  

Nilda is the president of this communal bank "Suma Sartawi."  She is married and has four children.  She is a professor and also an artisan, who makes a variety of art work: cloth paintings, macrame, weaves, and embroidery.  In order to keep her clients satisfied, Nilda indicates that every once in awhile, she takes classes and also teaches classes to other interested women.  She displays her work at fairs and educational and school expos.  While this is her first credit cycle with Pro Mujer, she comments that this is not her first time applying for a loan.  She also states, with great satisfaction, that the promoters of Pro Mujer arrived right on time, since she needed a credit to move her business along.  When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the credit and the possibility of growing with the group.  The credit that she receives would be used towards the purchase of artisan materials.

loans.use: Purchase materials: wool, cloth, paint.

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en:
Lonh C. L. is 40 years old and the mother of three children. Two are single and the other one is married and has already started a new family. In the beginning of 2008, Lonh C. L. built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells Khmer noodles and rice from morning to evening to neighbors who live near her house in the village.

Lonh C. L. is married to Van Yit, 46, a local vet who earns daily income by treating the villager’s animals. In order to make more profit, Lonh C. L. would like to request a loan to purchase essential ingredients for cooking Khmer noodles and rice for selling in her shop. She proposes to use the rest of the loan to buy some medicine for giving injections to animals.

loans.use: To purchase essential ingredients for cooking Khmer noodles and rice, and to buy medicine for giving injections to animals.

loans.name: Donny Humberto

texts.es: Donny Humberto M. R. de 27  años de edad, reside en Sacacoyo, en el departamento de La Libertad, en donde vive junto a su esposa. Para ganarse la vida, Donny posee un negocio de venta de comida a la vista, en donde trabaja junto a su esposa, elaborando desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales posteriormente comercializa en su casa de habitación, en donde muchas personas que laboral en los alrededores, consumen sus alimentos. Donny deseando aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía, solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras, legumbres, granos básicos, entre otros más para poder ampliar su menú y así tener a sus clientes satisfechos de manera que siempre quieran regresar a comer a este lugar.
texts.en:
Donny Humberto M. R. is 27 years old and lives together with his wife in Sacacoyo, in La Libertad department.

Donny earns a living through his business selling buffet food.  He works with his wife, preparing breakfasts and lunches which he then sells from his home where many people who work in the surrounding area come to eat their food.  Donny would like to increase his sales and improve his finances.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy a larger quantity of greens, vegetables, basic grains and other products.  This will enable him to expand his menu and thereby satisfy his customers so that they always want to return to his business to eat.

loans.use: To buy staple food products that he needs to make lunches

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Current conditions in Kyrgyzstan drive the majority of residents to go into business. People are compelled to try in as many spheres as possible in order to make a living.  The rural areas are the most vulnerable to any changes in the nation. With no production and substantially low employment, rural areas are left without a labor force and became even more undeveloped, while the urban population grows.  

Nazira K., 35, is a treasurer of this group of borrowers. A resident of the small coal-mining town of Tashkomur in Southern Kyrgyzstan, she has been involved in livestock breeding for two years. She is a mother of four children and her husband is a coal miner. He sells coal to local consumers and to other regions of the city. 

Nazira says the biggest challenge for her is to pay enough attention to livestock breeding while raising four kids. Livestock needs careful treatment the whole day, starting from early in the morning until late in the evening. When the livestock is grown, Nazira sells it and buys new younger ones to raise.  This business always has enjoyed high demand because the Kyrgyz people’s main dish is meat. 

The business was Nazira’s husband’s initiative, thanks to which the family’s monthly revenue is 10000 soms. This loan is planned for the purchase of  9-10 livestock animals. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Yazmin

texts.es: Yazmin R. R. y su esposo son una pareja muy joven que comienza a formar su patrimonio para ofrecer a sus futuros hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Yazmin es un mujer muy trabajadora por lo que los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y artículos para el hogar desde hace 1año el cual desea surtir en mercancía de ropa de temporada así sus ventas se incrementen.
texts.en: Yazmin R. R. and her husband are a very young couple who have started to build their wealth in order to offer their children a better quality of life. Yazmin is a very hard-working woman, so for the last year, she has been selling used clothing and home goods on the weekend. She wants to stock up on seasonal clothing so she can increase her sales.

loans.use: to stock seasonal clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase balanced feed and fix the area where he raises his livestock.

loans.name: Genner

texts.es:
Genner  tiene 28  años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el caserío Túpac Amaru ubicado en una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Genner se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, los cuales cría en ambiente cercano a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con un terreno de cultivo producto de una herencia en donde suele sembrar limón el cual lo cosecha semestralmente. Cuenta con una experiencia de cinco años en ambos rubros. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Genner desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas, además desea comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Genner is 28 years old, married and lives with his wife and their two children in the village of Tupac Amaru.  It is located in a rural area in the region of Tambogrande, an agricultural district in the Piura region, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Genner raises and sells sheep.  He raises them in an area near his home, and when the have reached a good level of maturity he offers them in sales to the general public, and to the businessmen that often visit the zone.   Additionally, he has some farmland that he inherited where he usually plans lemons which he harvests every six months.   He has 5 years of experience in both lines of work.  With the income from these activities he helps his family to get ahead. 

Genner wants to increase his business, buying more animals and balanced feed so that he can increase his sales.  He also wants to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop.  For this reason he has asked Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 2000 nuevo soles.

loans.use: to buy cattle and balanced feed

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur, with her family. She has 4 children, the oldest of whom is 12 years old.

Liezel is in the business of raising hogs. She has a small backyard piggery that she hopes to expand soon. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and feeds. 

In the future, Liezel hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for her children to finish school and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Namoz

texts.ru: Табаров Намоз проживает в районе Яван. Ему 48 лет. Он женат, имеет 11 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Его старший сын находится на заработках в России. Сам Намоз вместе с детьми занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи и арбуз, а весной он сеет пшеницу. В этой области уже 25 лет. Кредит берет для покупки топлива и семян.
texts.en: Namoz T. lives in Yavan. He is 48 years old, married, and has eleven children. His wife is a housewife. His eldest son is working in Russia. Namoz and his children work in agriculture. He raises vegetables and watermelons, and in the spring he sows wheat. He has been doing this work for 25 years. He is taking out a loan to buy fuel and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fuel and seeds

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora Ana L. es socia del banco comunal Narancay Bajo, vive por la comunidad de Narancay Bajo en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad en 1999 fue nombrada patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por la belleza colonial de su centro histórico, Cuenca es cuna de grandes atletas, pintores, escritores y artesanos, tiene una variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es muy amable y cordial. 

Doña Ana tiene 27 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 7 y 6 años de edad que  estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá de manera independiente.
 
La Señora. Ana se dedica a la venta de frutas en un mercado de la ciudad, esta actividad la realiza hace 10 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal.

Es socia del banco comunal hace dos años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana L. is a member of the village bank Narancay Bajo and lives in the community of Narancay Bajo in the city of Cuenca. In 1999 this city was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site for the colonial beauty of the historic center. Cuenca is the cradle of great athletes, painters, writers and artisans. It has a varied cuisine and the people are very friendly and polite.

Ana is 27 years old and is a single mother to two children, 7 and 6, who study in a school in the city. She does not own a home, so she lives independently in her mother's house. 

Ana sells fruit in a market in the city. She has been doing this for 10 years. She works from Sunday to Sunday, from 6:00am until 6:00pm. In her free time she sells cosmetics from the Yanbal brand.

She has been a member of the bank for 2 years and will invest her credit in buying Yanbal brand cosmetics.

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy Yanbal products.

loans.name: Batnasan

texts.en: Batnasan is 51 years old and lives with her three children in an apartment in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. Her younger sons are students while her daughter helps with the family business, a store where the family has been selling construction materials since 2006. As a way of increasing sales, Batnasan is planning to open a second store at a new location. She is an honest women who is working hard to feed her family and emphasizes that, "with the loan I want to improve my business." She is seeking to borrow 1,500,000 MNT to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to tile her home with ceramics and add an electrical system, improving hygiene and living conditions for her family.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em, 23, is divorced and looks after her daughter by selling coffee and mobile cards, which she has done for the past three years. She and her daughter live in Ho Chi Minh City.

She would like to take a loan to expand her business by selling a greater variety of goods. She hopes that this will increase her income and permit her to better feed and meet the basic needs of her daughter and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda, a 57-year-old married mother of three, lives in the Philippines where she has had a retail shop that sells coconuts and green bananas for the past five years. A member of HSPFI  since 2009, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts and beverages to sell. In the future, Veneranda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more rice and ready-to-wear clothes to sell. Sheila has been in this business for 3 years. Sheila earns more income from ready-to-wear clothes.

Sheila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more rice and ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 20 years she has operated a business selling vegetables to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her dream is to expand her business in the future.

With the 15,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: TH., 33 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a Tok Tok driver with an income of $6 per day. She has three children. Two of the children are studying. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $3 on electricity, and $8 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a cow to feed and get its baby to sell. She will use the rest of the money for an electrical system to use in her house. This loan can help her family to have electricity to use like the other villagers. In the future, she wants to buy a new Tok Tok for her husband to continue his career, because the current Tok Tok is old and the tourists like the new Tok Tok.

loans.use: To buy a cow and an electrical system for her house

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a 51 year-old widow with two school-aged children.  For the last eleven years, Beth has been practicing farming in Limuru town. 
She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and till the land.

In the future, she hopes to practice large scale farming, which will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Norma Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Norma es cliente antigua de Emprender, ella se dedica a la venta de papelería, material de escritorio, adornos, regalos y otros objetos como tarjetas, libros etc. Ella vende variedad de productos según a la temporada, tiene ubicado su bazar librería en la zona de San Miguel un lugar muy concurrido de la zona Sur, ella vive en casa familiar con sus hermanos, quienes se colaboran en sus actividades, ella solicita el crédito para proveerse de mercadería para las fiestas de fin de año, además tiene propuestas para la venta de chocolatería, y tarjetas de navidad, por la ubicación del negocio tiene una buena venta y es una persona que cumple con sus pagos, es responsable y trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Norma is a long standing Emprender client.  She sells stationery, office supplies, decorations, gifts and other objects like greeting cards, books, etc.  She sells a variety of products according to the season.  Her book store is located in the San Miguel zone which is a very busy area in the south.  She lives in the family home with her siblings who collaborate with her activities.  

She is asking for the loan to stock up on merchandise for the end of year festivities.  In addition, she has prospects for chocolates and Christmas card sales.  Because of her store’s location, sales are good and she’s a person who pays her debts; she’s responsible and hardworking and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a hardworking business woman and a single-mother of one. For the last seven years, she has been managing a boutique to earn a living. She works hard in her business so as raise her five-year-old child who is in school. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. 

She is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La señora MatilD. es casada, tiene 42 años D. edad, cursó los grado D. educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos 3 D. los cuales estudian, se dedica al comercio a la venta D. ropa para todas las edades, inició este negocio como trabajadora para otro negocio, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años D. experiencia.

Solicita un dinero como préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio para la compra D. mas mercadería suéteres, playeras, lencería, pants, camisetas, etc. En el futuro espera ver su negocio con venta mayor.
texts.en:
MatilD. is 42 years old, married, and completed her primary education.  She has four children, three of whom are in school.  MatilD. sells clothes for all ages.  She started this business while working for another business.  She now has ten years experience.

MatilD. is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  She will buy more merchandise (sweaters, t-shirts, underwear, pants, etc).  In the future, she hopes that her business will experience more sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 38 years old and married to Joyce. They have four children who attend school. He is a business man involved in livestock trading. He also has a retail shop and owns a taxi. He has been in the livestock business for the past 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

This is his sixth loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy goats to raise and to add inventory of wheat flour and washing detergents for his shop. He will use the anticipated profit to expand the retail shop to wholesale. His dream is to become a prominent, successful business man.

loans.use: To buy more goats, wheat flour, and washing detergents

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru: Елена тогрует постельным бельем на рынке, сейчас на него повышенный спрос у нее большая торговая точка и ей надо много товара. Елена планирует закупить турецкий товар в Одессе. За товаром она ездит вместе с мужем, у которого тоже свой бизнес, на семейном микроавтобусе. Проживают в доме в пригороде с  меньшим сыном и старшей замужней дочерью. Внук Миша проходит реабилитацию по онкологии ,недавно у дочери родилась еще  девочка (7мес) здоровая. Вся большая семья живет вместе. Лена очень довольна возможностью брать кредиты и использует прибыль  как на развитие бизнеса, так и на помощь детям.
texts.en: Yelena sells bedding at the market.  There is currently an increased demand for bedding, and, having a big retail outlet, she needs a lot of merchandise.  Yelena plans to buy Turkish merchandise in Odessa.  She travels for the merchandise with her husband, who also has his own business, in a family minivan.  They lives in a house in a suburb with the youngest son and oldest married daughter.  Their grandson Misha is going through a oncological rehabilitation, and their daughter recently has a healthy daughter (7 months).  The entire big family lives together.  Yelena is very happy to have a possibility to obtain loans and uses the profit to develop her business, as well as to help her children.

loans.use: to purchase bedding

loans.name: Lucrecia Angela

texts.es:
Lucrecia es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del, distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.  Tiene estudios de educación secundaria (incompleta).
	
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de ovejas.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de cinco ovejas pequeñas para su engorde y luego venderlas a buen precio.  Su esposo trabaja como albañil.

La señora desea seguir con el negocio y tener ganados mejorados para incrementar su ganancia.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la alegría de las socias y las charlas con las socias.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is a member of the Aymaras Juli II Communal Bank in the Juli District of Chucuito Province in the department of Puno.  She is 44 years old, married, and has three children.  She has some secondary education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years now.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy sheep.
	
She is asking for a new loan for 500 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy five small sheep to fatten and sell later at a good price.  Her husband works as a builder.

She would like to continue with her business and have better livestock to increase her earnings.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the happiness of the members and the chats she has with them.

loans.use: to buy five small sheep

loans.name: Imara A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Imara A Group in Western Kenya! Josephine is the facilitator of the Imara A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Josephine is a mother of three children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Josephine had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Josephine was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Josephine and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Josephine will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Imara A group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is 21 years old. She is married to a military man and has two children. A year ago, Wisam started a small retail business. At first, it involved buying and selling accessories, then clothes, and now blankets as a preparation for the winter season.
Wisam is looking forward to expanding her business so she can help to support the family while they are young. She wants to provide her children with a comfortable life while they are growing up. In order to do that, Wisam has applied for this loan to purchase more products to sell in larger quantities and at a better price.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Edita works hard to support her family. She has a basket weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Edita is borrowing 11,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her basket weaving.
Edita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Malamba Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Malamba” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 700,000.00 SLL for each member to invest in her businesses. 

Mabinty is the leader of this group. Born in the village of Kamasikie, in Northern Sierra Leone, Mabinty is married. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells market food – palm oil, rice, pepper, tomatoes and margi (which is used to give sauce a sweet taste). With her share of the loan, Mabinty is going to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice, pepper, margi and tomatoes in large quantity for her business

loans.name: Milagros 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el octavo ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2009. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, cuyo objetivo principal es ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Sofia, ella tiene 3 hijos, esta acompañada con Ricardo, su marido trabaja como Pasero y ella se dedica hace varios años a la compra y venta de productos de todo tipo, como fideos, arroz, azúcar, y demás productos de primera necesidad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, yerba y demás insumos para abastecerse y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This group from the city Encarnación came about through contact with one of the members of the foundation. The group is in the eighth loan cycle and has worked with the foundation since 2009. The members are fighters and hardworking women. Their main objective is to help each other through working together. 


One of the members of the group is Sofia. She lives together with her husband and has 3 children. He works ferrying people across a river. 


She has worked for several years buying and selling all kinds of products, such as beans, rice, sugar, and other staples. 


Sofia is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, herbs, and other basic goods to be fully stocked, which would allow her to continue growing and helping her family.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, beans, herbs, and other staples

loans.name: Kerambo Mwita

texts.en:
Kerambo Mwita is a 40-year-old grocery store owner in Mombasa. He is married and has been running this business for the past 10 years with great success. 

This is Kerambo’s first business loan from KADET. He hopes to purchase more tomatoes, onions and kale to sell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to build his own permanent house. He hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, onions and kale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Emmanuel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Iliya, Sulemanu and Hajara.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Emmanuel  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Merlita is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy spare parts, and other materials needed in her business for her motorcycle transport business.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a mobile phone and electronics parts hawker/vendor. He conducts his business along the busy Kenya-Uganda highway and sells most of his products to truckers and other travelers. He is married with 4 children. Since leaving school, he has done all sorts of businesses to earn a living.  The loan of US$450 is intended to help him expand his hawking business and eventually open a little shop. With sufficient cash he also plans to travel to the city of Nairobi, where he can buy electronics cheaper and hence improve his profitability. He eventually hopes to become a wholesaler. Daniel was introduced to us by his brother-in-law, who is a long-term client of PEMCI and also his guarantor. This loan would be of great advantage to this young man with big ambitions.

loans.use: Mobile Phone/Electronics Hawker/vendor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Adon

texts.en: Adon A. is a 46-year-old woman with 4 children. She is a dynamic and ambitious woman who has been doing fruits and legumes sales activities for more than 20 years. Adon A. heard about AE&I in April, 2004 from her sister and got her first loan one month later. She lives in Treichville, a popular township in Abidjan. With revenue generated from her activities she contributes to the payment of the education fees for her children.

loans.use: Adon Ande will use the loan to expand her fruits and legume selling activities.

loans.name: Liberiana

texts.es:
Liberiana works at home selling bottled drinks to people in the surrounding area. She's 28 years old and married with 4 small children; her husband grows maize. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 3 group along with dona Pascuala de Jesus L. L. (who makes corn tortillas for sale to people in her neighborhood). They hope to use the loan to invest in their respective businesses: Pascuala, buying maize in bulk for her tortillas, and Liberiana, to add a place in her house for selling her bottled drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

LIBERIANA, se dedica a la venta de refrescos en su casa para las personas que habitan a su alrededor, tiene 28 años es casada con 4 hijos pequeños, su esposo se dedica a la siembra del maíz, Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 3 junto con doña PASCUALA DE JESUS L. L. (hace tortillas de maíz y las sale a vender entre las personas de su comunidad). Esperan con el préstamo invertir en sus respectivos negocios , Pascuaza comprando maíz por quintales para tener abastecimiento de materia prima para sus tortillas y Liberiana colocar un lugar en su casa para la venta de sus refrescos

loans.use: Bottled drink sales.

loans.name: Elba

texts.en:
Elba is 59 years old. She has seven children and five grandchildren. This is her second loan from Esperanza. She successfully paid back her first loan which was for 5000 pesos (150 USD). She used her first loan to build her Colmado (convenience store) and buy some products to sell, such as cooking oil, sugar, and soft drinks. She is going to use this next loan to buy an additional storage unit for her goods, so she can keep more products and continue expanding her small business.

Elba has been living with her father who is 80, her younger children, and two of her grandchildren since her husband died. Before she got the loan from Esperanza she was selling small items by the side of the road. She eventually wants to use the profits from her Colmado to make repairs on her house. Her son and his wife also have a loan out with Esperanza.

NOTE: This is a group loan; there are four other women in Elba's group. This $1200 loan will fund Elba's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective businesses and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To purchase a larger storage unit to keep her inventory in

loans.name: Volodya

texts.en:
Volodya is married and has one child. His business is the main source of income for his family.  About five years ago Volodya started a business selling something he enjoys – home electronics and appliances. His small indoor retail space at the “Fortune” store in Beregovo, Ukaine is packed with TVs, microwaves, washing machines, refrigerators, and other home appliances. These items have been in strong demand in Ukraine as the economy has expanded and should stay in demand with the increased use of consumer credit. Volodya would like to take advantage of the demand and grow his business. He has about $10,000 worth of inventory in his store and he makes about $550 profit in a typical month.

Volodya has requested a loan of $1000 to increase his available business capital. He has benefited from financial assistance through Nadiya Ukraine in the past and has used funding wisely. We are happy for another opportunity to help him as he works to develop and expand his business.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Gumru

texts.en: Gumru (her mother is pictured) has her own farming business. She started this business 5 years ago. She was born in 1981, is single, and lives in the Salyan region, in the village of Khaladj. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer to improve her farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 42 year-old woman who lives and works in the region of Nabatieh, in south Lebanon.

Samira sells kitchenware, cosmetics, and several other goods. Samira's husband is retired from the army so she is the primary income earner in the family. She is very pleased to have a hand in supporting their family. However, at this time, she needs a loan to build her base of merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To buy kitchenware, cosmetics and other home products

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosario belongs to the communal bank "Progress". She works selling clothing, quilts, and towels, but invests mainly in the purchase of underwear for women, men and children. She markets her products to her friends and family going from house to house. Her business is located in Huaraz city, a province of Huaraz, in the Ancash region.

With the loan she receives, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy half a dozen sheets, 3 quilts, half a dozen jackets, half a dozen pairs of pants, and 8 dozen pairs of underwear.

Rosario is 52 years old, divorced, and a mother of 2 children. Her oldest daughter is married and her youngest is 5 years old. Living alone with her daughter, Rosario's enthusiasm and willpower have helped her business grow every day.

Translated by from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Rosario pertenece al banco comunal "El Progreso". Se dedica a la venta de ropa, edredones, toallas, pero invierte más el la compra de ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños. Ofrece sus productos a sus amistades y familiares a quienes visita en sus domicilios. Este negocio se desarrolla en la ciudad de Huaraz, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará 1/2 docena de sabanas, 1/4 docena de Edredones, 1/2 docena de casacas, 1/2 docena de pantalones y 8 docenas de ropa interior. Rosario tiene 52 años, es separada y madre de 2 hijos, la mayor ya es casada y la última tiene 5 años. Sólo con su niña, su entusiasmo y fuerza de voluntad le han ayudado para que su negocio crezca mucho más cada día.

loans.use: Purchase of sheets, quilts, jackets, pants, and underwear

loans.name: Fatuma's Starehe Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 26 years old and married with two children, ages 12 and 8. Fatuma owns a small food store, which she opened in 2006. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $90.

Fatuma would like a loan of $650 to replenish her stock of foodstuffs. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in clothing sales, food vending, and a beauty salon.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more items for her food store

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak L., a 55-year-old widow in Kampong Chnang Province, has three children, two of whom are employed as garment factory workers. Their wages of $5 U.S. per day constitute the family income. Because Prak wants to give her family a solid home to live in, she is requesting this loan to purchase the wood and zinc that their new house will be constructed from.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and married with 4 children. She works as a secretary with the (. Children's Village in Makeni. Her husband is a petty trader with a meager income.

Because Mary's salary and her husband's income are insufficient for major family expenses, Mary is requesting a loan of $350 (Le.1,000,000) to purchase zinc sheets and cement to renovate their family home.

loans.use: Purchase cement and zinc sheets to renovate the family house

loans.name: Hawa I.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Hawa M.. She is married and has three children aged, 13, 7, and 2. In 2002, Hawa established her tailoring business. Hawa requires a loan in order to buy more material for cloth-making. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more material for cloth-making.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is 37 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are currently in school. She says selling of lingerie especially for women is very profitable and therefore, she has been selling ladies' lingerie in the local market for five years to help her husband in taking care of the family’s needs.

Augustina wants to use the loan to buy bales of lingerie to increase her inventory and sales for good income. She believes this loan will help her save some money to start paying part of the children’s school fees and the utility bills. Augustina is a member of the group called Confidence. Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie for re-sale

loans.name: Magna

texts.es:
Magna is a member of the Pura Vida Communal Bank. She is single and 27 years old. Magna lives with her parents and everyone in her family has the same [type of] business but operates them independently. Magna buys potatoes in different small towns in the region. She [gathers and transports] them with her father’s car and then sells them in the Santa Elena potato market where her father has two warehouses. Besides that, in the months of July and September, Magna buys cereals and then sells them at wholesale prices to merchants in the different markets located in the city of Ayacucho. Before, Magna also maD. dried potatoes but had to stop that activity because her mother was ill and she had to take care of her.

Magna needs a loan of 2,500 soles - money that will be invested in the purchase of wheat and barley.

Magna dreams of building her house on the land given to her by her father and to have more capital to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Primer Préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30409&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Magna es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.

Magna es soltera y tiene 27 años, Magna vive con sus padres y toda su familia tienen el mismo negocio pero con capitales independientes. Magna compra papa en los diferentes pueblos D. L. región, el acopio lo realiza con el carro D. su papa y lo venD. en el mercado D. papas D. Santa Elena donD. su papa tiene dos depósitos. Además Magna en los meses D. Julio a septiembre compra cereales que luego venD. por mayor a los comerciantes D. los diferentes mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Magna también hacia papa seca, actividad que dejo D. realizar porque su mama estaba delicada D. salud y tenia que atenderL..

Magna necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. trigo y cebada.

Los sueños D. Magna son construir su casa en el terreno que le regalo su papa, tener más capital para ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase wheat and barley

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La señora Aurelia, socia del Banco Comunal Las Lomas de Yarina, ubicado en  AA.HH Los Rosales – Fonavi, distrito de Yarina, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos. Su esposo es electricista. Aurelia con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidió invertir en venta de condimentos.

Aurelia, en la actualidad continúa con la venta de especería. Ella vende en el mercado Nº 2, en la cual está muy contenta de ver crecer el negocio. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 3,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 saco de ají panca, 2 bolsa de ajinomoto, 1 galón de aceite, 1 saco de laurel y otros, así como también ayudará a su esposo en su taller comprando algunos materiales.

Aurelia está muy contenta por el apoyo que le brinda el banco comunal de Manuela Ramos ya que gracias a ello ha podido sobresalir en el negocio, así mismo también puede darles educación superiores a sus 2 últimos hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Aurelia H. is a member of the Las Lomas de Yarina microfinance institution located in AA.HH Los Rosales Ð Fonavi, in the Yarina district of the department of Ucayali. She is 34 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is an electrician. Aurelia decided to invest her first loan from Manuela Ramos (300.00 PEN) in the spice business. Aurelia currently sells spices at the number 2 market. She is quite happy seeing her business grow. With this loan of 3,000.00 PEN, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase 1 sack of panca chili peppers, 2 bags of chili pepper seasoning mix, 1 gallon of cooking oil, 1 sack of bay leaves, and she will help her husband with his workshop by purchasing some supplies. Aurelia is very satisfied with the support that the Manuela Ramos microfinance institution gives her. Thanks to their support, she has been able to excel in her business, as well as provide a higher education for her 2 younger children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chili peppers, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan A. is 42 years old. He is married and has 3 sons. Since 2002, he has been involved in the livestock business started by his father. Elkhan has been educated in agronomy, and this experience has helped him in business, allowing him to open a dispensary in his house and to successfully raise and sell cattle. Elkhan hopes to continue expanding his business to be able to offer a better future for his children, and to raise them as professional, ethical and hardworking adults. Therefore, he is now asking for a loan of US$1,200 that will be used for buying four additional calves. In turn, Elkhan hopes to generate substantial profit by raising and selling them later on.

loans.use: Purchase of four calves

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal S. (in picture with her daughter), 45, and her husband, Mr. Chhean S., 47, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1985 and have six children; one son and five daughters. One of their daughters is married, two children are in school, one daughter is a silk weaver, and one son is a horse-cart driver.

Sophal has been a silk weaver since she was young but has transferred her loom to her daughter while she spins threads for her daughter. Her daughter sells the finished products to the middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Chhean has been a boat builder for over ten years.

Sophal is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a horse for her son's horse-cart and to purchase silk materials for her daughter's weaving.

loans.use: To purchase a horse for her son's horse-cart and to purchase silk materials for her daughter weaving.

loans.name: Mursal

texts.en:
Mursal H. is very young and proactive entrepreneur who is 27 years old. He built a grocery store two years ago; he sells a wide variety of foodstuffs, including cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, and tea. He married just recently, and his wife actively helps him in his store. Musal also works as a policeman in the police department of Bilasuver, the city where he is living now.

Mursal has applied for a loan of 1200 USD to purchase more food to add to his store's inventory. By expanding his business, Mursal will attract more clients and earn more income.

loans.use: Purchase more food to expand his store's inventory

loans.name: Preung

texts.en: Mr. Preung N. was born in 1972 and he now lives in Bro Vash village in Kampong Cham Province. He sells coconuts and bananas. Since this business is doing well, he wants to expand it, and so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more coconuts and bananas to resell. He hopes to increase his income and improve their living conditions with this new loan. His wife, Mrs. Hang Ren, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. Mr. Preung N. is 36 years old and the father of four children, three of whom attend the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four years old. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and bananas to resell.

loans.name: Mirza

texts.es: Mirza vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas que ya son mayores de edad, trabajan y la apoyan mucho. La casa donde viven es propia. Tiene una pequeña peluquería dentro de su domicilio, donde hace cortes de cabello para damas y caballeros. Este  servicio lo viene brindando desde hace 10 años atrás y trabaja durante todo el día. Lo que le gusta de esta labor es que se relaciona con muchas personas con quienes también tiene muy amenas conversaciones. Este negocio le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y lo bueno es que sus hijas la ayudan trayendo clientes y recomendando su buen trabajo. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que ahora solicita mandará a construir un local al costado de su casa, para tener ahí su peluquería, también comprará instrumentos para su labor.
texts.en:
Mirza lives with her husband and two daughters. Both of her daughters are older and both work and help support the family. Mirza has a small hair salon inside of her home, where she provides hair cuts for women and men. She has had this business for 10 years and works every day. What she likes about this business is that she works with people and has good conversations with her customers. Her small salon does well because she is located in a very busy zone. Her daughters also bring clients to her and recommend her good work. This is her 7th loan with MFP and with the money she is requesting, she would like to construct an area outside her house for her salon, as well as buy materials needed for her business.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a new location for her small hair salon, and purchase materials needed to run her business

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Chheng S., 41, is a farmer with 9 children who lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1988, she has been growing and selling rice to earn approximately US$2 every day, while her husband makes US$2 as a palm climber. Every day, her husband goes to collect palm juice and refines it into palm sugar. Chheng recently has requested a loan to make a new investment. She will use the money to raise ducks so she can sell the eggs.

loans.use: To raise ducks.

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people. Its leader, Mrs. L., is 48 years old. She is a good mother who has given birth to eight children. Six of them are single and the others are married. She is married to Reun, 50, who is a Khmer wine distiller.

L. currently earns a living raising pigs in a medium-size stall next to her house. Her investment is running very well because she has skillfully raised pigs in the village for a long time. Due to the business growing, L. is asking for a loan in order to buy more piglets to raise and plans to use the remaining amount of the loan for her husband's business distilling wine.

The other three borrowers are: S., who sells boiled eggs in front of her house and seeks a loan to build a stall for raising pigs; R., who is a fruit seller and requests a loan to buy a cart for transporting fruits to sell at the market; and C., who is a homemaker who cares for three children and applies for a loan as capital to purchase chicks to raise.

All of the borrowers live in Odom Bang Commune, Battambang Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Jahaira De Los Angeles

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León del bello país de Nicaragua, la señora Jahaira M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de joyas comercializadas a diario con el propósito de mantener su hogar compuesto por sus dos pequeños hijos que se dedican a estudiar y por ende debe sufragar sus gastos.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel hoy en día es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las joyas y así continuar comercializándolas en su sector.
texts.en:
In the city of Leon of the beautiful country of Nicaragua, Mrs. Jahaira Munillo daily dedicates her time to her business of selling jewelry with the goal of supporting her home which is made up of two small children who are in school and need her help. Her reason for coming to Ceprodel this time is to request a loan with which she will purchase jewelry that she will resell in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry

loans.name: Hildo

texts.es: Hildo tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su pareja, con la que tiene 5 hijos; con mucho esfuerzo pudo brindarle a su familia una casa propia. De joven era un experto en realizar comederos para vacunos, ovinos y porcinos, habilidad heredada de su padre. Pero desde que formó familia se tuvo que mudar al lugar de su amada esposa, desde entonces, aprendió el arte de cultivar y labrar la tierra en los terrenos heredados por sus suegros. A inicios, sembró café en el intermedio de los cítricos de sus suegros, pero ahora ya se han independizado, pero no deja  de apoyar en todos los trabajos a los padres de su esposa. Hildo es muy feliz en su hogar y con su trabajo, cada vez que cosecha el café lo vende a una casa cafetalera, que por cada kilo le paga 4.80 soles, sus ganancias son seguras y regulares, y ya no está con la tensión de los precios que pueda ofrecer el mercado. Para sus cítricos tiene compradores que van hasta su misma chacra, aunque le pagan un menor precio, le resulta conveniente y ahorra tiempo. Hildo es un nuevo en su banco comunal, decidió ser parte por invitación de un vecino que lo motivó en el tema de los ahorros. Y en este, su primer crédito con MFP, hace compromisos de ser un cliente muy puntual en cada una de las cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la renovación de sus herramientas y una bolsa de urea para el abonado de chacras de café.
texts.en:
Hildo is 47 years old and lives his wife, with whom they've had five children. With a lot of hard work he was able to provide his family with their own home. From a young age he was an expert in feeding cattle, sheep and pigs, an ability he that was passed down from his father. But when he formed his own family he had to move to his wife's place, and since then he has learned the art of cultivating and working on the land he inherited from his in-laws. At first, he planted coffee along with the in-laws' citrus trees. Now he has gone off on his own, but he has not stopped supporting all the work of his wife's parents.

Hildo is very happy at home and at work. Every time he harvests coffee he sells it to a coffee house that pays him 4.80 soles for every kilo. His earnings are safe and dependable, and don't fluctuate like the prices he could offer at the market. For the citrus products, he has buyers who go to the same sales point as the coffee, and although they pay him a lower price, it is convenient and saves time. Hildo is new to his community bank, and he decided to join on the invitation of a neighbor who motivated him with the subject of savings. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to be a client who is punctual with all of his payments. The money he is requesting will be used to upgrade his tools and purchase a bag of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Jessy

texts.es:
Yessy es socia del Banco Comunal Chacco.
Yessy es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Yessy vende lubricantes de carros en un grifo cerca de su comunidad, su esposo trabaja en el grifo se encarga de la administración del grifo.
Yessy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lubricantes.
Los sueños de Yessy son aumentar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Yessy is a member of the Chacco Community Bank. Yessy is a go-getter; she's 34 years old and has a son. Yessy sells automotive lubricants in a shop near her home. Her husband works with her also, as the adminstrator of the shop. Yessy is requesting a loan of 1000 soles ($350 USD), which she'll invest in the purchase of auto lubricants she can sell. Yessy dreams of growing her business and being able to afford a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de lubricantes. (To purchase automotive lubricants)

loans.name: Saldivar Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Saldivar Poty, se conformó en fecha 22 de marzo del 2007, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Ma. Esther S., quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artículos de limpieza, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 8º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El grupo en el transcurso de los ciclos, pasó por algunos inconvenientes, ya que la hija de la Directora General estuvo internada, y otra de las integrantes estuvo en cama muy enferma, respondiendo sin ningún problema al compromiso aceptado, de esta manera el grupo gracias a su trabajo solidario logró salir adelante y seguir trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de  735.000 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de comidas,  venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderías para la despensa(arroz,  azúcar, fideos, lacteos,panificados,yerba,etc),venta de ropas ,venta de lencerías, venta de cosméticos, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de crochet, etc.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee by the name of Saldivar Poty was formed on 22 March 2007. This is thanks to the fact that the current Director General, Maria Esther S., who makes and sells cleaning products, contacted the advisor in a weekly meeting that she was conducting in the neighborhood, so that she (Esther) could learn about the type of work the Enterprising Women’s Committee was doing. Once she was informed about the program, she was able to get together 15 women who are now working very well in their 8th loan cycle, in a mutually supportive manner. During the loan cycles, the group has passed through some difficult times. The Director General’s daughter was very ill and admitted to the hospital. Another of the members was very ill and bedridden for a while. Because the group was very supportive, it accepted responsibility and responded without any trouble; it was able to pull through and continues to work in the program to this day. The average loan size per member is 735.00 PYG, which will be used for different activities, such as: food sales, sewing notions sales, grocery sales (rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, breads, herbs, etc.), clothing sales, lingerie sales, cosmetics sales, fruit and vegetable sales, cleaning products sales, crochet sales, etc. All of the members work to raise funds and they help each other so that they can achieve the goals they all have in common as a group in the Fundación Paraguaya. They actively participate in weekly meetings and they are impeccably supportive of each other.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery staples (rice, sugar, herbs, dairy products, breads, sodas, etc.), to buy ingredients for foods, clothing, sewing notions, lingerie, fruits and vegetables, perfumes, cosmetics, yarn for crocheting, ingredients for cleaning products, earrings, rings, bracelets, necklace chains, clasps, etc.

loans.name: Farajallah

texts.en:
Farajallah is a 44-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Farajallah has been selling fruits and vegetables for over ten years. Farajallah requested a loan of $1700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase fruits and vegetables for his work. Farajallah has been a microcredit client for eight years now and has always paid on time.  

His previous loans helped him improve his work and his financial condition by diversifying his merchandise. Farajallah is special in his work because he sells a big variety of merchandise. His clients are people from his region. Farajallah decided on doing this business because he wanted to improve his family’s income and because of his experience in sales. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru: Курбонов Абдукарим проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Абдукарим более 9 лет занимается торговлей, до этого более 10 лет он работал шофером. Абдукарим в основном торгует запчастями. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Abdukarim K. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. Abdukarim has been in the retail business for more than nine years and has worked as a driver for more than ten years before that. Abdukarim mainly sells spare parts. The client is asking for a loan to increase commodity circulation.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Замире – 40 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей детской одежды. Она торгует на рынка «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда, а также по пятницам на рынке "Джумабазар" и по воскресеньям на рынке "Якшанбебазар" города Худжанда. Замира закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан и часть товара из города Бишкек Республики Киргизстан. Она ездит за товаром 2-3 раза в месяц. Замира кредитуется у нас с 2005 года. Она очень хороший клиент. Замира просит кредит для закупки новой партии летнего детской одежды, футболок, маек и шорт. Тогда у Замиры увеличится ассортимент ее товара.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Zamira is 40 years old. She is married and is a mother of three children. She sells children's clothing. She sells on the Panshabe market of the town of Khujand and also on the Djumabazar market on Fridays and on the Yakshanbazar market of Khujand on Sundays. Zamira buys the goods on the wholesale market in the town of Istaravshan and part of the goods from Bishkek, Republic of Kyrgyztan. She travels for the merchandise two to three times a month. Zamira has been our client since 2005. She is a very good client. Zamira is asking for a loan to buy a new batch of summer children's clothing, t-shirts, tank tops and shorts. This way Zamira will increase the assortment of her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer children's clothing, t-shirts, tank tops and shorts

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel V. D. M. vive en el departamento D. Sonsonate. Hace apenas dos años monto por si sola una tienda personal en su propia casa. Sus dos hijos y su esposo le ayudan en la tienda y a la vez trabajan cada uno por aparte para aportar al mantenimiento D. la casa. A pesar D. haber vivido momentos muy difíciles, Reina y su esposo han logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, dándoles los estudios adecuados que aseguren su formación. Reina y su familia solicitan un préstamo para refinanciar su negocio y hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel V. D. M. lives in the Sonsonate district. It has been almost two years since she opened a store in her own home. Her two children and her husband help with the store and at times they work apart so that one of them can tend to the house. Despite having lived through difficult situations, Reina and her husband have managed to push their children ahead by giving them an adequate education required for their personal growth.

Reina and her family are requesting a loan to fund their business so that it can expand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to grow her business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 41 años, 02 hijos que aun depende de ella.

Maribel, lleva ya varios años dedicando al trabajo de tejidos, nos cuenta que desde muy pequeña, siempre le aficiono los tejidos y le encanta hacer estas manualidades. Para iniciarse mas a fondo en este negocio, decidió sacar un prestamo la cual Manuela Ramos la apoyo con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, implemento su negocio y poco a poco fue haciéndose conocida.

En la Actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y ahora ya tiene una clientela fija que mes a mes realizan sus pedidos, ya que ella trabaja así y como también va ofreciendo a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, le va muy bien y mensualmente genera sus propios ingresos y con el carisma que tiene sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará materiales para realizar sus manualidades como: hilos tren, para tejer en docenas y diferentes colores y algunas telas para adornar sus acabados.

Maribel, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, feliz por que en su negocio le va muy bien. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Maribel belongs to the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of 2 dependent children.

Maribel has been making crocheted item for many years. She told us that when she was little, she had a fondness for knitting and enjoyed making things by hand. In order to start her business, she decided to seek assistance from Manuela Ramos and request her first loan of 300 soles. She used it to launch her business and gradually over time more people knew about her products.

Maribel’s business continues to run smoothly and she now has a steady clientele who place orders every month. Since she does good work, she has started getting referrals from friends, relatives, and neighbors. She has done so well that she is able to generate her own monthly income. Due to her charismatic personality, she is able to generate sales strictly through word of mouth.

With her loan of 500 soles, she will buy materials for making her handicrafts, such as skeins of different colored yarn and various fabrics to adorn the edges.

Maribel is very pleased with her accomplishments and happy that her business is doing very well. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her and other women start and grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making her handicrafts

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Selling under the heat of the sun and sometimes in the rain are the sacrifices Elena A. makes to help her husband support the needs of their family. She sells eggs, cooked balut (chicken embryos), salted eggs and snacks from her pedicab.

Elena is 41 years old and is married to Eduardo, whose occupation is farming. They are blessed with five children, but only three of them are sent to school because of financial problems. The other two children temporarily stopped their schooling and are helping the family earn a living.

Elena drives her pedicab around the village regularly, selling the same products. She wants the business to progress, so she asked for a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP7,000 to use as additional business capital. She hopes the loan will give her the chance to create a more productive business.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Digna Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Digna Esperanza Lojana V. es socia del Banco Comunal San Miguel,  vive en la comunidad Victoria Alta  por el sector  El Valle  a unos 45 minutos a las  afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca.

Digna  tiene 38 años de edad, se encuentra casada, concibió tres hijos de 18, 16, 7 años de edad, su primer hijo este año ingresa a estudiar en la Universidad de Cuenca, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio Guillermo Menzi y su último en la Escuela Octavio Díaz, su esposo se encuentra en el extranjero, emigro para darles a sus hijos un futuro mejor,  debido a la crisis mundial no les envía mucho dinero, la casa en la que vive es propia fruto del esfuerzo y sacrificio de los dos.

Digna se dedica al comercio informal de frutas, verdura, etc.,  además en su casa tiene una tienda de víveres  que es atendida por sus hijos cuando ella no está, siempre da gracias a Dios por el día de vida que la da sea bueno o malo.

Lleva  siete años trabajando junto a su banco comunal que  se reúnen  cada quincena para capacitarse y tener un momento de esparcimiento junto a sus amigas,  nos comenta que con los prestamos que la fundación le ha entregado ha podido ayudar a pagar las deudas de su esposo.

Con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en sus negocios comprando frutas y verduras para vender y si le resta un poco para surtirle a su tienda.

El sueño de Digna es terminar de construir su casa y comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Digna Esperanza Lojana V. is a member of the San Miguel Community Bank and lives in the El Valle neighborhood of Victoria Alta, located 45 minutes outside the city of Cuenca.

Digna is 38 years old, married, and has three sons, aged 18, 16, and 7. Her oldest son is beginning his studies at the University of Cuenca, her second son is a student as Guillermo Menzi High School, and her youngest attends Octavio Díaz School. Her husband is living abroad. He went abroad in order to provide their children a better future, but the world economic crisis has prevented him from sending back much money.
