The home in which they live is the fruit of the couple's hard work and sacrifices, and Digna says that loans from the foundation have enabled her to repay some of her husband's debts.

Digna has a business selling fruit and vegetables. She also has a grocery store in her home which her sons help her run when she is not there. She is grateful to God for every day, be it good or bad.

She has worked with her Community Bank for seven years and attends meetings every two weeks for training and to enjoy some leisure time with her friends in the group.

With this loan from Fundación ESPOIR, Digna will invest in her business by purchasing fruit and vegetables to sell. She will use any remaining funds to stock her shop.

Digna's dream is to finish the construction of her home and to buy herself a car.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit, vegetables, and merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to help her husband take care of their children. She prepares and bakes bread for a living. She started her business four years ago. She overcomes her business challenges with determination and commitment. 

Her bread business brings hope to her family and support from her husband. She has customers who come to her to buy in bulk. Her only problem now is that she doesn't have the money to buy enough raw materials to meet her customer's demand. She is requesting a loan to help her to remain in business and also to save some money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy baking supplies, including flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es una socia emprendedora y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 48 años, tiene un hijo mayor de edad, es madre soltera.
Natividad tiene una bodega de abarrotes que funciona en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al progreso” desde hace seis años, donde siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una socia muy puntual. El primer crédito que obtuvo en este banco fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de golosinas para vender en la vereda de su casa, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para surtir su negocio, comprará arroz, asúcar, fideos, y otros productos. La meta de Natividad es tener una tienda con todo tipo de artículos y seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Natividad is an enterprising and collaborative member of her community bank. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, region of Ucayali, Peru. She is a 48-year-old single mother, and her son is fully grown. Natividad has a convenience store that she runs out of her home. She has been part of the "Mujeres al progreso" (Women of Progress) Community Bank for the past six years and has always been known for being a very punctual member. Her first loan from the community bank was for 300 soles, and she used it to purchase snacks to sell on the sidewalk at her house. Currently she is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $350), which she plans to use to stock her business by purchasing rice, sugar, noodles and other products. Natividad's goal is to have a store selling all kinds of items and to keep working to make headway.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store by purchasing rice, sugar, noodles and other items

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda V. is from the village of Usocan. She is 54 years old. Alfreda is married and has 54 school-aged children. To make a living, Alfreda raises and sells pigs. Alfreda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Alfreda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfreda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Alfreda is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Alfreda 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy feed and supllies for her piglets

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 daughters in Corredores, a rural region of Southern Costa Rica. Juana has a business selling hand-made clothing, necklaces and bracelets from her home. She demonstrates a strong work ethic; assembling jewellery, making and selling clothes by day, while working evenings and nights in a local restaurant as a waitress.

Similar to the story of many low income individuals in Costa Rica, and across the world, Juana has found it impossible to obtain approval for a business loan from the local bank in Corredores. The bank requires a guarantor of a loan to be someone who is not part of her immediate family. Juana does not know any suitable guarantors, with a steady income and a secure job, other than her husband. From Juana´s perspective, the rules of the formal banking system have had the effect of excluding her from the financial services she seeks.

 In an effort to extend the reach of financial services to deserving entrepreneurs, Fundacion Mujer proposes to lend Juana 500,000 colons (around $862 US), with her husband as the loan guarantor. This will be her second loan with Fundacion Mujer. Juana received her first loan in 2008 for 100,000 colons ($173 US) which was repaid from her business earnings, on time and in full, within 6 months.

With this loan, Juana plans to purchase raw materials such as cloth and necklace parts in an effort to expand her jewellery and clothes-selling business. Recently, many of Juana’s regular clients have inquired about the possibility of purchasing shoes. She would like to satisfy this demand and expand her business by providing quality footwear to her clients. She will use this loan to buy shoes from a contact in Panama to sell from her home in Costa Rica. Juana dreams of expanding her business and earning more money so she can provide a better standard of living for her family. She says that since starting her business 2 years ago, her self-confidence has increased. Juana is now a strong believer in her ability to improve living conditions for her family through her determination and hard work. 

Your contribution is a direct investment in the betterment of the lives of families living in a poor community of southern Costa Rica. By lending to Juana, a hard-working entrepreneur, you are enabling her to build towards a higher standard of living. On behalf of Juana and her family, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: For the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Mujeres Capactitadas 1,2,3,6 Group

texts.en:
Isabel is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Capacitadas (Capable Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural villages surrounding Puerto Plata where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure made of wood, concrete and a tin roof as a single mother with her one adult child.

Isabel is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans, and she looks forward to continuing to grow with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business taking orders from her clients to purchase bed sheets, bedspreads, women's blouses and women's underwear in Santiago (the closest large city) and selling them at a profit. She will use the profits to continue improving her house to the point where there are no more wooden walls (which are susceptible to termites) with the long term goal of adding a small corner store to her home so that she can work from home.

Additionally, she would like to see her son become a professional and she is using part of the profits from her loan to fund his university education, studying accounting. He is the first person in her family to attend university. She thanks you all for your support and would like to urge more people to join Esperanza so that they can improve their lives like she has.

loans.use: Bed Sheets, women's blouses, women's underwear and bedspreads to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is thirty-six years of age and married.  She mothers four children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. As a result, the major occupation of the people is mainly fishing.

Veronica is a trader. She trades in bags of cement. She sells in a store by the road side in the community. Veronica procures her goods from Accra. According to her, she has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy bags of cement

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en: Mouna is a 22-year-old single woman. She works as a home-based clothing sales person in her town. She started her small business in 2005. Today, Mouna is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to expand her inventory for the winter and propose a bigger choice of clothes to her customers.

loans.use: expand her inventory

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 50 years old and is living in Norala, South Cotabato. She has a hog-raising business. She started her business back in 2007 with six piglets. She is a mother of 6 children, and her eldest is still 27 years old. She receives enough income for her family from her piggery.

She would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to purchase feed and vitamins for the pigs. This is very helpful to sustain her family and business.

loans.use: feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rwenyerere Bakyara Kweterana Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Mary is 47 years old and married with four children aged from 11 to 5 years.

Mary has operated a grocery shop in Buzaniro trading centre for two years, from which she is able to make 35,000/= as weekly profits. She mostly sells yellow bananas plus other produce and she is mostly affected by the late payments from the customers that take the goods on credit.

Mary ensures that her prices are fair as long as she gets the profits from her transactions. She would like to expand her business so that it can generate more income as well as educating all her children to the highest levels. She needs a loan to be able to improve on her grocery by buying more bananas for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es:
Carlos Roberto Ramírez J., tiene la edad de 23 años, está en unión libre, y vive únicamente con su compañera. El crédito lo quiere para dar asistencia a su finca, el desea realizar unos trabajos en la finca y así lograr que los cultivos produzcan más. La idea es mejorar y aumentar la capacidad de producción y aumentar el área del cultivo.  Don Carlos cuenta con área de diversos cultivos en producción tal es el caso del cultivo del café. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento y lograr una mejor calidad y  obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de su cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Carlos también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mayor estabilidad económica, y así poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Carlos Roberto Ramírez J. is 23-years-old has a live-in girlfriend. She is the only person with whom he lives. He wants this credit to help his farm. He wants to do several jobs on the farm so his crops will produce more. His idea is to improve and increase his production capacity and to expand his area for growing crops. Don Carlos has a production area with different crops like coffee. He hopes to give it adequate maintenance and to achieve better quality so he can make the most income possible at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms they have offered him. Don Carlos has worked in agriculture for several years. He hopes to improve his quality of life in the future and to have more economic stability so he can keep growing as a person and a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to his farm

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie L. is from the village of Timogsay, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Marjorie owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling personal items like bags, T-shirts, blouses and other dress styles in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marjorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Marjorie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jobel

texts.en:
Jobel is a 41-year-old married man with three children. His oldest child is only nine years old, so he works hard to save for their future. He says school fees keep increasing. In 1994, Jobel started his Disco Mobile Rental.  He bought speakers and sound systems that he rents to other municipalities during fiestas and other events.  From his income and hard work, he was able to start his own welding shop that he hopes to expand upon.

Jobel has been a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. since 2007.  He said that his previous loans were helpful in improving his business. He is now requesting a loan Php 50,000.  He will use this loan to buy disco light and speakers.  He also plans to buy a welding machine, tools and an oxygen tank. 
--------------------------
“Asenso Loans are a new product offered by CEVI for clients showing strong performance in previous loans, and who need a larger loan in order to continue to develop.  CEVI recognises the importance of helping people out of poverty, as well as providing continuous support and training as these clients progress.  
CEVI aims to provide financial services, not only our poorest clients, but also to our developing clients who should be rewarded for the way in which they display promising business skills.  Please help us provide support for these clients”

“Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the past 5 years.  Based in Bohol, they have 22 branches throughout the Philippines, and will soon be adding two more branches.  CEVI has recently been awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  Social performance monitoring is imperative in order to measure a microfinance institute’s effectiveness.  The fact that CEVI is participating in this process speaks volumes.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings.  Please feel free to take a look at the CEVI Website”

loans.use: Buy speakers, Disco lights, welding machine and tools.

loans.name: Albert's Group

texts.en:
Albert M. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He is 21 years old. Albert is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Albert is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Albert owns & operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Albert has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Albert joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Albert is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Albert from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Kerimbubu's Group

texts.ru:
Литературные произведения и множество современных фильмов описывают жизни простых людей, как они ценой неимоверных усилий и трудов достигают большого успеха в жизни и претворяют свои мечты в жизнь. Но одно произведение, не смотря на то каким бы большим оно ни было, или художественный фильм, не смотря на то, каким бы многосерийным ни был, не смогут передать со всей точностью все подробности их повседневной жизни. Они лишь могут передать отдельные моменты и дать общее представление о жизни своих героев. Герои нашей истории вполне заслуживают быть героями таких книг или фильмов, ведь они каждый день трудятся ради своих семей и пытаются обеспечить им хорошую жизнь. 

Илязова Керимбубу – лидер группы. Некоторое время назад Керимбубу постигло несчастье; она потеряла мужа. Но это её не сломало, а наоборот дало ей дополнительные силы, ведь она – мать четверых детей. Сейчас все её четверо детей уже женились и живут отдельно. Сама Керимбубу предпочла не зависеть от детей и на данный момент занимается выращиванием сельхоз продукции. На своём земельном участке, она выращивает пшеницу и картошку. Осенью от продажи урожая она получает весь её годовой доход. Керимбубу занимается земледелием уже четыре года и набралась немалого опыту. Тогда она начинала с пяти тысяч сомов. Сейчас Керимбубу за год зарабатывает до тридцати тысяч сомов. Керимбубу нужен кредит, чтобы купить солярки для полевых работ. 

Партнёры Керимбубу по группе:

Ибаевой Анаркан пятьдесят семь. Анаркан с мужем вырастили семерых детей. Муж Анаркан сейчас на пенсии, но он и Анаркан вместе с детьми занимаются выращиванием сельхоз продукции. Годовой доход Анаркан и её мужа – около пятидесяти тысяч сомов. Анаркан обратилась за кредитом, чтобы закупить ГСМ и семян пшеницы. 
Чороевой Гульнаре сорок пять. Муж Гульнары – тракторист. Гульнара – мать пяти дочерей. Гульнара и её муж сейчас готовят поле для посева; будут сеять пшеницу. Прошлой осенью они собрали шесть тонн пшеницы. Гульнара нуждается в кредите, чтобы закупить семян картошки. 

Елтуйбасовой Кулуйпе пятьдесят восемь. Кулуйпа – вдова, и мать шестерых детей. Кулуйпа вместе с детьми занимаются земледелием; выращиванием сельхоз продукции. Кулуйпа обратилась за кредитом, так как ей нужны средства для закупки семян клевера. Кулуйпа надеется получить хороший урожай, и от продажи урожая она планирует купить скот и женить сына. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Literary creations and numerous contemporary movies describe lives of simple people, how they achieve big successes in life at the cost of unbelievable efforts and labor and turn their dreams into reality. However, not one book, no matter how big it could be and not a movie, no matter how many episodes it could contain, can show all of the nuances of people’s daily lives. These creations can only show single moments and offer an overall understanding about the lives of our heroes. The heroes of our story deserve to be heroes of these books or movies because they labor every day for their families and try to provide them with good lives. Kerimbubu I. is the leader of this group. Some time ago, she lost her husband. However, this did not break her and, on the contrary, gave her additional strength because she is a mother of four children. Now, all of the four children are married and live separately. Kerimbubu preferred not to be dependent on her children and is currently involved in growing agricultural crops. She grows wheat and potatoes on her land plot. In the autumn, she sells the harvest and receives her yearly income. Kerimbubu has been involved in farming for four years and gained quite a bit of experience. Originally, she started with five thousand som and now earns up to thirty thousand som per year. Currently, Kerimbubu needs a loan in order to buy diesel fuel for field work. Kerimbubu’s group partners are: Anarkan Ibaeva is fifty-seven years old. She and her husband raised seven children. Her husband is currently retired, but he, Anarkan and their children are involved in growing agricultural products. Their yearly income is about fifty thousand som. Anarkan requested this loan in order to buy fuel and wheat seeds. Gulnara C. is forty-five years old. Her husband is a tractor driver. Gulnara is a mother of five daughters. Currently, Gulnara and her husband are preparing the field for sowing. They will be planting wheat. Their last autumn harvest was six thousand ton of wheat. Gulnara needs a loan in order to buy potato seeds. Kuluypa E. is fifty-eight years old. She is a widow and a mother of six children. Together with her children, Kuluypa is involved in farming, specifically growing agricultural products. She requested this loan because she currently needs means to purchase clover seeds. Kuluypa hopes to get a good harvest and plans to use profits from the sale of the harvest to buy livestock and marry off her son.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of diesel fuel for field work

loans.name: Massa

texts.fr: Massa  E. est une femme de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle habite à Dayes une ville située sur l'une des montagnes de Kpalimé, elle est revendeuse des produits alimentaires comme savons, sucres, tomates en boîtes, de l’huile et autres. Avec ce prêt, Massa voudrait agrandir sa marchandise en achetant des cartons de savons, d’huile,des cartons de sardines et autres choses aussi. Avec le bénéfice réalisé, Massa souhaiterait épargner de l’argent et le reste de son économie ira dans les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Massa E., 34, is married and the mother of four children. She lives in Dayes, a town situated in the mountains, and she sells various items such as soap, sugar, tinned tomatoes, oil, etc. With this loan Massa would like to expand her inventory by buying cartons of soap, oil, cartons of sardines, and so on. With the profit she expects to make, Massa would like to save money and also cover some of the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for resale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married. She has five children who go to school. She also takes care of her elderly mother. 

Margaret owns a charcoal store on Lubaga Road. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She buys these bags of charcoal from the villages of Luwero and uses public transport to and from shopping. Margret goes shopping twice a month. She has been in this charcoal business for nine years. 

Besides her charcoal business, she also fries and sells samosas. Margaret works from her home, so she doesn’t pay rent for her business. She sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges includes transportation and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow big and start selling on wholesale only. 

She joined MCDT because of low interest compared to other MFIs. Margaret resides in and owns a four-room house. The family has access to electricity, but has no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima B. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Fatima is widowed and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Fatima owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Fatima has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fatima joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fatima is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Fatima from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio T. is from the village of Minongan, Quezon, Bukidnon. He is 27 years old. Rogelio is single. To make a living, Rogelio owns & operates a  motorela or habal-habal service to local community members. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rogelio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rogelio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es: Balvina vive en una aldea de San Martín Jilotepeque tiene 50 años de edad casada y tiene 7 hijos a su cargo. Balvina trabaja en su propia casa se dedica a la crianza de animales y también se dedica a hacer güipiles típicos para venderlos. Solicita el credito ara la compra de abono organico para cafetales, compra de cerdos, queire comprar un motor de agua para sacar el agua del pozo y regar su cultivo, dentro de sus planes se encuentra la siembra de milpa, plantas de cafe. Su sueño es que su negocio poco a poco prospere mas y mas.
texts.en:
Balvina lives in a village of San Martin Jilotepeque. She is 50 years old, married and has 7 children in her care. Balvina works in her own home raising animals and making traditional blouses to sell. She is seeking the loan to buy organic fertilizers for coffee plantations and to buy pigs. She wants to buy a water motor to draw water from the well to irrigate her crop. Her plans also include sowing crops (coffee plants). Her dream is that little by little her business grows more and more.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in fertilizers and pigs

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 32 years old and he is married.  Jean de Dieu is commonly known in the business of selling clothes and he has been in this business for about 5 years. The hours of his business are from 8 am to 6 pm every day.

 After realizing that his capital is still too low to expand meaningfully, Jean de Dieu decided he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, he will purchase different styles of clothes to sell which in turn will increase his sales as well as profits.  If successful, he will create some other sources of income and create more jobs to the people from his community.

loans.use: Different styles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Tarr’S Group

texts.en:
Esther B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called T.’s Group.  She is 55 years old, married, and has nine children who are between the ages of 15 to 36 years old. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For ten years, she has been selling rice, beans, cooking oil and fish in the “Old Road” Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 69,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, and beans. 

She describes herself as an easy-going woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, meat, fish and beans

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose D.  is currently in the business of baking bread and selling rice and beans and is requesting a loan to stock more beans and rice to sell.  Rose is 28 years old and is divorced.  She has 3 children and 2 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats to raise.

loans.use: Stock more beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Success To One Group

texts.en:
Mondyu Z., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Success To One. She is 47 years old, married and has four children who are between the ages of 14 and 25 years. She also cares for one sibling. She was only able to attend school through tenth grade due to a lack of financial support. She describes herself as a determined woman.

For sixteen years Mondyu has been selling fish, meat, chicken and pigs’ feet in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 LRD portion of this 45,000 LRD group loan to buy more cartons of fish, meat, chicken and pigs’ feet. Her goals are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish, meat, chicken and pigs' feet

loans.name: Araba Paao Sophia

texts.en:
Araba Paao Sophia D. is married and has seven dependents. She has no formal educational background.   Araba sells a variety of fish and soaps at Abura. Her husband is a farmer.  Araba uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of the family expenses. Araba will use the loan to purchase more fish and soap for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to reinvest back into her business.

The picture shows the dried fish she sells.

loans.use: purchase more fish and soap for sale

loans.name: Mary Vic

texts.en: Mary Vic D. C. is from the village of Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old, married and has 1 infant. To make a living, Mary Vic owns and operates a business venture selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Mary Vic has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Mary Vic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Vic is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Vic from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 37 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Después de haber trabajado por muchos años,  como ayudante en la venta de gas, aprendió todos los movimientos de este negocio y cuando el dueño le propuso traspasarle el negocio no lo dudo. Es así que hace 1 año, viene dedicándose a la venta de gas,  que se sitúa al  costado de su casa, de esa manera puede brindar un servicio oportuno a sus clientes. Trabaja con la ayuda de un joven, quien con su moto lineal reparte los balones  de gas a los domicilios, por medio de pedido vía telefónica. Esta muy contenta con su negocio; ya que le va muy bien, y lo que más le gusta es que gana muchas amistades que la prefieren a pesar de la ardua competencia del mercado. Con el tiempo, desea ampliar  su negocio, para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Es su 11avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a seguir pagando puntualmente como hasta ahora. En su grupo comunal, es una socia muy respetada por la puntualidad  de sus cuotas. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará más balones de gas, ya que generalmente trabaja con créditos, para seguir abasteciendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Victoria is 37 years old and is a hard working mother who lives in her own home, along with her husband and four children.  After many years of working as a natural gas sales assistant, she learned all of the ins and outs of the business, so when the business owner proposed transferring it to her, she had no doubt about it.

For the past year, she’s been selling natural gas from a location alongside her home, so she is able to offer opportune service to her customers.  She also has a helper, who uses his motorcycle to deliver cylinders to the homes of customers who have phoned in their orders.

She is happy about her business because it’s going well for her.  What she enjoys most is that she is able to make many friends who prefer to use her services, despite the fierce competition in the market.  She eventually wants to expand her business so that she can better her children’s quality of life.

This will be her 11th loan through MFP and she is committed to continue making her payments on time.  Because of her punctuality, she is much respected within her communal bank.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more compressed gas cylinders – she usually works with loans – in order to supply her customers.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Berlina

texts.en:
Berlina C. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 51 years old. and married with three adult children. To make a living, Berlina has a business buying and selling sweet and green bananas. Berlina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Berlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional bananas. This will be the second loan taken out by Berlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar tiene su negocio que es la venta de sacos vacios y envases plásticos. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con Fundación por lo que ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente. El tiene una gran variedad de clientes que siempre llegan a comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de sacos vacios y venderlos más baratos.
texts.en: Julio Cesar's business is selling empty sacks and plastic containers.  This is not the first time that he has had loans from Fundación Leon 2000 and he has been an excellent client.  He has a large number of different customers who always come to buy the products that he offers.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy empty sacks and sell them more cheaply.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
AMINATA T. est une célibataire âgée de 35 ans, mère d’un  enfant qui vit dans une famille nucléaire à Fana Badialan, un des quartiers de la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro République du Mali.
 Diplômée de l’Institut Universitaire de Gestion (IUG), enseignante de son état dans une école fondamentale, Aminata en plus de son activité principale, exerce le commerce d’habillements, de cosmétiques et de chaussures pour mieux s’occuper de ses charges personnelles. Elle a commencé avec le prêt solidaire avant de venir au prêt individuel.  Elle a  remboursé sans aucune difficulté ses deux prêts précédents.
Pour ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des chaussures, des produits cosmétiques et des habits. Elle s’approvisionne à LOME (capitale du TOGO). Elle effectue sa vente en gros avec les clients de Bamako et en détail au niveau de son service et à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle compte avoir 450 000FCFA de bénéfice au cours de son cycle de prêt qui servira à couvrir ses dépenses personnelles et payer l’intérêt du prêt.
texts.en: Ms. Aminata T. is 35 years old, unmarried, and the mother of one child living in a nuclear family in Fana Badialan, a district of Fana City, Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali. With her degree from a management institute, the Institut Universitaire de Gestion (IUG), and as a teacher in an elementary school, Aminata also has a side business involving clothing, cosmetics, and footwear. She does this to do better in meeting her personal expenses. She started with a solidarity loan before coming to individual loans. She has paid back her two preceding loans without any problems at all.   For this new loan, Aminata intends to purchase shoes, cosmetics, and clothing.  She gets her supplies in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She sells wholesale to men and women customers of Bamako. She sells retail at work and out of her home. She plans on having 450,000 francs CFA in profit over the course of her loan cycle.  The profits will be used to meet personal expenses and to cover the loan interest.

loans.use: Buying shoes, clothing, and cosmetics

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 22-year old single woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. Josephine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josephine has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business expansion. Josephine is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase general store stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing scrap metals.

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her husband’s embroidery business. With the loan he will buy embroidery supplies such as fabrics, colored thread and beads in bulk to offer better quality services to his clients by preparing different varieties of embroidered clothing. He operates his shop in the market and is well known among his clients for his good quality work. Tahira is hopeful that her husband’s business will improve after the loan investment which will result in making her family’s life better. 

Tahira was married eight years ago and has four children. Two of them are studying and the others stay at home. She wants to enroll her remaining children in school, for which her husband needs to improve his business income because he is the only breadwinner in the family. 

Tahira lives with her family in Mian channu, which is a small city located in the Punjab province in Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house where she moved seven years ago. 

She is a new loan user, and this is the first time she has applied for a loan from Asasah. She is hopeful that it will be a good decision for her family's future.

loans.use: To buy embroidery supplies for her husband's business

loans.name: Rosa Fabiola

texts.es:
La Señorita. Rosa Z. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive por el sector de Huizhil que  pertenece a la parroquia de Baños, esta parroquia es conocida por sus aguas termales, su rica gastronomía y sus bellos paisajes.

La Señorita. Rosa tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive haciéndole compañía a su abuelita, quien tiene casa propia.
 
Nuestra socia de lunes a viernes se dedica a sus estudios universitarios encontrándose en su segundo año de Economía y los fines de semana labora con su padre como cajera de un local de venta de mariscos, trabaja de de 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, trabaja allí por 3 años.

Es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su mamá, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un computador para sus estudios. Su meta es culminar sus estudios y poder viajar.
texts.en:
Miss Rosa Z. is a member of the "Mujeres de Combate" (Fighting Women) community bank.  She lives in Huizhil, in Baños parish.  This parish is known for its hot springs, its fine food and its beautiful landscape.

Rosa is 19 years old.  She is single and lives with her grandmother, who owns her own home, keeping her company.

From Monday to Friday, Rosa studies at university.  She is in her second year of a degree in economics.  On weekends, she works with her father as a cashier in a place that sells seafood.  She works from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  She has worked there for 3 years.

This is the third loan that Rosa has had through her community bank.  She was invited to join by her mom.  Rosa will use her loan money to buy a computer for her studies.  Her goal is to finish her studies and travel.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es: La señora Olga Lidia E. García es cliente nueva se dedica a la actividad de venta de zapatos y otros ,inicio el negocio hace mas de cinco años con los ahorros que le generaba el ingreso de su cónyuge al inicio empezó con pedidos pequeños y repartiendo la mercadería entre sus amistades mas cercanas hoy en día es conocida y tiene una lista clientes fijos su esposo trabaja como taxista y tienen un niño de nueve años que esta en edad escolar no tiene deuda y cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y personales su sueño a futuro es tener un local propio requiere el préstamo para invertir en comprar mercadería para su negocio es por ello que se propone el crédito.
texts.en: Sra. Olga Lidia is a new client who sells clothing, shoes and other products. She began this business more than five years ago with the savings from her husband's income. In the beginning, her business sold a few things and distributed her merchandise amongst her closest friends. Today, she is well-known and has a list of steady clients. Her husband works as a taxi driver and they have a 9-year-old son that is attending school. Sra. Olga Lidia doesn't have any debt and says that she has great professional and personal references. Her dream is to have her own business. She needs this loan to invest in buying merchandise for her business and for this reason she is requesting the loan.

loans.use: To buy shoes & clothes for her store.

loans.name: Maria Betty

texts.es: Maria tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa con sus padres en la parte rural del distrito de Olmos en el norte de Perú. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios básicos de agua y luz. Desde hace dos años, se dedica a la compra y venta de pollo. Ella compra los animales de sus vecinos que los crían para luego venderlos al público general en el mercado local. Con sus ingresos, ella puede solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a sus padres con sus gastos familiares. Desea aumentar su mercadería con la compra de más animales para vender. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles. María agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Maria is 24 years old and single. She lives in her parents' home in a rural area of the Olmos district in northern Peru. She currently does not have basic services like electricity  and running water. For two years, she has been buying and selling chickens for a living. She buys the animals from her neighbors, who raise and subsequently sell the chickens to the general public at the local market. With the proceeds, she is able to cover her personal expenses and help her parents with the family expenses. She would like to increase her stock by purchasing more animals to sell. For this reason, she thinks that it is opportune to request a  500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Maria gives thanks to the Kiva lenders for their support in helping her business grow.

loans.use: Purchase more animals to sell

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bakary Sidibé est un homme marié de 32 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle élargie, chez son père, dans le quartier Dougounina de la ville de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire moderne, très vite il commença les activités économiques, notamment l’achat vente de pièces détachées. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son père qui fut un mécanicien garagiste très réputé de la place. Avec une expérience de 15 ans, il maîtrise son activité. 
Avant d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, Monsieur Bakary Sidibé n’arrivait pas à mener à bien son activité à cause d’un manque de fonds de roulement.
C’est ainsi qu’il décida d’intégrer l’institution afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre. Il est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter, une grande quantité de pièces détachées auprès des grossistes et effectuera sa vente en détail et au comptant.
Le bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA qu’il espère gagner va lui permettre d’agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr Bakary Sidibé is a 32 year old man, married, and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in a traditional family, at his father's home, in the neighborhood of Dougounina in the city of Bougouni.

Having not attended school, he began working at a young age, notably in the purchasing and sales of spare car parts. He learned this activity from his father, who was a well-respected mechanic.  He is very good at his work, having done this for the past 15 years. Prior to joining the microlending organization Soro Yiriwaso, Mr Sidibé was struggling to maintain his business due to a lack of consistent funds. He decided to join the organization in order satisfy the demands of his customers to be able to grow his business. He is asking for a second loan from Soro Yiriwaso, after having reimbursed the first loan on time. 

This loan would allow him to purchase a large quantity of spare parts from wholesalers and then re-sell either to retailers for cash. The estimated monthly profits of approximately 75,000 FCFA [approximately 160 USD] he hopes to receive will allow him to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase spare car parts

loans.name: Monique

texts.en: Monique is 48 years old. She has three children who are between the ages of 18 and 26 years old. She adopted one and the other two are her own and they are both in school. Her husband sells foodstuffs. Monique works with her husband; she sells foodstuffs and they rear a cow. They grow green bananas and, as you can see in the photo, there are banana trees. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs and a cow to make more profits because in the future, she plans to open up a shop of her own.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is from the village of Butay, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 22 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Mary Jean owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling firewood in the local community. Mary Jean has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mary Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional firewood. This loan will be the first one taken out by Mary Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood

location.town: Butay, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene  30 años de edad, tiene dos hijos menores,  Julia  cuenta con casa propia y vive con sus esposo, en un  zona en donde las personas se dedican a las labores agrícolas así como al comercio de productos de artesanías, zona rural ubicada a 15 km de la ciudad de Piura, en el camino al Distrito de Catacaos.

Julia se dedica a la elaboración de chicha y harina de jora, desde hace mas de 08 años,  desarrollando su actividad en la zona donde vive y elaborandolo en su propio domicilio.

Julia  requiere de un préstamo en EDPYME Aternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para poder adquirir insumos para la elaboración de chicha ( Maíz , azúcar, leña); así como para realizar arreglos en la parte donde funciona su cocina, ampliación y techado con calaminas), esta inversión ayudara a mejorar su  calidad de vida.

Julia tiene  muy buena referencias,  por parte de las personas que la conocen, la consideran una mujer trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Julia tiene  30 años de edad, tiene dos hijos menores,  Julia  cuenta con casa propia y vive con sus esposo, en un  zona en donde las personas se dedican a las labores agrícolas así como al comercio de productos de artesanías, zona rural ubicada a 15 km de la ciudad de Piura, en el camino al Distrito de Catacaos.

Julia se dedica a la elaboración de chicha y harina de jora, desde hace mas de 08 años,  desarrollando su actividad en la zona donde vive y elaborandolo en su propio domicilio.

Julia  requiere de un préstamo en EDPYME Aternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para poder adquirir insumos para la elaboración de chicha ( Maíz , azúcar, leña); así como para realizar arreglos en la parte donde funciona su cocina, ampliación y techado con calaminas), esta inversión ayudara a mejorar su  calidad de vida.

Julia tiene  muy buena referencias,  por parte de las personas que la conocen, la consideran una mujer trabajadora y responsable.

loans.use: comprar insumos para su negocio y realizar alguas mejoras en el lugar de produccion.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung, 58, is a married woman with four children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. She makes money to feed her family members by selling groceries from the door of her home. 

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater variety of stock. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of stock

loans.name: May Amor

texts.en:
May Amor is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

May Amor has a retail shop and eatery that sells & serves different dishes. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking dishes.

May Amor is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, May Amor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking dishes.

loans.name: Kao

texts.en:
Kao lives in Ornlong Veng in Siem Reap Province. To make a living, she sells different kinds of meatballs in her community from her motor-cart. From this, she could make around 3 USD in profit a day. She has a life partner in her husband who is a rice farmer. Besides her meatball-selling business, Kao often helps support her husband in the farming business as well.

Her motorbike, which she uses as a vehicle to transport her meatballs to sell, is broken, and this is an obstacle for her in running her business. Therefore, Kao is requesting funding from Kiva in order to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old broken one.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle to replace her old broken one.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business in the future.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase building materials, cement, and sand. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase building materials, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, 55, is married with eight children and lives in the Philippines. She is raising a pig to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. 

Rosemarie has requested a loan to purchase additional pigs to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en:
Bonny is a 48-year-old married man with three children, living in  a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children up to university. He has been cutting and selling firewood to schools around the area and has done the business for twenty-two years now. His major challenge is always lack of manpower to cut down the trees and then chop them into pieces and his dream is buy a tree cutting machine.

Bonny needs the loan to buy trees to be chopped into firewood for selling.

loans.use: To buy  trees to be chopped into firewood for selling.

loans.name: Teresita De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresita, vive en una localidad en la  en eses lugar hay muchos  árboles  de pinos, ella  es  casada con el señor  Miguel  y con quien procreo cuatro hijos que aun están a su  responsabilidad.
    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en  la compra  de   catálogos  para vender cosmeticos, en ésta actividad lleva  un  año en lo que comenta que le va bien  ya que con ello ha tenido  un buen resultado  en sus ingresos de su hogar.
  A ella la motivo una compañera  para  que  venda cosmeticos y se animo, pues así tendría mejores ingresos  y  también apoyar a su esposo con la educación de sus hijos.
  Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad  pueda mejorar su estado económico  y sacar adelante a su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresita lives in a town where there are many pine trees. She is married to Sr. Miguel and they have four children who are their responsibility.

Teresita is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of catalogs for selling cosmetics. She has been in this business for one year and says that she is doing well. Teresita has achieved good results with her household income.

Her husband encouraged her to sell cosmetics as a way of bringing in more income. Teresita is also able to help her husband with providing an education for their children. What she desires most from her small business is to improve her financial situation so that her small family can move forward.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics of various brands.

loans.name: Wonder

texts.en: Wonder is 46 year old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has four children between 10 and 24 years old, all of whom are in school and live at home. For the past fifteen years she has been selling cold water, rice bags and charcoal in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more water by the sack, rice bags and charcoal for her business.  She hopes to send her children to quality schools and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more water by the sack, rice bags, and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Luchadoras se formó con la unión de vA. vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Ella se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que día a día luchan por el sustento de su familia.
La Señora Bonifacia es una de las integrantes del comité, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de artículos. Todos sus clientes quedan muy admirados con su trabajo. Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 3  hijos y su marido quien trabaja  como Contratista. Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo. 
La señora Bonifacia  solicita el crédito para la compra de productos para su despensa, como ser comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y otros. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Luchadoras' committee was created when a number of neighbors from the town of Mariano Roque Alonso joined together.  The members created a very united group and are capable of jointly carrying out activities that strengthen their team spirit.  They describe themselves as very hard-working and tenacious women who work hard every day to support their families.

Bonifacia is one of the committee's members.  She has a well-stocked store where she sells all kinds of goods.  All of her customers are very impressed with her work.  She has a very united family.  She has three children and her husband works as a contractor.  She is very happy with her business and the training sessions that her group receives.

Bonifacia is requesting this loan to buy products for her store such as food, drinks, dairy products, etc.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Uk is humble 37-year-old woman who resides in Kompong Chhnang province. She is a tradeswoman who runs a business selling beans. She buys beans from local farms and resells them at the marketplace. Uk earns an average of 3 USD a day. 

Uk is planning to start a new business raising and selling pigs for breeding and for meat. She is therefore requesting a loan from the Kiva partner HKL to purchase pigs. In the future, Uk hopes to improve her family’s living standard and secure them from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Inom

texts.ru: Ином женат, отец четверых детей. Он опытный предприниматель. Более 15 лет он занимается выращиванием пшеницы и откормом скота на селе. От проданной пшеницы он получает доходы, также откорм и купля-продажа крупного рогатого скота приносит немалые доходы. Но следует отметить о том что, по словам Инома скот нужно купить своевременно, когда цена на них падает. Сейчас как раз таки такое время. Вот поэтому для приобретения скота, минеральных удобрений и семян ему нужны средства. Этот займ поможет ему расширить его бизнес.
texts.en: Inom is married and is a father of four children.  He is an experienced entrepreneur.  He has been involved in growing wheat and fattening up livestock for over 15 years.  Inom earns an income from sales of wheat, and fattening up and buying-selling cattle brings in a good income as well.  We need to note that, according to Inom's words, livestock purchases need to be timed when their prices drop.  Right now is precisely this time.  Inom needs funds to purchase livestock, mineral fertilizers and seeds.  This loan will help him to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with two children. One child attends school while the other one is too young for school. Hamisi has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Hamisi has operated a function decoration business for the past 5 years. His potential clients are mostly people around his town who need his services. He faces a major challenge with seasonality because he works during the festive seasons.

With the Kshs 25,000 loan Hamisi wants to purchase lights, cables and wires for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase lights, cables and wires for his business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a steel bender. Abena has been a small-scale trader at Kokoado in Elmina, Ghana for five years. She uses her income to assist her husband in educating their children. Abena will use the loan to purchase slippers for sale. With the new profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase slippers for sale.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 26-year-old lady who has a small retail business at home. She sells home products, mainly to her friends and neighbors.
Amani started this business in order to help and contribute to her family’s income. Now she want buy more products to increase her sales and that is why she has applied for this loan.
Since Amani is a conservative person, she asked her brother-in-law Mohammad to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to add more home products to her range.

loans.name: Gh Ayidote Minawanou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amis et qui habitent le même village. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Benoît est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Benoît est âgé de 56 ans et vit au Bénin. Benoît n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Benoît est marié à une marchande du nom de Adidja. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant en charge. Benoît vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Benoît exerce depuis quarante ans environs, la culture du maïs, du piment, de tomate et de gombo qu’il vend dans un marché du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Benoît fait la pêche. Benoît exerce ses activités dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Benoît sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Gh Ayidote Minawanou group consists of four people who are friends and live in the same village. This is the fifth time that the group has sought financial support from ALIDé, to raise the level of its business activities. The representative of the group, named Benoît, is the one with the raised hand in the picture.

Benoît is 56 years old and lives in Benin. He did not attend school. Benoît is married to a retail merchant named Adidja. The couple has six children, all in school and who are their dependents. In addition to their children, the couple has another child to support. Benoît lives together with his wife and children.

To ensure the various family expenses, Benoît has been growing crops for the past forty years: corn, peppers, tomatoes and okra that he sells in a market in Benin. Secondarily, he is also a fisherman. Benoît runs his business activities in the surrounding region.

Seeking to satisfy customers and increase his turnover and income, Benoît is requesting, together with other members of the Gh Ayidote Minawanou group, a fifth credit loan from ALIDé. The first four loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy vegetable products to grow crops (pepper, tomato and corn).

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra, de 22 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, así como amable y alegre, es conviviente con Santos quien es empleado, vive en compañía de su padre, madre, dos hermanos, su pareja y sus dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad, instalados cómodamente  en la casa de sus padres. Mayra se dedica a la venta de comida como menú al medio día y por las noches vende comida rápida como pollos broaster y salchipapas en el frontis de la casa de sus padres, adicional a eso también vende refrescos a pedidos que entrega a los trabajadores de un aserradero que está ubicado muy cerca de donde vive, y también vende plátanos en una mesa en la casa de sus padres. Tiene más 02 años realizando esta actividad, y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano para atender a sus clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar, y viendo que la zona es una calle transitado tiene una regular demanda y clientela. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas, así como la compra de plátanos a precio por mayor.
texts.en:
Mayra, 22, is hardworking and knows what she wants; she is also friendly and happy. Her live-in partner Santos is employed, and they live comfortably in her parents' home with her father, mother, 2 siblings and her two children, ages 8 and 2. 

Mayra sells daily specials at lunch time and at night she sells fast food like rotisserie chicken and salchipapas [sausages with french fries] in front of her parents' house. She also sells sodas that she delivers to the workers in a sawmill not far from where she lives, and she sells plantains on a table in her parents' house. She has been doing this for more than two years and her brother helps her attend to her customers. She likes her business because it allows her to earn money to assist her partner with their household expenses. Her street is well-traveled and so she has regular demand and clientele. 

This will be her first loan with MFP, so she hopes for a small loan that will help her meet her objectives. With the 800 nuevos soles that she requested, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make meals, as well as buying plantains at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing meals, as well as plantains.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 53-year-old married man, the father of six children. He has worked as a car mechanic for 35 years.  This long experience gave him customers' trust and support. He opened his current garage in 1997, and it is well known in the region.

Ali works hard for his family's happiness, he sacrifices his life for theirs. To provide his children with the best education, Ali requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for their school fees.

This is Ali's second experience with Al Majmoua, and his previous one was very impressive, it reflected positively on both his social and financial situations. 

Ali is looking forward to improving and updating his business as much as he can in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 31-year-old single lady from Aqaba, Jordan.

Fadwa is a tailor with a home-based business and she is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase materials needed in dress-making for trading purposes.

An aspiration of Fadwa is to open a shop for her products so that she can increase her customer base and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in dress-making for trading purposes.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en: Amer, 30 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. She has operated a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Amer is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is a small scale food vender who sells cooked rice and vegetable stew in Npatado (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education as she is a primary graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason.

Christiana has been working as a food vender for close to ten years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of rice and vegetables, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a food stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of rice and vegetables, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of seven group leader farmers in Lugari District with Judith selected as the Kiva representative. Judith has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right side of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 80 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Judith is married and has five children. She is 37 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, and an experienced farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the prayer group and the burial committee.  Judith has been a farmer for 16 years.  She described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  		

Judith joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Judith joined One Acre Fund so that she could get new farming methods, fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  Because she wants to help more farmers, Judith has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Judith's life because she has more farm training and was able to save money.  In the future, Judith hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school and save for the future.  							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Judith and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.			

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 50 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Anita has a general store business in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Anita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
This young man is a well known joiner in Sumgait city. Rasim has been working in the joiner\'s shop since 2005. He married, has 2 children. This 30-year-old Rasim is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli. He is hard worker. 
He would like to borrow a loan amount of $1200 from Normicro because he wants to buy 1 planer and additional board materials.

loans.use: To buy  1 planer and board materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a very hard-working woman. She lives in Sabinas Hidalgo in the State of Nuevo León. She is a single mother and has a lovely 3 year-old daughter.
