With the loan, she will buy embroidery material such as beads, colored thread, clothes and sketches in bulk for her business.  

She lives with her husband and 2 daughters in Multan which is a historic city of Pakistan. She owns a two room house there in the area of Samejabad. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his clients and to school children. Her daughters are both enrolled in school and are getting their education. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Nazia”.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Om

texts.en:
Om S., 31, is married to Rim, 33, and they are in the photo with their lovely kid. She has two small kids who live under her care. 

Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house. Palm-tree-climbing jobs are very common for poor people who live in the commune. 

Om S. has a plot of farming land. She and her husband currently generate an income of approximately $5 per day. 

Om S. is looking for a loan to buy a few ladders to help her husband to climb the palm trees, and to buy a few small pigs to feed for selling.

loans.use: To buy a few ladders to help her husband climb the palm trees, and to buy a few small pigs to feed for selling.

loans.name: Maristela

texts.es: La Sra. Maristela, vive en la localidad de Sacaba, es muy conocida por su tienda de Barrio ya que es muy conocida por la variedda d productos que ofrece y por la buena atencion de la Sra. ya que es una persona amable, el negocio lo atiende desde sus 20 años de edad  se encuentra en un lugar muy céntrico ,es soltera  vive en la casa de sus padres tiene 30 años, el préstamo lo destinara para aumentar capital para surtir una variedad de productos, como Arroz, fideo, azúcar aceite y variedad de dulces, es una persona joven muy trabajadora su deseo es el poder comprarse una casita e independizarse, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Maristela lives in the town of Sacaba. She's very well known for her neighborhood store, which provides a variety of products and good customer service. Maristela is a nice person. She has run the store since she was 20-years-old, and it's very centrally located. She's single, 30-years-old, and she lives in her parents house. She will use the loan to expand her capital and stock up her store with various products, such as rice, noodles, sugar, oil, and sweets. She's young and hardworking; her goal is to be able to buy a small house and live independently. She would like to thank the institution for the support it has provided her.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, noodles, sugar, oil, and a variety of sweets

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun M. is a 41-year-old who has been in the farming business for many years. Besides doing farming, she is good at making baskets at home to sell for extra income. She is a married mother of two children who are students in the local public school. She has a partner in her husband who helps her to plant crops as well as being a firewood seller, in and around Kompong Chhnang province. 

Moeun M. and all their family members still live in an old house that is frequently broken and their living conditions have been affected. To solve this problem, Moeun M. will take her loan to purchase wooden poles to build a new house. Moeun M. and her young child appear in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase wooden poles to build a new house.

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut S. and all members of the group, Satya Laksana, got a third loan from MUK. The group still wants to join MUK until they can support their own capital for their pig businesses. Ni Ketut S. is a tenacious housewife. Even though she is now 63 years old, she still keeps the spirit to be a hardworking woman. Ni Ketut S. maintains two sows. A new one was purchased after getting the loan, at a price of Rp. 1,300,000, Ni Ketut S. and her husband hope to get more benefits after taking care of the sow. Every day she spends Rp. 10,000 for the kitchen and Rp. 200,000 for electricity and water.

loans.use: To buy a sow

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa owns & operates a business venture selling dairy products in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Epenesa needs a loan of WST 1400 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Epenesa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Epenesa's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Jane Wangui

texts.en:
Jane has been practising farming in Njabini town for the last three years.  She is 33 years old, married to Bernard K., and they have one child.

Jane was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers.  This will be her second loan. She had repaid her previous loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use this new loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Jane hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with no children. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her young siblings. For the past four years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from a shop and also from her home to her neighbours. 

Juliet faces a major challenge in competition from other boutique operators in her area. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase cloth and thread. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and thread.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Salamatu .  She is unmarried and has no children.   She has four other dependents, some of them help her with her business and the others go to school.  In 2009, Salamatu established her local food restaurant business. She began her business because she dropped out of school and found business as a means of livelihood. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy more food. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Salamatu plans to build a house.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more local foods for her business.

loans.name: Piri

texts.en: Piri is 20 years old and is a single man. His family is an Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) from the Nagorno-Kharabkh. They now live in the small settlement in Bilasuvar, which was built for IDP families. Piri got his start as a farmer in his parents' fields when he was 16. He is hardworking man and now he has four cows in his farm. He plans to expand his cattle-breeding business buying two more cows and balanced feed. He requested a loan of 1200 AZN for the first time from AqroInvest and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy two cows and feed.

loans.name: Xuan Tuan

texts.en:
Tuan, a 42-year-old single man, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He has a cleaning business that cleans vehicles. 

Tuan requires a loan to purchase better equipment that will enable him to provide better services for his customers. He hopes that better equipment will permit him to work more efficiently and to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase better equipment to clean vehicles

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Mely has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Mely is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mely hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 52 years old and married with 4 children. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her store.

Elena has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, soap, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Linlingnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement LINLINGNON est composé de trente membres qui vivent tous dans la même localité et qui mènent certaines activités ensemble. La présidente de ce groupement du nom de Étiennette, est celle qui a une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Étiennette est une veuve ayant quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un n'est plus à sa charge. Étiennette vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Étiennette n’a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Étiennette mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d'année, la production d'huile de palme et de farine de manioc, qu'elle vend dans sa région. Étiennette s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter sa production et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, Étiennette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement LINLINGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira ainsi à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The group LINLINGNON is made up of thirty members who all live in the same locality and do certain activities together. The president of this group, called Étiennette, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. In order to raise the level of their businesses so that they can better respond to the demand of their clientele. this group is requesting their first-ever loan from ALIDé. 

Étiennette is a widow with four children, all enrolled in school. One of them is no longer her responsibility. She lives alone with her children and covers their living expenses. 

Étiennette only went to primary school. To support herself and her children, she has been producing palm oil and manioc flour for about 15 years now. She sells her products in her region. She buys her supplies in Bénin. 

In order to increase her production and better respond to the needs of her ever-growing client base, Étiennette is requesting, together with the other members of the group LINLINGNON, her first loan from ALIDé. This loan will help them to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy palm fruit and manioc.

loans.name: Jade Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Jade esta conformado por las señoras Maria Guadalupe y Lourdes van a comprar con su prestamo harina,azucar, pintura, bolsas, aceite, lija, cinta canela para elaboracion de obleas, el señor Virgilio va a comprar harina, azucar, manteca y leña para la ellaboracion de pan, las señoras Carina y Ofelia van a comprar obleas por paquete para recortarlas, empaquetarlas y venderlas. La señora Maria Guadalupe tiene 38 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 4 hijos tres mujeres y un hombre, todos sus hijos estan estudiando, su hija mayor en bachilleres, dos en la secundaria y su niña mas pequeña en la primaria, ella elabora y vende obleas, ella solicito su credito para comprar harina, pintura, aceite, azucar, bolsas para tener todo lo necesario para su negocio, ella inicio su negocio hace 6 años, sus hijos estaban pequeños y habia carencias economicas, entonces su prima le enseño a preparar la mezcla para elaborar las obleas, su esposo le compra las maquinas de obleas y la materia prima con un dinero que tenia ahorrado, asi comenzo el negocio de obleas, a ella le gusta trabajar y ayudarle a sus esposo y tener dinero para vivir mejor, su negocio es importante porque tiene su porpio trabajo, tiene ingresos y le puede dar trabajo a otras personas en la elaboracion de obleas, ella se siente orgullosa de su negocio le ayuda a comprar algunos articulos para el hogar como su lavadora, la grabadora, sus sueños y esperanzas son que Dios le de vida y pueda construir una bodega especial para trabajar, comprar un carro para ir a vender las obleas, hacer creser su negocio, que sus hijos sigan estudiando y tengan su carrera y tengan un buen trabajo de gobierno. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad "muchas gracias por pensar en las personas que tienen negocio y tenemos la necesidad de estos prestamos para seguir trabajando en nuestros negocios".
texts.en:
This group is called “Jade” and is composed of María Guadalupe and Lourdes.  They are going to use their loan to buy flour, sugar, food coloring, bags, oil, ribbons, tape and cinnamon to make wafers.  Virgilio is going to buy flour, sugar, shortening and firewood to bake bread.  Carina and Ofelia are going to buy wafers by the package to repackage in smaller amounts and sell.  

María Guadalupe is 38 years old, married and has four children: three girls and one boy.  All her children are in school.  Her oldest daughter is in high school, the next two are in middle school and her youngest daughter is in elementary school.

She makes ‘obleas’ (sweet made from two thin wafers stuffed with caramel) and requested the loan to buy flour, food coloring, oil, sugar and bags to have everything necessary for her business.  She started the business six years ago.  Her children were small and she had economic needs so her cousin taught her how to prepare the dough for the wafers.  Her husband bought her the machines to make them and she used savings she had to buy the raw materials.  This is how the obleas business started.  

She likes to work to help her husband and to have money to live better.  Her business is important because she has her own job, earn income and can employ others manufacturing obleas.  She is proud of her business.  It helps her buy some items for the home like her washing machine and the tape recorder.  Her dreams and hopes are that God grants her life so that she can manage to build a warehouse to work in, to buy a car to sell the obleas, to help her business to grow and that her children stay in school and attain careers and good jobs with the government.

The group members would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad:  “many thanks for thinking about people who have businesses and need these loans to continue working in our businesses.”

loans.use: To buy flour, food coloring, oil, sugar and bags to make wafers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old and is married with two children. She sells clothes to earn a living. Mary has managed to expand her business with financial support from Faulu Kenya.  She has also been trained on how to manage her business through seminars conducted by Faulu Kenya.

Mary is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell. In the future, she dreams of owning a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Norma Petronila

texts.es:
Doña petronila tiene la edad de 50 años, de profesion docente de primaria, casada, su esposo labora como fotografo profesional, madre de tres hijos, el mayor trabaja.
Como objetivo ha sido la mejora  a su casa, que junto a su esposo han construido, y que se han esforzado mucho para hacer posible un techo para sus hijos, hoy en dia doña Petronila fue asendida  a directora del centro escolar, por su buena conducta, por su buen su trabajo, el cual esta sastifecha.
Lo que quiere hacer es un muro perimetral, y quedar dividido con el vecino sus tierras, ya que solo una parte tiene cerrada y la otra parte no, es por eso necesita comenzar el muro, el cual dara seguridad a su propiedad, el cual busca financiamiento en Afodenic, en donde comprara materiales de construccion en arena, bloques, cemento, hierro, piedrin, para comenzar su obra.
texts.en:
Doña Petronila is 50 years old.  She is a primary school teacher by profession, and her husband works as a professional photographer.  She is the mother of three children, the oldest of whom works.

Her objective has been to improve her house, which she built with her husband.  They have worked hard to put a roof over their children's heads.  

Currently Doña Petronila has been promoted to be Director of an educational center, as a result of her good conduct and good work, which she is satisfied about.

What she wants to do is build a perimeter wall to keep her land separate from her neighbor, as only a part is closed off and the other part is not.  This is why she needs to start the wall, which will provide her property with security.  She is looking for financing for Afodenic for this, so she can buy construction materials of sand, cinderblocks, iron and gravel so she can start her work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to start building a perimeter wall to secure her property.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is one of our individual loan borrowers. She operates an underwear sales business. She buys underwear wholesale and sells it to different sellers. Alicia’s family consists of her four children and husband, but her children are already grown, so they are not living together with their parents. She said that her most difficult challenge is to keep improving her business, the economy is really not stable. She loves to work and especially to sell goods.

Alicia started her business after she had the option to start a business or stay alone all day at home. She started selling underwear directly to clients, now she sells to sellers. She took her first loan with Esperanza and started her business. After seven years and 13 loans, Alicia is now running an underwear wholesale business.

With her profits, she is planning to reinvest in her business, buy anything she needs at home and to support her children if they need anything (by saving money for the moment any of her child requests help). She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 30 year old young woman. She is married and has two sons, her husband is a branch manager in a Palestinian association with a decent salary. 

Alaa' wants to start a new project of her own to increase the family income and assist her husband in paying for their life expenses. She wants to open a beauty salon and wants to purchase a new beauty salon kit such as: chairs, mirrors, hair creams, different types of hair brushes, etc. Alaa' has an amount of money which is not enough to pay for these supplies. She needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN. When Alaa' gets the loan which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase all of the supplies needed to start her beauty salon. This will enable Alaa' to start her project and increase her income to have better life conditions. Alaa' is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a beauty salon kit.

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en: Munhbayar is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia.  His one daughter is a student in elementary school and the other one stays at home with her mother.  He started his taxi service in 2004 with his car.  Now he wants to buy a truck for 6,000,000 MNT.  In order to buy a truck he'll sell his car.  He'll also sell 2000 seabuckthorn trees which he planted himself, for 2,000 MNT each.  He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "Now that the mining business is booming in Mongolia there's high demand for trucks.  With the income I want to build my own house."  He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new truck for his taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a new truck.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Erlinda has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to stock more canned goods, snacks and beverages .
Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a single mother with one school going child.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanalima has operated a retail shop for the past 7 years; her clients are local villagers. She faces a major challenge of transportation.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan Mwanalima wants to purchase rice, maize flour and soap for her shop.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, maize flour and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Neh Isabella

texts.en:
Neh Isabella is single and has four children, all over the age of 15. She lives in a five-bedroom apartment with her children at Ntamulung, Mezam in the  Northwest region of Cameroon. The death of her brother and mother are the major challenges she has faced in her life. Poverty and the unemployment problem facing her children also continue to make her unhappy.

Neh Isabella joined GHAPE in 2006 and has taken and repaid Empowerment Credit loans several times. She used the profit from her past loans to feed, clothe, provide medication for, and educate her children. Given a loan, she intends to invest it in poultry farming. She believes that this business will be a success because she has many years of experience farming poultry and also because there is high demand for poultry products. Neh Isabella thinks that this activity will help her community in that it will provide manure to farmers in her locality, it will provide employment, and also because it will increase the supply of chicken in the market, which will improve people’s eating habits.

With the proceeds from her loan, she will provide for her children and also increase her capital. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the easy method of repayment, low interest rates, and also because of the regular education and training GHAPE provides to its members.

loans.use: to purchase fowl, buy feed, and pay laborers.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 34-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents, two siblings who are still attending school and four others working. With his siblings’ backing, he finds it much easier responding to his family needs and demands. He decided to start his own business as a constructor in 2006, after being involved in this domain for the previous ten years. 

Ahmad is working really hard to serve his customers as quickly as he can. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added materials for his business. This loan will facilitate his business operations. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects, outside and inside the country.

loans.use: to purchase added materials for his business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a 54-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She earns a living making and selling "bahalina" (coconut wine). She earns about 4,000 PHP from her business. Catalina works hard to support her family and send her children to school.
Catalina has requested this loan to purchase containers and other materials. She hopes that her children can finish college and that her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase containers and other materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 48 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 11 and 32. All of her children are presently in high school and college. For the past ten years, she has been selling used clothes in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Educating her children and building a house for them are in her plans for the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy another printer and bond paper.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia, 51, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Armando, a contractor and father to her children. Delia, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Delia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to residents of the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a packet of shampoo, a few pesos' worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting her inventory at wholesale prices and then retailing them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products she sells in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Delia hopes her business will grow into a mini-grocery. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to sell.

loans.name: Cristine Joy

texts.en: Cristine Joy is from the village of Zone II. She is 28 years old. Cristine Joy is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Cristine Joy owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cristine Joy has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately P 15,000 a month for these activities. Cristine Joy engage in grocery to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristine Joy requesting a loan of P 50,000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional products like drinks, snack foods and coffee for her store

loans.name: Belive In God Group

texts.en:
John is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. John was born in Makeni city, 50 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has four  children who are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For many years now, John has been selling used clothes. With the help of this loan, John is going to buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock of clothes.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock of clothes

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a native from the town of Pilar. She is 53-year-old married woman and has two grown children.  , 
She raises and sold hogs.  In addition to that, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities like  noodles,cooking oil, sugar, eggs, tooth paste shampoo and soap.

She would like to raise quality hogs and filled the inventories that is out of stock. But as of this time, Loreta has very limited amount of funds to make it so.Therefore she join CEVI to avail loans and would like to invest in feed and groceries for the store like assorted canned goods, beverages and soft drinks.
Slowly, she will be able to pay her obligation and handle her finances wisely. She would like to set aside half of the profit for future use and use the other half for the expansion of her both sources of income.

loans.use: to invest in feed and groceries for the store like assorted canned goods, beverages and soft drinks

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Mister Miguel has had his business in fruit sales for 15 years, he is married and has one child that is currently studying his university career. He decided to work on this business because the salary he earned while he worked for a company was not enough to cover his son\'s studies. On the other hand he had always liked sales, and he usually visited the local markets to sell. He requies a loan in the amount of $925 which will be used for the purchase of merchandise and to be able to expand his small business.

He has struggled a great deal to be able to provide his son a better education with the hopes of giving him a better future and patrimony. You can help Miguel in the realization of his goals. Make your decision and support him.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Miguel tiene con su negocio de venta de frutas una antigüedad de 15 años, es casado y tiene un hijo que se encuentra estudiando una carrera universitaria. El decidió dedicarse a esta actividad porque son el sueldo que ganaba como empleado de la empresa para la que trabajaba no le alcanza para poder costear los estudios de su hijo. Por otra parte a el siempre le han gustado las ventas, actualmente realiza su actividad en mercados rodantes. El requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 DLLS , mismo que utilizará para la compra de mercancía y poder hace crecer como microempresario. El ha luchado mucho para poder brindarle a su hijo la mejor educación con el objetivo que el tenga un mejor futuro y patrimonio que el que hoy por hoy puede brindarle. Tú puedes ayudar a Miguel para el logro de sus objetivos, decídete y apóyalo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar is a responsible man. He is single and lives in Yenikand village of the Salyan region. 
He has a plot of land on which he grows vines and strawberries. 
He needs a loan of $500 to buy fertilizer and expand his plot of land.
He has 3 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and expand his plot of land
